loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Mohammad has been working as a car repairer since 2000. He is a car mechanic and he sells spare parts. Mohammad requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and merchandise for his garage. This is the first time that Mohammad has requested a loan.

Mohammad is trustworthy and he does good work. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties because he took his father’s business, and his father already had built a network of clients. Mohammad decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his family's income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and finish purchasing all the required equipment for his garage.

loans.use: To purchase tools and merchandise for his garage

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is a 48-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Houssein owns a bakery. He does “saj,” “mankoucheh,” and “knefeh." The “saj” is the metal oven where you do the saj bread and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (thinned) bread and doughy confections or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza with the most common toppings being zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Knefeh is a traditional breakfast Lebanese sweet; it is a special kind of braided cheese that is served with liquid sugar in rounded bread. It is also served as a dessert, but somehow it tastes better in the morning also. In America and in Europe, knefeh is known as a gourmet dish that will surpass in popularity the cheesecake and the pancake. Houssein requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a refrigerator for his sweets and the sodas and to purchase additional raw materials. This is the first time that Houssein has requested a loan.

Houssein is known for his good mankoucheh and his knefeh. His clients can be anybody from his region. Houssein worked in a restaurant before he opened his bakery, but he left the restaurant because he wasn’t earning enough and needed to increase his income. That is why he decided to start his own business. In the future, he plans on expanding and improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and additional raw materials.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco se dedica a la confección y venta de chalecos, faldas los cuales vende en el altiplano, en estas fechas es cuando tiene mas demanda para estas prendas, vive en casa propia su esposa falleció tienes cuatro hijos los cuales ya son independientes su casa queda ubicada en la Calle Ayacucho, zona Puerto Camacho de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra tela por cantidad hilo encajes que necesita para la confección de las prendas. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Francisco makes and sells sweaters and skirts, which he sells in the Bolivian Altiplano. Demand for these garments is highest at this time of year. He lives in his own house. His wife passed away and he has four children who are already independent. His house is on Calle Ayacucho in zona Puerto Camacho in the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to buy the thread and fabric that he needs to produce garments.

It is his first loan from Impro; the results from his evaluation qualified him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Elva Francisca

texts.es:
Elva se dedica a la compra y venta D. juguetes además elabora sorpresas  D. globos los cuales compra por cantidad y los venD. a las tiendas, su esposo es jubilado D. la empresa Hoy, tienen dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes su casa propia esta ubicado en la mzno. “E” patio 1 Zona Rió Seco D. la ciudad D. El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. globos juguetes en cantidad por que con eso elabora las sorpresas y con eso mantiene a su familia.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Elva buys and sells toys and also makes surprise balloons, which are bought in bulk and sold to stores. Her husband is retired. Now, they have two children who are independent. Their home is located in Zona Rió Seco in the city of El Alto. With this loan, she will buy balloons and toys in bulk to make surprises and support her family. This is her first loan from Impro; she was qualified for credit by an evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys and balloons

loans.name: Emerson Beymar

texts.es:
Emerson trabajaba en un Hotel de cocinero pero fue retirado por que se encuentra mal de la vista ahora consiguió un local donde prepara y vende comida y así cubre sus gastos de alimentación y manutención de su familia, vive con su esposa y tiene un hijo actualmente se encuentra viviendo en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la calle Exaltación, zona Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, refresco por cantidad para poder producir los alimentos en su pensión.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Emerson used to work as a cook in a hotel, but left because of vision problems. He now has a place where he prepares and sells food, which is how he supports his family. He lives with his wife and son in his parents' house, located in Zona Exaltación in the city of El Alto. With this loan he will buy rice, sugar, oil and beverages in bulk to produce his dishes. An evaluation qualified him for this, his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 28-year-old engaged man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon. Mahmoud has owns a computer and mobile phone shop. He repairs and sells computers and mobile phones, as well as their accessories. He requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for his shop and computer spare parts. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is good at his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Mahmoud decided on doing this business because of his experience in the business, as well as he likes working with phones and especially with computers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and computer spare parts

loans.name: Abed

texts.en:
Abed, 54, lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife. Abed has owned an accessory shop since 2001. He sells gifts. Abed requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Abed has requested a loan.

Abed has a big selection in his shop. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and tourists. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing merchandise for his shop as well as diversifying his stock. In the future, Abed plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco tiene un punto de llamadas y de juegos en red, es soltero.
Su trabajo le ayuda a poder solventarse los gastos de alimentación y otros ya que es independiente.
Vive en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital de Inversión ( reparación y mantenimiento de tres computadoras)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de accede a este crédito.
texts.en:
Marco owns a phone and internet gaming center, and is single. His work allows him to cover food and other costs, as he is independent. He lives in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz in his parents' house. The loan will be invested in capital (repair and maintenance of three computers). This is his first loan from Impro. His drive to overcome gave him the opportunity to access this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Ali has been working as a mason since 2002. Ali has requested a loan of $1,200 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase material and tools for his work, like sand for the cement and bricks. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he does it well and is punctual. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his work, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the necessary tools for his work. Ali decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on working on bigger projects.

loans.use: To purchase sand and bricks

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en:
Abdo is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Abdo has been working as a florist for two years. He requests a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase flowers for his business. This is the first time that Abdo has requested a loan.

Abdo is special in his work because he does nice flower arrangements and he is good at his work. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. Abdo decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase flowers

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 26-year-old woman who lives in Bekaa with her husband and their two children. Batoul has owned a clothing shop for a year.

She has requested a loan of $700 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase a computer for her shop. This is the first time that Batoul has requested a loan.

Batoul's clients are people from her region. She decided on doing her business because of her experience in the business.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa comercializa calzados para varones tiene su puesto ubicado en la Zona 12 D. Octubre, el esposo es transportista inter provincial dentro el departamento D. La Paz, es su principal fuente D. ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención D. sus dos hijos que están estudiando en la universidad publica tiene casa propia viven en la casa D. sus padres ubicado en la zona Loreto D. la Ciudad D. El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. mercadería D. esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad D. demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento D. pago permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Rosa sells men's shoes from her post in Zona 12 D. Octubre. Her husband works as an inter-provincial transporter in La Paz, which is their main source of income for supporting their two children studying at the public university. They live in her parents' house, located in the Loreto area of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to meet the market demand. This is her fourth loan from Impro. Her good repayment history allowed the approval of her loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi M., 30, is single with four children. She has four years of experience in producing and selling Samoan handicrafts and souvenirs. She sells to the Fugalei market customers five days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).

SPBD loans are Naomi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. To improve her business and also her home, and to support her kids' school fees, she really needs this future financial support so that her family will improve their way of living.

loans.use: Purchase tools to use for her crafts

loans.name: Chhade

texts.en:
Chhade is a 44-year-old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their nine children. Chhade has been working as a farmer for six years. He plants cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbages and other vegetables.

He requests a loan of $1,000 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Chhade has requested a loan.

Chhade's clients are the merchants from his region. He decided on doing this business because of his experience in agriculture.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Fredy Modesto

texts.es:
Freddy  vive en la C. “Corpa”    de la zona anexo 25 de Julio en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa  y  sus  tres hijos en su casa propia.

Trabaja como albañil en diferentes construcciones donde requieren mano de obra, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar y cuidado de sus hijos (todos se encuentran en edad escolar).
 

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de lentes de aumento para una de sus hijas, pues requiere con suma urgencia para poder estudiar. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Freddy lives on Corpa street in the area next to "25 de Julio" in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their three children in their own home. He works as a builder for different construction jobs, which requires manual labor. His wife is dedicated to household chores and caring for their children (all of them are school-age).

The loan will be used to get reading glasses for one of his daughters. She needs them urgently so that she may study. It is his first loan with Impro; the evaulation that he completed qualified him to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Glasses for his daughter

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai T., 19, is married with one child. She sells banana and taro and her husband does the planting and looks after the plantation. She sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $83). SPBD loans are Salafai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Salafai wants to focus on her business because she believes it will help immensely in the uplifting of their living standards.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, chemicals and equipment

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa F., 44, is married and has five children. For three years, she has been selling B.B.Q on the road. She also delivers it to town offices and businesses. She sells to the village people and general public three days a week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $104 USD). SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Luisa wants use this loan to improve her business, to make improvements to her home, and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy food for her B.B.Q business

loans.name: Eka

texts.en: Eka F., 29, is married and has four children. She has just started planting, harvesting, and selling bananas and taro. She sells to the village people and general public three days a week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145 USD).  SPBD loans are Eka’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Eka is motivated to improve her buisness so that she pay for her children's school fees and improve her family's way of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, chemicals, and equipment

loans.name: Lemapu

texts.en: Lemapu F., 31, is single and has one child. She has just started planting, harvesting, and  selling bananas and taro. She sells to the village people and general public three days a week. This is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $104 USD). SPBD loans are Lemapu’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Lemapu is focusing on improving her business so that she can better the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, chemicals, and equipment for the business

loans.name: Nidia Patricia

texts.es:
Actualmente en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Nimia P. se dedica a su actividad de venta de verduras la cual posee en su propio tramo el cual diariamente se esfuerza para brindar las mejores condiciones a sus clientes.

Es importante destacar que actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las verduras como son los plátanos y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Currently in the Market La Terminal in the city of León, Nimia P. dedicates herself to the sale of vegetables in her own stall where she strives daily to offer the best conditions to her customers. It is important to emphasize that she has currently turned to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan to purchase vegetables, such as plantains, to able to continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Ato

texts.en: Ato A., 31, is married and has three children. She has one year of experience in planting, harvesting, and  selling bananas and taro. She sells to the Fugalei market and to the general public three days a week. This is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $104 USD). SPBD loans are Ato’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She wants to improve her business so that she can raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, chemicals, and planting equipment

loans.name: Martha Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Martha S. se dedica en el Mercado la Terminal de León a su negocio de venta de ropa y bolsos desde hace 10 largos años habiéndose destacado como una muy buena comerciante por lograr mantener su núcleo familiar y brindar excelente atención a sus clientes.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería debido a que la requiere en estos momentos y por esto espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Martha S. sells clothing and bags in the Terminal de León Market. For ten years she has stood out as a good businesswoman in order to support her immediate family and provide excellent service to her customers. Nowadays she has turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan in order to buy merchandise that she currently needs. She confidently hopes that her loan will be granted.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Alaimalo

texts.en: Alaimalo F., 58, is married and has eight children. She has four years of experience planting, harvesting, and selling bananas and taro. She sells to the people of the village and in Fugalei market three days a week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala ( about $104 USD). SPBD loans are Alaimalo’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Alaimalo will use this money to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Olivia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa P. es una fiel cliente de Ceprodel que ha logrado mantener su pulpería gracias a todos los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel y por los cuales ella busca la manera de continuar realizando para surtir su negocio.

A pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado ha logrado salir de ellas y hoy en día la necesidad que atraviesa es la pronta adquisición del recurso económico para obtener su mercadería y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa P. is a faithful client of Ceprodel who has been able to maintain her grocery store thanks to all of the loans that Ceprodel has given her. Through these loans she hopes to continue supplying her business. Despite the difficult economic situations that she has faced, she has been able to get through them. Today, she needs to quickly acquire economic resources to purchase merchandise, thus getting ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Tamate

texts.en:
Tamate L., 19, is married with one child. She just started selling bananas and taro and also plants and harvests them. She sells to the Fugalei market and general public five days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $104). SPBD loans are Tamate’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. This loan will be used to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, chemicals, insect killer and to replace some planting equipment

loans.name: Selena

texts.en:
Selena P., 48, is married with one child. She has four years of experience in the plantation and fishing businesses. She sells to the village people and general public two days per week. She has had five previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 380 Tala (about $158). SPBD loans are Selena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Some part of the loan will be used to pay her child's school fees and to buy equipment needed for repairing her house.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and equipment needed for her plantation business

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Luisa P. se dedica a laborar en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde a diario lleva a cabo su actividad de venta de chinelas de diferentes estilos y para todas las edades.

Se ha destacado por vender bonitos modelos de chinelas y por este motive es muy visitada por sus clientes que a diario la visitan. Ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de dichas chinelas y por esto su anhelo es que su solicitud sea aprobada y así seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa P. works in the La Terminal Market in the city of León. Every day she works selling sandals and slippers in different styles, for people of all ages. She has distinguished herself by selling attractive styles, which is why she is sought out by her clients. She has requested support from Ceprodel to help purchase the sandals and slippers and hopes that her application will be approved so that she can progress with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Sarona

texts.en:
Sarona A., 34, is married with five children. She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public two days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 230 Tala (about $95). SPBD loans are Sarona’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and equipment needed for her plantation business

loans.name: Faanofo

texts.en:
Faanofo L., 26, is married with three children. She has just started in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (about $100). SPBD loans are Faanofo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and equipment

loans.name: Finao

texts.en:
Finao M., 47, is married with three children. She has four years of experience in planting and selling vegetables. She sells to village people and the general public three days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145). SPBD loans are Finao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Most of this money will be used to improve her business and part will be used for her children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for vegetables, fertilizer, insect-killer liquid, cromozone, chemicals and equipment for planting

loans.name: Galu

texts.en:
Galu N., 36, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the bingo business. She sells to the villagers and the public two days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208). SPBD loans are Galu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of the loan will be used to maintain business needs.

loans.use: Purchase bingo supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria L., 73, is married with three children. She has two years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the villagers and the public seven days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala ($150). SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She has working kids who help out with the family needs and back up the business.

loans.use: Restock the business

loans.name: Tenisia

texts.en:
Tenisia F., 63, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public two days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 220 Tala (about $91). SPBD loans are Tenisia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Some part of the loan will be used for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and equipment needed for running and maintaining the good growth of her plantation

loans.name: Alfredo Abraham

texts.es:
Maria Concepcion Loza Medina esposa del señor Abraham M. aparece en la foto ya que el señor se encontraba trabajando.
La tienda se llama “Miscelanea America” ya tiene 3 años operando.Abaraham M. es supervisor de una maquiladora, el es una persona muy emprendedora que con el transcurso del tiempo fue juntando dinero para ponerle este negocio a su esposa para obrtener mas ingresos.
El señor desea comprar mas mercancia para su tienda, ya que entre mas suirtida el cliente tiene articulos que busca y asi satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion Loza Medina, the wife of Abraham M., appears in the photo because her husband was working. The store is called "Miscelanea America" and has been in operation for 3 years. Abraham M. is a supervisor in a factory and is a very enterprising person who saved money over time in order to start this business for his wife, to bring in more income. He would like to buy more merchandise for the store, because if the store offers more varied products, the customers will find what they were looking for and thus be satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for general store

loans.name: Lima

texts.en:
Lima T., 64, is married and has 4 children. She has two years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the school, villagers and public three days per week. 

She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 tala (~$83 USD). SPBD loans are Lima’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the rest of the loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make pancakes and to purchase building materials for home improvement

loans.name: Solaua

texts.en: Solaua T., 57, is married and has five children. She has two years of experience selling ice blocks. She sells to the school and villagers seven days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~$62 USD). SPBD loans are Solaua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She has children who are working and help her financially.

loans.use: To buy supplies and materials for her business

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia O., age 58, is married and has seven children. She has two years of experience in farming. She sells to the villagers and public two days per week. She has has two previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (~$100 USD).  SPBD loans are Silia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of the loan will be use to fix their toilet to improve their living situation.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and equipment for her business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose Luis A. C. y su esposa son maestros desde hace muchos años pero el señor en sus ratos libres se dedica ala carpineteria oficio que lleva mas de 12 años. El hace trabajos como closets, bases de cama, cuadros o lo que el cliente le pida. Pero ahora el esta requiriendo un trompo moldeador para trabajo mas detallados. Jose quiere tener mas variedad en sus trabajos para tener mas ingresos y vender a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Jose Luiz A. C. and his wife have been teachers for many years. For twelve years, Jose has also worked in his spare time as a carpenter. He makes handicrafts such as closets, bed frames, picture frames, and other items that his customers request. But now he needs a lathe so that he can make more detailed items. Jose wants to have more variety in the handicrafts he makes so that he can sell them at a good price and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a lathe

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Soonalote

texts.en: Soonalote T., 25, is married and has one child. This is her first year in the farming business. She sells to the villagers and public two days per week. She has never had a loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 210 Tala (~$87 USD). SPBD loans are Soonalote’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and equipment for her business

loans.name: Solotua

texts.en: Solotua T., 29, is married and has four children. This is her first year in the handicrafts business. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 280 Tala (~$116 USD). SPBD loans are Solotua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from a traditional bank.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 48 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo en la casa que adquirieron después de su matrimonio. Hace 20 años logró abrir una tienda en su casa, actividad que le permitió crecer económicamente  y le sirvió de apoyo para los gastos del hogar, mas ahora está iniciando un nuevo negocio de venta de comida, alquiló un puesto a lado de su casa y todas las noches atiende a las personas salen a consumir después del arduo trabajo del día. Es así que después de atender todo el día su tienda sale a vender comida junto a su hija, quien la apoya en la atención de su local y juntas trabajan hasta la media noche, quedando exhaustas por su trabajo y con deseos de descansar, sabiendo que el próximo día tendrán el mismo ritmo o quizás mayor. Pero aun así siguen adelante, con la finalidad de lograr la meta de acondicionar los pisos de su casa, ya que desean  alquilar departamentos, pues lo consideran un negocio muy rentable por la zona donde habitan. Ella es cliente hace 5 años y este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, oportunidad que le ayudó a crecer como comerciante y como persona social. Julia invertirá 3700 en la compra de una congeladora, ya que por esta temporada (verano) es necesario ofrecer a sus clientes bebidas heladas que alivien su sed.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in the house that they bought after their wedding. For twenty years she has run a store in her house, which has allowed her to improve her economic situation and help cover her household expenses. But now she has started a new business selling food, renting out a stall next to her house. Every night she serves food to people coming to eat after a long day at work. So after working all day in her store she goes to sell this food with the help of her son. Together they work until midnight, exhausted by the work and wanting to sleep, knowing that the next day they will have to work at the same speed, or possibly faster. However, they continue on with the goal of being able to equip their house with air-conditioning, since they want to rent out apartments, which is considered a very profitable business in the area where they live. Julia has been a client for five years and this is her eighth loan with MFP. Loans help Julia to prosper as a shopkeeper and a member of society. Julia will use the loan to invest in the purchase of a freezer because in the summer it is necessary to offer cold drinks to her thirsty customers.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer for drinks

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es: Catherine es madre soltera, a sus 27 años viene velando por el bienestar de su pequeña hija de 4 años y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, con quienes vive, sigue adelante. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la costura, pero para mejorar su trabajo decidió estudiar un curso de Corte y Confección que la ayudó a mejorar, hace 3 años instaló un taller en un espacio que le dio su madre, quien vio el anhelo de Catherine  por progresar. Ahora todas las personas de su vecindario acuden a ella a cualquier momento para solicitar sus servicios, ya sea para arreglar prendas, confeccionar vestidos u otro tipo de vestimentas, pues el don que tiene la ayuda a realizar los trabajos eficientemente, ofreciendo a sus clientes un acabado de calidad. En el futuro desea alquilar o comprar un stand en el mercado de su localidad, pues hay mayor concurrencia  en las zonas comerciales y el pago por su servicio sería mayor, ya que en su domicilio cobra precios cómodos. Catherine tiene 5 años en MFP y está en su octavo préstamo, todo este tiempo viene desfrutando de la compañía de las sus compañeras de grupo en la institución, que son un gran apoyo para su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una máquina de coser que la ayude a agilizar su trabajo y entregar los pedidos en el tiempo indicado.
texts.en:
Catherine is a single mother. At age 27, she is responsible for the well-being of her little 4-year-old daughter. Thanks to the support of her parents, who she lives with, she is making it. At an early age she dedicated herself to sewing, but in order to improve her work she decide to take a dressmaking course, which helped her. Three years ago she set up shop in a space that her mother let her use, because she saw how much Catherine really wanted to get ahead. Now everyone in the neighborhood comes to her, asking her to repair clothing and make dresses or other articles. The gift that she has enables her to do the work efficiently, producing quality work for her customers. In the future she would like to rent or buy a stand in the local market, because there is more traffic in the commercial zones and the work would be better paid, since she charges low rates working from home. Catherine has belonged to CCFP for 5 years and is in her 8th loan. She always enjoys the company of the other group members, who are very supportive of her business. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy a sewing machine that will help her to work more quickly and finish her orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer de 58 años de edad, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y a su hija a quien apoya en el cuidado de su nieto. Ella está dedicada a la venta de productos medicinales y productos de belleza, actividad que inició desde que recibió el apoyo de su hija, quien la impulsó a la venta de estos productos y desde hace 6 años ha progresado, pues su simpatía la ayudo a incrementar su clientela, quienes mes a mes realizan sus pedidos a doña María quien las visita continuamente para estar en contacto y ofrecerles nuevos productos. Sin embargo, las horas de viaje y de caminata terminan agotándola, pero al mismo tiempo la animan, porque puede obtener gran cantidad de pedidos   que tendrá que presentar y llevarlos a sus clientes a sus respectivos domicilios. Este trabajo tiene buenas ventajas en lo económico, pues trata de aprovechar las ofertas por temporada y revender los productos a los precios habituales ganando así un porcentaje adicional, que ayudará a cubrir sus gastos de movilidad. También cuenta con una actividad adicional junto a su pareja, pues se  dedican al alquiler de sus carros, ella lo administra y controla. Con el paso del tiempo María desea incrementar la cantidad de autos, para así poder instalar una empresa de alquiler. Hace 5 años que viene trabajando con MFP y este es su octavo préstamo, hasta ahora sigue aprovechando la oportunidad que le brinda la Institución tanto en lo económico como en lo social. Esta vez, tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en ambos negocios, tanto para el incremento de cosméticos, como para completar el capital necesario para adquirir un auto y seguir aumentando sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 58-year-old lady who lives in her own house together with her husband and daughter, whom she helps to care for her grandson. She sells medicinal and beauty products, an activity that her daughter’s support inspired her to start 6 years ago. Her kindness has helped her to increase her number of customers, who month by month place their orders with Doña Maria who visits them continuously to maintain contact and offer them new products. However, the hours of travel and the long walk end up tiring her out, but at the same time this motivates her because she is able to get lots of orders that she must take to her customers’ houses. This work has good financial advantages, Maria is able to take advantage of seasonal offers and then sell on the products at their normal prices, so earning an additional percentage which helps her to cover her transport costs.

She also takes part in another activity together with her partner. They hire out cars and she administers and controls the operation. Over time, Maria would like to increase their number of cars until it is possible to start up a rental company. Maria has been working with MFP for 5 years and this is her eighth loan. Up until now she has continued to take advantage of the financial and social opportunities offered by the Institution. This time, she is thinking of investing the money she is asking for in both businesses, so that she can increase her cosmetics and finalise the capital needed to purchase a car and thus increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a car

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene un hijo con quienes reside en su casa propia. Ella es docente en una institución privada, pero para cubrir las gastos en su hogar inició hace 8 años un negocio de venta de zapatos, los cuales compra en el centro de Lima para venderlos en su distrito donde ofrece a sus vecinas y amigas, a quienes les deja a crédito diversos zapatos para que poco a poco le puedan pagar, siendo así un negocio rentable pues el costo es mayor al que puede dar al contado, ya que incluye el costo por la movilidad que hará para los cobros semanales. Sin embargo, es muy cansado tener que trabajar durante el día enseñando y salir por las tarde a distribuir sus pedidos de zapatos y a realizar sus cobranzas hasta muy noche. Por estos motivos desea alquilar un stand donde pueda atender su negocio en las tardes sin tener que caminar mucho por las calles y dedicarse a buscar nuevos modelos de zapatos que llamen la atención de las personas. Mónica es cliente de MFP desde hace cinco años y este es su octavo préstamo y espera seguir formando parte del grupo, pues encontró un verdadero equipo de trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá nuevos modelos de zapatos escolares para seguir aprovechando la temporada de inicio de clases.
texts.en:
Monica is 33 years old. She is married and has a son that she lives with in their own house. She is a teacher at a private school, but in order to cover all of her expenses, she began a shoe sales business 8 years ago. She buys the shoes in downtown Lima in order to sell them in her neighborhood to her neighbors and friends. She sells the shoes on credit, allowing her customers to pay for them little by little, which makes it a profitable business, as the final price is higher, because it includes the fees charged for making monthly payments.

However, she is very tired of having to teach during the day and then go out in the evenings to deliver shoe orders and collect her payments until late at night. For this reason, she would like to rent a stand where she can run her business in the afternoons without having to walk so much around the neighborhood, and can focus on looking for new shoe designs that will interest people. Monica has been an MFP client for 5 years and this is her 8th loan. She hopes to continue being part of the group, because she has found a true work team.

With the money she is requesting she will acquire new school shoe designs, in order to take advantage of the start of the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: El Buen Futuro 5 Group

texts.en:
Group 5 from the El Buen Futuro ("The Good Future") Bank of Hope is starting their 6th loan cycle with Esperanza International. They all agree that the loans they've been taking have been a great help to them to keep their businesses in good shape, and make sure that they always have merchandise available for their clients. These entrepreneurs have been able to successfully repay five loans and hope to use this next one in their business expansion projects. 

Antonia S. is the group representative. She has four children who are grown. The youngest is 18 years old. However, she still supports all her children with their education, which is something she describes as one of her biggest challenges. She's glad that she is able to help them build a better future for themselves through a good education. In the future, she would like to have a house of her own and her own clothing store. 

Antonia and her group mates are working hard on their businesses, but they still need the all support that we can give. On behalf of Esperanza International and this group of entrepreneurs, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: La Union En Progreso Iv Group

texts.en:
The members of this group, part of the La Union en Progreso (Union in Progress) Bank of Hope, are starting their 6th loan cycle with Esperanza International. This group is very excited to receive this new loan because it will help them to continue to expand their businesses. But they are also excited about how far they've come. To date, they have successfully repaid five loans. 

These small entrepreneurs are very grateful for the opportunity they've been given and the trust Esperanza International has showed in them. That is why they are very careful to conduct their business practices in the right way so that they can produce enough profit for themselves and their families and repay their loans on time.

Ocadia S. is the group representative. She is 35 years old and has five children, ages 18,16,13,7 and 5. She could not reach middle school, which is why she works very hard and makes sure her children have everything they need to go to school. She dreams of seeing them go to college one day and getting successful jobs. For herself, she dreams of having a house of her own and a deli where she can sell all kinds of meats and cold cuts. 

Please help these entrepreneurs who are on their way to achieving their dreams. On behalf of Esperanza International and the Union en Progreso Bank of Hope, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy meat products for sale on business

loans.name: Sokeang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokeang S. lives in the Pech En village in the Takeo province. She is a clothes seller in the local market. Since her business has a lot of consumers who need new fashions, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more new clothes to resell to her customers and earn more profits.

Mrs. Sokeang S. is a 43-year-old widow with a child who is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to resell

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Mrs. Ith K. lives in Pech En village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Keav Ry, are farmers who own a piece of land and cultivate rice for a living. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. Another is a construction worker. One is attending the local school, and the last is too young to work or study. Even though Mrs. Ith K.’s family members try to work hard, they still earn less than they need to support the family and are unable to afford a better house. Mrs. Ith K. needs a loan to add to her savings in order to buy building materials for a house. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: Buy building materials for a house

loans.name: Bron's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group of five borrowers. K. is 25 years old and is the mother of one young child. She is married to Sokhov, age 35, who runs a bicycle and motorbike repair service in front of his house. K. owns a general store where she sells cooked ingredients, kid's sweets, and plastic and tin containers to the whole community. 

Because her store is located in the middle of a busy street, K. can sell many products every day. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. To meet her family's demands, she has recently planned to increase her income based on her selling. Therefore, K. is taking a loan to buy more ingredients and more products for her store. The loan will benefit her business. 

There are four other members of the loan group. M., age 22, owns a small grocery store front of his house. He is looking a loan to buy more cooked ingredients for his store. N., age 47, owns a shop where she sells breakfast food. She is taking a loan to renovate her shop. P., age 29, is a motor taxi driver who is applying for a loan to buy a new motor because his old motor is broken very often. P., age 31, is a furniture maker who is looking for a loan to buy a electric machine for his home. 

Mr. M. and Mr. P. were not available when the photograph was taken so their wives appear in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients and more products for her store

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
P., age 46, is a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has five children. The two oldest work with her and the  three youngest attend school. She is married to Nat, age 40, who is a police officer who protects the community. 

P. has been selling clothes in front of the Takeo Temple since 1980. She is a responsible mother and a friendly seller and she has a lot of clients, including tourists and locals. Her shop is full of traditional and modern clothes. She wants to increase her income, so P. is taking a loan of $500 to buy more traditional clothes for her shop. The loan will help the family to attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more traditional clothes for her shop

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
S. is 49 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has three children, all of whom are single and under his care. He is married to Monika, age 31, who owns a beauty salon that serves the whole community. 

S. has been a high school teacher since 1980. He teaches from Monday through Saturday from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. and from 1:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. and earns an income of $ 6 per day. 

S. wants to help his wife to develop a larger beauty salon, so he is applying for a loan of $1200 to build up his wife's shop and to buy more beauty supplies for her salon. The loan will help the family to attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To expand his wife's shop and to buy more supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
Rodella A. is a 33-year-old married mother of three.  Her husband drives a delivery truck for a bakery.  One of their children is an infant, one is in preschool, and the third child is in elementary school.

Rodella used to run a "sari sari" shop, a small general store that sells a variety of goods to satisfy everyday needs, but she closed her shop during maternity.  Now that her children are old enough, she hopes to re-open her shop, so she has applied for a loan to buy inventory to re-stock her store.

Rodella aspires to have a successful business and make enough money to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase cigarettes, shampoo, detergent, oil, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, milk, diapers, napkins and candy for resale.

loans.name: Faalagilagi

texts.en:
Faalagilagi M., 39, is married with three children. She has five years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers two days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208). SPBD loans are Faalagilagi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Part of the loan will be used for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides, chemicals, weed eater, cement, timber and iron roofing

loans.name: Fuatai

texts.en: Fuatai I., 44, is married with two children.  She has five years of experience in the Sewing business. She sells to the general public and villagers seven days per week. She has five previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Fuatai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay her children’s school fees at the University. Fuatai is a very good tailor who wants to make sure that she provides the best service and highest quality to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and sewing tools like threads, needles, pins and scissors.

loans.name: Meaaisi

texts.en: Meaaisi A. Y., 35, is married with six children.  She has 0 years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the general public and villagers 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Meaaisi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her business is running well.

loans.use: To purchase mutton flaps, chickens, sausages, soya sauce, onions, garlic, charcoal, and foam plates and cups

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухаё женщина 34 лет , мать двоих детей.С 2006 года Мухаё кредитуется в Микроинвест.Она торгует детской одеждой на рынке Костакоза.Некоторое время у неё был перерыв на счёт кредитования,т.к. она была на заработках в России.В связи с кризисом её сократили и она вернулась на Родину,и приступила к своему прежднему бизнесу.Для увеличения ассортимента она хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Muhayo is 34 years old and the mother of two children. Since 2006 Muhayo has financed with MicroInvest. She sells children's clothes in the city market in Kostakoz. For some time there was a gap in her borrowing because she was working in Russia. However, due to the financial crisis, she was laid off and has returned home to restart her former business. She wants to take out a loan to increase her assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling children's clothes

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик мужчина 28 лет женат имеет двоих детей.Бизнесмен по продаже в розницу мужской обуви.Он продаёт на рынке города Костакоза.Товар привозит с Бишкека сам ,во время его отсутствия торгует его отец.Абдумалик кредитуется уже пятый год, его оборот увеличился в несколько раз.Во время мониторинга Абдумалик был в отъезде за товаром , на снимке его отец.Для увеличения весеннего ассортимента обуви Абдумалик подал текущую заявку на кредит.Абдумалик благодарен инвесторам за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdumalik is a 28 year old man, he is married and has two children. He is a retail businessman and sells men's shoes. He sells on the market of the Kostakoza town. He brings the merchandise from Bishkek and his father replaces him when he is away. Abdumalik has been taking out loans for five years and his turnaround has increased a lot. During the loan approval Abudmalik was away, his father is pictured instead. To increase his spring inventory of shoes he has applied for a loan. Abdumalik is very grateful to all the investors for the financing and support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's shoes

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо женщина 33 лет, замужем имеет двоих детей.Муж работает инспектором ГАИ.Сама Дилрабо домохозяйка,но около своего дома имеет ларёк по продаже продуктов питания первой необходимости для дома.В начале открытия бизнеса, финансами  помог её муж.У неё постоянные клиенты соседних домов.Их микрорайон отдалён от центрального рынка , поэтому её торговля постоянно кипит.Для расширения бизнеса Дилрабо решила взять кредит.
texts.en:
Dilrabo is a 33 year old woman, she is married and has two children. Her husband works as an police inspector. Dilarbo is a housewife, but has a small kiosk near the house where she sells food and goods for the household. When she started her business her husband helped her with finances. She has regular customers from the neighboring homes. Their small region is far away from the central market and this is why her sales are always high. To expand her business Dilrabo want to get a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Тохир мужчина 42 лет, женат имеет четверых детей.Жена портниха на дому по пошиву женской одежды.Сам Тохир мастер по строительству жилых домов.Он имеет бригаду с которой на заказ принимает работу.
Кроме своего основного дохода он также имеет бизнес животноводства,по откорму и продаже скота.У него в основном мелкий скот.За скотом присматривает его жена и дети.К лету Тохир планирует отремонтировать хлев и закупить корм для скота.Для чего и обратился Тохир в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Tohir is a 42 year old man with a wife and four children. His wife works from home as a seamstress of women's clothing. Tohir himself is a construction worker specializing in residential buildings. He and his team work by contract. In addition to his primary income Tohir also has an animal husbandry business. He feeds and sells mostly small livestock. His wife and children look after the animals. Toward summer Tohir plans to renovate the barn and stock up on animal feed. With that aim he came to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feed and sale

loans.name: Mumtaz M.ramzan Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji is the wife of M. R. and has resided in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the last 10 years. Mumtaz baji’s husband has a business selling cosmetics. He buys cosmetics from a famous city named Lahore and sells in parlors and cosmetic shops. He has been in this business for the last seven years. Mumtaz baji is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics to expand her husband’s business. 

She is the group leader for some more women in her locality. Noreen anjum baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Shamim baji wants a loan to pay off the installments on her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy paints to sell. Riaz baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each group member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Loeurm's Group

texts.en:
A small group loan is being requested by five members, all of whom live in Siem Reap Province.

V., 40, is a widowed mother of two children who are still young. She earns a living by raising pigs in her pigpen behind her house. She always sells her mature pigs for a good price to the slaughter after raising them for four months. She plans to have a shop selling cooked ingredients and other domestic materials in order to meet the family's expenses. So V. is looking for a loan to build a small grocery store.

And the other members are: C., 30, who sells soft drinks in front of the market and is taking out a loan to build a shop for her business; S., 24, who sells porridge and Khmer noodle and is looking for a loan to buy more chairs and tables for her business; K., 27, who is a souvenir seller and is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike for her business' transportation; and G., 31, who sells sweets in the market and is taking out a loan to buy a motorbike for her business' transportation. The loan will help them attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a small shop for a grocery store

loans.name: Nasreen Kanwal Akhtar Abbas Group

texts.en:
Nasreen kanwal baji has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last seven years. Her husband's name is A. A. and he has had a business selling garments for the past five years. He runs a shop in the cloth market and earns a good income. Nasreen baji helps him by selling his collection of garments in the community. She is applying for a loan to expand his garment-selling business. 

She is the group leader for some more women in her locality. Zeenat begum baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore” which she uses for loading. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy paints to sell. Tanveer A. baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, clothes and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Uzma Parveen M. Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Uzma parveen baji has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last five years. Uzma baji is married to M. S. and he has a business making and selling car seats.  He has been making these for the last three years. Uzma baji is involved in an embroidery business. She does this work to pay off the school fees for her three sons. Uzma baji is applying for a loan to buy material (plastic sheets and thread) to make more car seats to sell.

She is the group leader for some more women in her locality. Nadia baji wants a loan to buy repair tools for her workshop. Abida parveen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shakeela Fatima baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her vegetable-selling business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material to make car seats

loans.name: Bilquis Fatima M.munir Group

texts.en:
Bilquis Fatima baji is a 32 year old widow and has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 10 years. Bilquis baji’s husband left her with five kids: three sons and two daughters. Bilquis baji worked hard to survive. She started making embroidered dresses and selling them in the market. Using her income she sent her kids to school. Now all her kids are getting an education from a school located near her house. Bilquis baji is now starting a business selling clothing. The embroidery business is a time-intensive profession and there’s a strong trend for people to buy ready made garments. She is applying to buy the ready made garments to sell in the clothing markets to earn a good profit. 

She is the group leader for other women in her locality. Jamilan begum baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her drink corner. Hamidan begum baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothing-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy ready made garments to sell

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima M. Nadir Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima baji is the wife of M. N. who is a fruit seller by profession. Fatima baji has been a citizen of  Vehari, Pakistan for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five kids: four sons and one daughter. All of her kids are getting an education at a school located near her house. Fatima baji’s husband sells fruit on a cart. He shouts out in different areas, so that people hear his voice and buy fruit. He has been in this business for the last five years. Fatima baji is a very hardworking lady. She keeps herself busy with her clothing business. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her kids and to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to expand her husband’s fruit-selling business. 

She is the group leader for other women in her location. Shahnaz parveen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (electric wires and switches) to sell. Sana rubab baji wants a loan to buy a movie camera for her movie-making business. Rafia baji wants a loan to buy a donkey for her donkey cart. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Ilolo Group

texts.en:
Sara has been selling alcohol in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for four years. She belongs to the Ilolo group loan (Group code 2003). Every day she works at her business for six hours.
  
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more alcohol for her business. She is hoping that with this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Sara is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She also cares for two additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Esnati, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more alcohol for her business.

loans.name: Ilolo Group

texts.en:
Vumilia is a banana seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for six hours.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bananas for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Vumilia is 38 years old, married, and has six children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Luthi, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Dezilantah's Group

texts.en: Dezilantah P. is the leader of the Grace loan group in Lugazi. She is 43 years old with 9 children of her own and a cares for the daughter to her late brother. She has a tailoring business that she has been running for the over 15 years.  She specializes mainly in making school uniforms, gomes’s (traditional Ugandan dresses), shirts, trousers, and children’s wear. Her recent loan helped her make enough profits throughout the Christmas season so that she was able to meet the expenses of sending her children to school at the beginning of the school term. This time round, she needs a loan to help buy more clothing material for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing material for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Benki Group

texts.en:
Kajembe has been a potato seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 5 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.
  
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more potatoes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Kajembe is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Annah, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Benki Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth has sold fruit in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.
  
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruit for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Elizabeth is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rofea. who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for her business.

loans.name: Makunguru Group

texts.en:
Veneranda has been a business woman in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.
  
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  


Venerand is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Bupe, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Mary Achieng

texts.en: Mary Achieng O. is a 29 year old single mother of three children, including Sheila, pictured here. This will be Mary's third loan for her clothing business, that she has been running for three years. The loans have helped her continue to grow her business and make larger profits in the Nyamisaria slum. Her profits go towards two of her children's school fees and she is saving up for Sheila. She also hopes to use this loan to enlarge her stall so she can continue to sell more clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell and shelving

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian A. is a 29 year old mother of three children and is pursuing her first loan. Currently she is working in a salon but is hoping to use the loan to start her own business. Her three children are all in school and she is raising them on her own. She says the grestest challenge in starting her business is access to capital. She is fortunate as her children are in government schools and she does not have to pay their fees.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and blowdryers

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy P. heard about K-MET and their micro-loan program through a friend and decided it was the perfect way to expand her business. She has two children aged 6 and 9 years, both in school. She will use this loan to expand her business and take the profit she makes and put it back into her business. Her husband is a mechanic. She is 30 yeas old.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and blowdryer

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy C., 52, and his wife, Mrs. Sarom Kong, 52, live on an Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1999 and have three daughters. One of them is a silk weaver and the other two are in school. 
 
Thy has been a wooden house builder since she 1992. He works in his village and other nearby villages. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was married, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village. Thy is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for his wife’s weaving business and to buy wooden materials to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for his wife’s weaving business and to buy wood materials to build his own house.

loans.name: Khiv's Group

texts.en:
N., 52, is the leader of a loan group consisting of five members. She is a widow  and a mother of two children. One of her children is married and lives separately, and the other is single and lives with her, owns a taxi service with tri-wheel motorbike (toc toc). N. produces balls of rice which are used for the traditional worship and ceremony in the commune. She is good at making this product and earns a reasonable income from this business. N. recently planned to increase her business and is applying for a loan to build a small shop for making and selling her balls of rice. 

The other members of the group are: L., 44, who sells porridge for breakfast and is looking for a loan to rebuild her shop. P., 24, who works as a security guard for a private company is taking a loan to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. T., 55, who is a motor taxi driver is looking for a loan to buy a new motor for his business. And S., 62, who owns a grocery store is requesting a loan to buy more cooked ingredients for her store. They all live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To build a small shop to make and sell her balls of rice

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Mrs. Lida T., 37, and her husband, Mr. Vuth Noun, 46, live in a small village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children attend school and one is still very young. Lida also has her mother is living with her. 

Lida has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been in the army for twenty years. He works at the Air Force Headquarters base in Phnom Penh. 

Lida is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials and set up one more loom for her weaving business. She also wants to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, set up an additional weaving loom and buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Mrs.Juliet Pepania of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, is 29 years old and married, with two children. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 1999 and is engaged in fish vending. Her husband is a fisherman.

Having completed her 9th loan, she is requesting a new loan of twenty thousand pesos  Php 20,000.00 ). She requests the additional capital to purchase fish in volume at a lower cost. The increased profits along with her husbands income will enable them to send their children to school and finish college in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing nets and additional capital for fish vending

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Poline Anyango

texts.en: Poline Anyango O. is a 29-year-old resident of Nyamasaria. She is a tailor. This is her first loan for her business which she hopes to enlarge. She will purchase cloth, threads and needles with her loan. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Poline says both are good kids. Her husband is a trailer-truck driver.

loans.use: Thread, needles

loans.name: Sreyton

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyton L., 26, and her husband, Mr. Saman Lonh, 25, live in a small village along the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have one young daughter.

Sreyton has been selling sugarcane and corn for two years. She buys her supplies in her village and resells them at nearby villages. Mr. Saman Lonh has been farming for five years. He grows rice. Besides farming he is a horse cart driver as well. Sreyton is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase contracts of sugarcane and corn for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sugarcane and corn for resale.

loans.name: Dorcase Achieng

texts.en: Dorcase is a 35 year old single mother raising one son. This is her second loan which she will use to purchase more products for her shop. She lives and works in Nyamasaria and assures Kiva lenders that her son, while an only child, is a good boy. She says it is a challenge raising a child by herself and she wishes she could make more money. Dorcase insisted that we come to see her shop after she receives her loan, which we plan to do.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
N. is 36 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. He has been a fisherman since 2000, and earns his living with skill and hard work. During the morning and in the late afternoon he works from his small boat with his fishnets along the Tonle Sap river. His wife, Cheng, is 38 years old and helps N. in the business. He has three children, all of whom are single and under his care. 

Income from his fishing allowed N. to buy a motorbike for his family, and now he is requesting a loan of $200 to buy more fishnets to help his business grow. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. N. dreams of having a big house for his family and of his children earning college degrees.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for his business

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Mrs. Sina S., 29, and her husband, Mr. Chum Keo, 34, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 2000 and have three sons, all of whom attend school. Sina has been a silk weaver since 1993. She also taught her husband to weave silk. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Sina is interested in creating another business selling sugarcane juice, but she lacks startup money. Therefore, Sina is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase a sugarcane juicing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a sugarcane juicing machine.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa Sidibé  est une femme mariée, née le 26 Août 1956 à Tougan (Burkina faso) et  mère de 4 enfants (2garçons et 2 filles) qui vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le village de Nimbougou, chef lieu d’une des communes rurales de la sous préfecture de Loulouni (région de Sikasso république du Mali).
Matrone de son état,  Awa Sidibé  fait le commerce depuis 15 ans. Expérimentée en raison des années d’exercices dans le commerce, elle le mène conjointement en harmonie avec son metier de matrone.
Elle est à son deuxième prêt indidividuel avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt anterieur c’est bien dénoué. 
Madame  Awa Sidibé  compte acheter avec ce prêt,  200 kg de tissus de draps de lit et 1 tonne de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina faso pays frontalier de la république du Mali et dans la commune de Nimbougou et environnants. Awa Sidibé vend au comptant et  à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elle ambitionne de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa Sidibé is a married woman who was born on August 26, 1956 in Tougan (Burkina Faso). She is the mother of four (two boys and two girls) and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wives, and their children in the village of Nimbougou, the seat of the rural communities in Loulouni sub-prefecture (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). A matron, she has been in commerce for fifteen years. Experienced in commerce from years of work, she does commerce jointly and in harmony with her job as a matron. She is on her second individual loan with the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loan was settled.

Ms. Awa Sidibé intends to use this loan to buy 200 kg of cloth for bedsheets and one tonne of corn. She acquires her supplies in Burkina Faso, a country bording Mali, and in and around the community of Nimbougou. Her sales are made retail, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of women and men.

She envisions realizing an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used for the most part to increase her working capital. Her ambition is to build a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bedsheet cloth and corn

loans.name: Maimounata

texts.fr:
Madame Maimounata D. est une femme mariée de 29 ans et mère de 2 enfants (1 garçon et 1 fille) qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants  à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités commerciales sans succès, elle s’initia à la teinture à Sikasso auprès d’une teinturière de la place il y a maintenant 2 ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (Mariage, baptème, fêtes, etc.) 
Ses ressources propres ne pouvant pas lui permettre de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, elle sollicita depuis maintenant 7 ans la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son  6ème prêt individuel  après 4 prêts solidaires,  tous correctement remboursés.
Elle compte acheter, 7 pièces de bazins blancs, 5 sachets de soude caustique et 8 boites de teintures de couleurs différentes. Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des commercants grossistes en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teinture). Les bazins reçoivent des colories avant d’être revendus au comptant et à crédit. Elle a pour clients potentiels, les revendeuses des bazins teintés, les couturiers et les femmes de son quartier..
