Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses presonnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales en aidant son époux, rembourser les intèrêts du prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Ms. Maimounata D. is a married woman, 29 years old, and the mother of two children (a boy and a girl). She lives with her husband and their children in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After having done several kinds of work unsuccessfully, she got introduced two years ago to the dyeing of cloth in Sikasso from a local woman in that trade. She enjoys a solid reputation in this work and receives many orders, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, holidays, etc.).

Her working capital being unable to help her meet the needs of her customers, she requested the collaboration of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. She is now on her sixth individual loan after four solidarity loans, all correctly repaid. She plans to buy seven lengths of white damask cloth, five bags of caustic soda, and eight boxes of dyes of different colors. Supplies of the raw materials are gotten locally from wholesale merchants. The damask receive their coloring before being sold, cash or credit accepted. Her potential clients would be retailers of dyed damask, clothiers, and women in her area.

She has the intention of realizing an average monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover personal expenses, to go towards family expenses by helping her husband, to repay the loan interest, and to bolster her dye business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask, caustic soda, and dyes

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary T., 45, and her husband, Mr. Tuy Pan, 49, live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  They were married in 1983 and have seven children: six sons and one daughter who is a cobbler in a shoe factory. One of their sons is a monk, two children attend school, one son was married and lives outside the family house, and another son has full-time employment.

Nary has been a rice farmer since she was young.  She grows rice on the farm nearby her home. Her husband has been a framer since he was young and has been a builder of wooden houses for a year.

Nary hopes to support her children's further education. She is applying for her first loan of $400 to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To grow rice.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia has been a local alcohol seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for six years. She belongs to Majengo "A" group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation and more hens for grazing. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Lukia is 42 years old, married, and has six children: ages 23, 21, 20, 16, 14, and 7. She also cares for four additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more items for alcohol preparation and more hens for grazing

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en:
Matrida M. has been a cow and hen keeper in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years. She belongs to the Majengo "A" street group loan (Group code 2001).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $300. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours. 

Matrida is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more hens and another cow to increase her livestock. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Matrida is 45 years old, married, and has three children: ages 18, 16, and 12.

loans.use: To buy more hens and a cow.

loans.name: Samun

texts.en:
Mr. Samun M., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Sina Sao, 36, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have two children, one son and one daughter, both of whom are in school.

Samun has been a mason for 15 years, a skill he learned from his brother. His wife stays at home taking care of their children. The house where Samun’s family lives is in need of repair, making it difficult for them to live in it. He is therefore requesting his first loan of $1,200 to make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Chea's Group
loans.use: To buy two machines for his apprentices.

loans.name: Saima Abdul Latif Group

texts.en:
Saima baji is 28 years old and a married lady and citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Saima baji is an uneducated lady; she couldn’t study because her parents had few financial resources. She is married to a man whose name is A. L. and he has an animal-selling business. He buys animals from the animal market and sells to the butcher shops and earns a profit. He has been in this business for the past 10 years.

Saima baji is the mother of one son whose name is Chand and he is in kindergarten. Saima baji is a highly determined lady. She wants to see her son at the peak of success and for this purpose she prepares embroidered dresses and sells them to clothing shops and earns a profit. She saves her income to be able to admit her son to a good school. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy goats for her husband's animal-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food business. Abida Jabeen wants a loan to buy bakery items (bread and butter) to sell. Farzana Maqbool baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her drink corner. Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Madame Mamou C. a 37 ans mariée, elle réside avec son époux et ses 2 enfants (1 garçon et 1 fille) à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mamou C. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès au village, s’initia depuis deux ans, à l’activité d’achat et de vente des calebasses et divers dès  son arrivée en ville.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec  elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 3 colis de calebasses. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre  en détail, au comptant et à crédit  à Nièna et dans les zones minières à  une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout de miniers. Il s’agit de l’orpaillage (exploitations minières traditionnelles) dans les placers.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Mamou C., age 37, is married and resides with her husband and two children (a boy and a girl) in Banconi, one of the outlying densely-populated districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work in the village unsuccessfully, she got introduced two years ago to buying and selling calebasses (cups and bowls made from a dried gourd) and various other goods as soon she arrived in the city.

Wanting to do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which she is on her first individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy 3 packages of calebasses. She supplies herself from rural producers in the towns near Sikasso and then sells the goods retail, cash or credit accepted, in Nièna and in mining zones. Her customers are generally composed of women and especially miners. This has to do with the washing of gold (a traditional mining process) at sites having alluvial deposits of gold.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help with family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calebasses

loans.name: Nawab John Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Nawab baji is 57 years old and a married lady and citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 7 years. Her husband's name is J. M. and he has been running a tea stall in the community for the past 5 years. People come to his stall for taking tea.

Nawab baji is the mother of two sons. Her elder son runs a small restaurant in the food market. His brother is 15 years old and doesn’t do anything. Nawab baji is an older lady so she keeps herself busy with household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her elder son’s food business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Hanifan baji and Ayesha baji each want a loan to buy material (wood and furniture polish) for their furniture-making business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to sell. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for food business

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M.arshad Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is 41 years old and a married lady. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family since last year. Parveen baji is married to a man whose name is M. A. and he is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Parveen baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her kids are getting an education from a school located near their home. Parveen baji is involved in a clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from famous cities (Multan and Faisalabad) and sells them in her native city. She has been doing this work for the past 10 years. Parveen baji does this work to share the financial burden of her husband and pay the school fees for her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Irshad baji and Mumtaz begum baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her cold drink corner. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
N. is 41 years old and is the leader of a group that consists of three members. She has one child who is studying in grade 9. N. has been selling jewelry since 1993; at first she started this business in her home and after that, she could afford to own a shop in the market. She is a very clever businesswoman; she imports her products from various places around the country and sells the jewelry in bulk to customers from the city.

N. now wants to sell wholesale: she would buy the jewelry in bulk from the field and then take it to Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, herself. Doing that, she can earn a good profit. So N. is applying for a loan to buy more jewelry for her shop.

The other members of the group are:

C., 41, who sells soft drinks and is taking out a loan to buy a sugar cane juice machine for her business; and

N., 49, who is a local construction worker and is taking out a loan to buy more construction materials for her work.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry for her shop

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at E., 40, and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Ros, 53, married in 1981 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home; one son is a security guard at a hotel in Phnom Penh, and the youngest child is in grade eleven. The family lives along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-at has been a cotton scarf weaver for thirty years; it’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products at the market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Chamroeun Ros has been driving a motor taxi for ten years. One of their daughters is an assistant to a dentist at a private dental clinic in Phnom Penh. That's why Sam-at is requesting her first loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work and to buy cotton thread for her scarf weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work and  cotton thread for her scarf weaving business

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. L., is 48 years old. She is a good mother who has given birth to eight children. Six of them are single and the others are married. She is married to Reun, 50, who is a Khmer wine distiller.

L. currently earns a living raising pigs in a medium-size stall next to her house. Her investment is running very well because she has skillfully raised pigs in the village for a long time. Due to the business growing, L. is asking for a loan in order to buy more piglets to raise and plans to use the remaining amount of the loan for her husband's business distilling wine.

The other three borrowers are: S., who sells boiled eggs in front of her house and seeks a loan to build a stall for raising pigs; R., who is a fruit seller and requests a loan to buy a cart for transporting fruits to sell at the market; and C., who is a homemaker who cares for three children and applies for a loan as capital to purchase chicks to raise.

All of the borrowers live in Odom Bang Commune, Battambang Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok S., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Im Proeung, 45, live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of their sons is married and lives outside the family home. Their daughter is a garment-factory worker. One son is a construction worker and the youngest one attends school.

Sok has been a fisherman for 10 years, a skill he learned from his brother. He fishes from the lake nearby his house. Mrs. Im Proeng sells the fish that her husband caught at a market in Phnom Penh.

Sok is asking for his first loan of $800 to buy a motorbike to carry fish for sale and to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry fish for sale and to build a fence around his house

loans.name: Asia Shahsawar Group

texts.en:
Asia baji is a 49-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is S., and he runs a grocery shop in the community. He has been in this business for the past four years. Asia baji is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from a school which is located near the house. Asia baji is involved in a business sewing clothes. She sews clothes by taking orders from her relatives and neighbors. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her kids and to share the financial burden of her husband. Asia baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is the group leader of some more women in her area. Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy dried fruits (peanuts and almonds) to sell. Azra baji wants a loan to buy tools for repairing vehicles for her motor-works shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie A. is a 47-year-old mother of two.  Her husband is a laborer.  One of her children is still in high school, and the other is a college graduate.

Merlie has a well-established pig raising operation, and recently started a business selling fish.  She's been learning about buying and selling fish from a friend who has experience in the trade.  Merlie sells fish to people in her neighborhood.

Merlie plans to use most of this loan to develop her fish selling business, and will use part of the loan to buy more piglets and feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy materials to develop her fish selling business, and to buy three piglets and two sacks of feed for her hog raising venture.

loans.name: Irshad Syed Imtiaz Ali Shah Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is a widow and a citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Her husband left her five years ago. Irshad baji bears hardships because there were no financial resources at that time. She worked hard to survive. She started embroidering clothes and selling them in the clothes shops.

She has one son who is 20 years old and now runs a small hotel in the community. His income makes her relax from work. She successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva's partner). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy material (utensils, lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her son's hotel.

She is the group leader of some more women in her locality. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy vehicle oil to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy utensils, lentils, cooking oil and spices for a hotel

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal U., 43, and her husband, Mr. Leang Seak, 42, were married in 1990 and have a young daughter who is in primary school. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophal has been selling food and rice for two years. She buys the ingredients from Prek Anhchanh market to cook and sell at a school nearby her house. Her husband has been driving a taxi for over ten years. He drives from his village to Phnom Penh and other attractive places. The couple is in the process of building a new house but they lack sufficient money to finish, so Sophal is applying for her first loan of $500 to complete her new house.

loans.use: To add to her own money to build her new house

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat S., 41, and her husband, Mr. Morn Moe, 47, was married in 1984 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family house, one daughter is a garment factory worker and another one attends school. The family lives on an Island of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophat has been a silk weaver for 29 years, a skill she learned from her mother.  She sells her finished products at places far away from her house. Her husband has been a boat repairer in the village for two years. Sophat is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
S. H. is the leader of this group of three borrowers. She has three children, all of whom are in school. She is married to Sophea, 49, who has a public service job. S. H. has sold different kinds of vegetables (such as cucumbers, potatoes, mushrooms, and so forth) since 2000. She is a struggling mother and a responsible seller; she earns a good income from her business because her store is in the busy market. To meet her family's needs, S. H. wants to increase the income from this business. So she is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables for her store. 

The other members of her group are: 
H., 44, who sells vegetables in bulk to the sellers in the whole market. She is looking for a loan to invest in her business. 
N., 49, who sells vegetables in retail. She is applying for a loan to renovate her store. 

All three entrepreneurs live in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her store

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat U., 35, and her husband, Mr. Ty Soung, 37, were married in 1994 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are in school. Besides her children, she also has her mother is living with her.

Sophat has been selling boiled corn and Cambodian cake for over four years. Her husband has been driving a taxi for one year. He carries people from Kampong Thom Province to Kampong Cham Province. Sophat used her first loan to repair her husband’s taxi. Now she needs another loan to replace the taxi’s wheels and to level the land around her house, so she is applying for her second loan of $1000.

loans.use: To buy new wheels for her husband’s taxi and to fill up the land around her house

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao C., 36, and his wife, Mrs. San Chea, 38, live along National Road Number One about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh They were married in 1991 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. One of their children has full-time employment, two children attend school and the other stay at home.

Mao has been a mason for 15 years. He works in his village and in Phnom Penh. His wife has been selling groceries and vegetables since she was single. She buys them from Koky market, about 17 kilometers from her village for resale in her village. The couple hopes to support their children's further education. Mao is asking for his first loan of $600 to purchase a motorcycle to help his wife to carry vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Tiny

texts.en:
Mr. Tiny B., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Hoeun Chhang, 39, were married in 2000. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. Mrs. Hoeun Chhang also has one son with her first husband. The eldest son is a construction worker and the others stay at home. Besides his children, Tiny also has an old mother living with him.

Tiny has been a mason for over one year. His wife sells porridge and Khmer noodles in front of her house.

Tiny is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle and a cart to load his construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and a cart to load his construction materials

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mr. Dina S., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Saret Vor, 34, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1998 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are in school and another one is a baby. Besides his children he also has his parents living with him.

Dina has been driving a motor taxi (tuk tuk) for four years, which he drives in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Saret Vor has been selling gasoline for seven years. She buys it from Phnom Penh for resale in her village.

Dina’s motorbike and a passenger trailer were broken and he spent a lot of money to repair it. Moreover, it is difficult for him to earn income to support his family. So Dina is applying for a loan of $700 to make the replacement.

loans.use: To replace a motorbike and a passenger trailer (tuk tuk)

loans.name: Florenia

texts.en:
Florenia A. is a 61-year-old widow who has five children.  She lives with her fourth child, a daughter.

Florenia has been running a "sari sari" store, a small variety shop where she sells general goods.  She is requesting a loan so she can start raising pigs again, and to buy goods for resale in her shop.  She plans to use the additional income from raising pigs to help pay for her grandchildren's school expenses.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, charcoal, salt and gas.

loans.name: Tat's Group
loans.use: To buy hundreds of kilograms of pork for her business

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan that is made up of four people, all residents of Battambang Province. Mrs. C. has been selected to be the leader by the members. C.'s age is 36 and she is married with seven children who are studying in the local school. Her husband is a domestic teacher in the education ministry.

C. currently makes a daily income by selling clothes in the village. Most of her clients are villagers. She normally sells her clothes to clients on credit with a specific repayment schedule. C.'s investment is running smoothly and has gained more income. To make more business success and to earn additional revenue, C. is applying for a loan in order to increase her stock of clothing.

The other three borrowers are: S. M., who sells groceries and provides a house-renting service, is looking for a loan to buy grocery inventory to sell; V. is a village dessert seller who is asking for a loan to buy the necessary ingredients for her business activities; and S. P., who earns a living providing small loans to the neighborhood and is asking for a loan as capital in her personal service.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothing

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa M. is a 41-year-old mother of five who is separated from her husband, but not legally divorced.  She has a live-in partner who has two children; he is a part-time fisherman and also is a butcher.

Elisa is requesting this loan in order to get the capital to start a business selling prepared food, such as roasted meat, and fish.  She plans to sell the fish and the food she makes to people in her neighborhood.

Elisa hopes to put the profits from her new business towards house repairs, and to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fish, meat, hotdogs and rice for vending.

loans.name: Kil's Group

texts.en:
The group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader N., 54, is the mother of five children: the first two are married and live separately, one works as a tour guide with an income of $30 per month, and the last two are attending school. She is married to Toek, 58, who is a labor worker in a private company. N. earns a living by selling porridge as a breakfast food. She is good at making a tasty porridge and she has a lot of clients coming to her store. N. wants to increase her selling in order to support the family better. So N. is taking a loan to buy more chairs and tables for her business. 

The other group members are: 
S., 24, a local labor worker who is applying for a loan to buy wooden poles for her house. 
N., 30, a machine repairer in a private company who is asking for a loan to buy the wooden slices of wall for her house. 
R., 55, also a machine repairer in a private company who is applying for a loan to buy fish for his wife to sell in the market. 

All of the group members live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for her business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora B. is a 68-year-old mother of three.  She lives with her husband and one of her children, an unmarried son.

This loan will help Aurora fund her established pig raising operation, and will provide the capital to start a rice retailing business.  Aurora has some experience in retail, having sold vegetables and fish from time to time.

Aurora hopes to use some of the income she earns from pig raising and selling rice to help support her grandchildren's college education.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and sack of rice for resale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 25-year old unwed mother of one child. Her child is her sole inspiration to pursue in her variety store business. She hopes that this business will be the source of income to finance the studies of her child.

Her variety store was established with only PHP 500 as initial capital. Her requested loan will be a great help for the business because she will be able to purchase more products. Her neighbors will  conveniently buy their needs from her store instead of going to the town proper.

She dreams that her business will expand after a year so that she will be sustaining to the expenses of her only child. She dreams that her child will finish her studies.

loans.use: To purchase of shampoo, cigarettes, and other mechandise for sale in her store

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид Муйдинов  1966 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Он 9 лет как ухаживает за скотом. Но основная его деятельность  это транспортировка грузов по регионам. Животноводство приносит большой доход , но надо долго ждать , когда скот вырастит , только тогда его надо продавать. Поэтому Абдурашид  стал водителем  грузовой машины и развозит фрукты овощи и другие грузы. Он стал сотрудничать с Микроинвест несколько дней назад. Если условия позволят расширять его  бизнес он будет кредитоваться и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Abdurashid M., born in 1966, has a wife and three children. He has been raising animals for 9 years, but his primary work is transporting cargo between regions. Animal husbandry produces a good income, but there is a long wait for the animal to grow to marketable size. Because of that Abdurashid became a truck driver and started carrying fruits, vegetables and other freight. He began to work with Microinvest a few days ago. If conditions allow him to expand his business he will continue to request loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Jerilyn

texts.en:
Jerilyn C. is a 28-year-old mother of two.  Her husband drives a "tricycle" -- a motorcycle with sidecar that's operated as a taxi.  One of her children is in elementary school, and the other is in high school.

Jerilyn plans to use the money from this loan to pay off another loan, taken out to buy her husband's tricycle.  She also plans to buy a pumpboat, or motorized outrigger canoe, for her brother.  Jerilyn and her brother work together to catch and sell fish -- he fishes, and she sells them.  Her brother will use the pumpboat to transport fish and other items.

By paying off her husband's tricycle loan early, Jerilyn will save her family money.  She hopes the pumpboat will bring her and brother extra income.  Jerilyn's dream is to earn enough money to be able to send both of her children to college.

loans.use: To pay off expenses on a motorcycle with sidecar (tricycle) and to buy a motorized outrigger canoe (pumpboat).

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. is a 48-year-old mother of two.  She and her husband have a stall in a public market where they sell fish.

Cecilia will use the proceeds from this loan as rolling capital, and will buy fish for resale at her stall in the market.  One day, she hopes to be able to buy a vehicle to transport her fish herself.

If she has enough income, Cecilia wants to send her youngest child, a son who is a high school graduate, to college.  Her oldest child is already a university graduate.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Since he was a boy, Hasan has loved animals. He has learned to raise them well so that he can market them. Hasan is married and has three children to provide for. To support his family, he has to invest in his livestock business and, consequently, he approached IMON International to apply for a loan that will allow him to purchase young cattle and fodder for feeding them. This loan will, in turn, increase his income from the sale of milk, meat, horn, etc. that the cattle provide.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to sufficient capital to fund viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
H. Nasim is 47 years old. He is married and has two children. Nasim's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver who drives the streets of Khujand city in search of customers. He has owned his business for four years. Nasim’s car needs a thorough repair, and he wants to borrow $600 USD for the term of 12 months. The financing will go towards general repairs of his vehicle. He thanks Kiva and all lenders who make this help possible.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
H. Munavvar comes from a humble family, but her desire to succeed in life supersedes her economic condition. At an early age, she learned to make new and different articles for women's national dresses. Thanks to her excellent work, she won the admiration and loyalty of her clients. With the benefits she obtained, she was able to pay for her advanced obstetrician studies and those of her husband. Both are now parents of three charming kids and the wish of this hard-working mother is to provide the best future for her children. In order to realize her plans for which she works hard, Munavvar appeals to your caring heart and requests a loan to buy the materials necessary to continue making her fine articles of dress. Let’s support this excellent seamstress so she can continue sewing her elegant and distinguished articles of national dresses. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing women national dresses.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
K. Nazokat is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. Nazokat sells clothes and shoes for women at the market. She has been in this trade for many years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Nazokat is hoping to receive a loan of $500 USD to increase the variety of inventory in her store and keep her business running successfully. She promises to fulfill the loan term within 12 months. This additional inventory will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to sufficient capital to fund viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora K. is 45 years old. She is still working diligently to help her husband who currently works in Russia. She has worked in the agricultural business of farming and also buying and selling cattle for 7 years. She uses the profits to cover the family expenses and her children’s education fees. Gulnora has three children. The loan from IMON International will be used to purchase mineral fertilizer for growing onions, which she is planning. She hopes that the business goes well and her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Turgunoy

texts.en:
Turgunoy M. is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married. Three years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She has a sewing machine in her house where she produces dresses for women in the traditional style. She is asking for a loan of $350 USD that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and cover her customers' demands. She has committed to repaying the amount in 12 months. Help this young family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Turgunoy’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: To purchasing fabrics for sewing dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, hair extensions, and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Kuchkor

texts.en:
Kuchkor R. is 50 years old. He is a livestock dealer. He buys and sells cattle at various markets and has been in the business for the last 16 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. Kuchkor is married and the father of three children. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children receive higher education and be able to get good jobs, unlike himself.

loans.use: To purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Kholida

texts.en:
Kholida has always been a very hard-working woman. She used to work sewing and selling traditional dresses for women and girls. Starting the business wasn't easy because she didn't have the necessary machine to do the work. However, with her father's help, she was able to save enough money to buy her own machine four years ago and has been working in embroidery ever since. Kholida would like to grow her business even more and buy a modern automated embroidery machine. With your help she can achieve her goals.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en:
Kurbon is 49 years old and lives with his wife and their 3 children. He is a man who, from an early age, was characterized as a hard worker who was very dedicated to his agricultural work, raising cattle. He saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. His challenge is to improve the breed, but to do so he would have feed them properly. Kurbon has the best intentions for his children, which allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer. This farmer yearns to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family living. In order to do so he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy animals of a better breed to improve their quality.

loans.use: To purchase better quality cattle

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is a very hardworking woman. She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 16 years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This is the way she pays for the education of her three children who have high hopes for their future. She raises calves and sheep and later sells them at the markets, according to her clients' demands. She prepares them so they are ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country. Since Marhabo aspires for a great future, she decided to expand her business with the sole purpose of improving her family living conditions and to help pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society. loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.en:
Abdujabbor is 37 years old and the father of two children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. He is a hard working person and has been providing taxi services for 5 years. The most important thing to him is that his children one day successfully finish at the University and be professionals so that they will have a better tomorrow. Abdujabbor wishes to keep his taxi business growing, and for this he needs to have his working tools in good working order. Abdujabbor needs to buy spare parts to repair his car and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work, he has been able to stabilize his quality of life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Shahnozakhon

texts.en:
Shahnozakhon has six years of experience as a seamstress. She worked with her mother first, which is how she learned her trade. Four years ago she started her own business, and with the help of some money her husband saved, she was able to buy the sewing machine she needed to open her business. Shahnozakhon specializes in women's national dresses. Her workshop is in her home and she works Monday through Sunday from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. She would like to take out a loan of $600 USD for the term of 10 months to be able to purchase new, modern fabrics for her business. Shahnozakhon is counting on your help and thanks all of you. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: To purchase fabric for sewing women's national dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell hair extensions and cloth, to buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en: Marwa Mahando is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. He is married and runs a charcoal-selling business at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam. Charcoal is the main source of power in most African countries due to the high cost and instability of electrical power. Mr. Mahando purchases his business items wholesale directly from the producers and sells them in retail to his customers. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To buy more business items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoe-making supplies

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en: Ashura A. runs a soft-drinks pub at Kigamboni Island in Dar es Salaam. She also owns and runs a cosmetics shop. She is married with two children. She purchases her cosmetics goods from the wholesale and retail shops at Kariakoo shopping center in Dar es Salaam. She plans to run a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To buy more business stock.

loans.name: Mtendeje

texts.en: Mtendeje I. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and businesswoman who runs a café at Kigamboni Island in Dar es Salaam. She is a married woman with four schoolchildren. In her business, she sells a variety of food and soft drinks. She has been in the business for four years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To boost up the business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen Trabaja como empleada, y tiene un hijo, está  separada del esposo y requiere el crédito para la compra de una computadora.
Este crédito le servirá de gran manera ya que podrá culminar sus estudios superiores.
Vive en la zona de Nuevos Horizontes de la ciudad de La Paz en alquiler.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, sus ganas de superarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida le dan la oportunidad de acceder al crédito.
texts.en:
Carmen works as a maid, and has a son. She is separated from her husband and needs this loan in order to buy a computer. This loan will be a great help to her in enabling her to complete her University studies. She lives in a rental in the Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) neighborhood in La Paz.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan; her desires to better herself and improve her living conditions have given her the opportunity to gain access to the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer to help in her University studies

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
Hernán tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como Radio Taxi, también es mecánico. 
Es soltero y vive en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz en la casa de sus padres. 
El crédito será destinado para capital la compra de herramientas para la instalación de un taller de mecánica y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida e ingresos.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Hernán uses his car as a Radio Taxi and is also a mechanic. He is single and lives in his parents’ house in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz. His loan will be used to buy tools to set up a mechanics workshop and so improve his quality of life and his income. This is the third time he has requested a loan through Impro, his file shows that he is a number one client, that is to say he reliably repays his loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools to set up a mechanics workshop

loans.name: Efren

texts.es:
Efren se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y a la  siembra de papa cuya producción  vende a comerciantes de la zona.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Kallutaca de la Provincia  Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a  dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Como segunda actividad se dedica al transporte publico en el vehiculo que es de su propiedad

Vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo 
 
El crédito lo destinara para incrementar su capital para poder comprar una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Efren raises cattle and farms potatoes to sell the produce to local businessmen. He lives with his wife and young son in Kallutaca de la Provincia de los Andes, of the La Paz department, located two hours from the city of La Paz, Bolivia. As a second job, he uses his own automobile to provide public transportation. A loan would enable him to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production. It is his first loan with Impro; his evaluation qualifies him to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for selling milk.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley es una mujer ejemplar en cuanto a emprendimiento y dedicación al negocio propio se refiere. A sus sesenta y un años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos aproximadamente quince años. Antes de esto se dedicaba a la venta de comida y también de joyas por pedido. Pero una vez que empezó con su venta de cosméticos como consultora de belleza no ha parado de crecer y crecer.

Hoy en día, gracias a todo su esfuerzo, continúa trabajando en la venta de cosméticos bajo el cargo de “Ejecutiva de ventas”, pues se encarga de administrar todas las ventas de todas quienes son también consultoras de belleza dentro de su zona.

Desde sus veinte años siempre ha trabajado, con la idea primero de ayudar a su esposo para el mantenimiento del hogar y crianza de sus tres hijos que ya son mayores. Por ahora sus ganancias las destina solo para su hija menor que aun no terminar su carrera profesional de educación.
texts.en:
Shirley is an exemplary woman in terms of managing a business. Now 61 years old, she has been selling cosmetics for a living for approximately 15 years. Before this business, she used to sell jewelry by catalog and food. However, as soon as she started selling cosmetics as a beauty consultant, she has not stopped growing as an entrepreneur.

Thanks to her efforts, she now continues to work in cosmetics as a sales executive who manages other beauty consultants in her area.

Ever since she was 22 years old, she has been working with the goal of helping her husband cover the household expenses and raising her three children, who are all adults. For now, she is using her income to help her youngest daughter complete her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a drainpipe in her home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora vive en la calle Mundo de la zona Villa Exaltacion de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su  esposo el cual trabaja como mecánico en un taller de reparaciones automotrices, tiene  tres pequeños hijos.
 
Se dedica al comercio de ajíes, condimentos y tunta en su puesto de venta fijo ubicado en la zona de villa dolores.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así mejorar su margen de ganancias.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Dora lives on Mundo Street in the Villa Exaltacion neighborhood of the city of El Alto.

She lives with her husband, who works as a mechanic in an automotive repair shop. They have three young children.

She sells chili peppers, spices and tuntas (freeze-dried potatoes) for a living in her permanent stall, located in the Villa Dolores neighborhood.

The loan will be used to purchase wholesale goods so that she can increase her profits.

This is her first loan with Impro. Her credit check qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chili peppers, spices and freeze-dried potatoes

loans.name: Marlene,

texts.es:
Durante seis años Marlene estuvo trabando en un negocio de copias impresiones y tipeos al frente de la Universidad de Lima. Debido al excesivo tiempo que le tomaba movilizarse hasta su centro de trabajo y también a la cantidad de horas de trabajo, Marlene finalmente decidió abandonar aquel trabajo y crecer con su pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos

Hoy en día ya lleva alrededor de siete años vendiendo cosméticos por catalogo. Sin embargo, este negocio no es suficiente para poder mantener sola a su hijo de dieciocho años. Para poder darle estudios superiores, desde hace dos años que Marlene trabaja en una casa para el servicio domestico.

Ella es madre soltera y sus cuarenta años, más adelante tiene planes de abrir una tienda-bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
For six years, Marlene had been working at a company that provides copy, printing and typing services in front of the University of Lima. Because of her hours and her long commute to work, Marlene finally decided to leave that job and expand her cosmetics sales business.

She has now been selling cosmetics by catalog for seven years. However, this job does not give her enough profits to support her 18-year-old son on her own. In order for her to be able to provide him with a higher education, she has been working as a housekeeper. She is a 40-year-old single mother who plans on opening a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition for son’s Environmental Engineering studies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ekaterina

texts.en: Ekaterina is divorced. She lives alone in a small apartment. Ekaterina sells women's clothing at the central market in Melitopol. She has been in this business for nine years. Today Ekaterina has two kiosks located close to one another. This helps her attract more clients. Ekaterina also has a discount policy that helps her to retain old clients. Ekaterina is hard working and quite an entrepreneurial person. She wants to develop her business even more. Ekaterina would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of clothing she sells. She would use the additional income to help her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing she sells

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio es chofer de una camioneta en la cual reparte cerveza trabaja con su cuñado, su esposa tiene una carnicería donde vende carne de vaca, carne de pollo y refrescos y con ambos ingresos mantienen a su familia y cubren los estudios de su hijo; vive en alquiler en la casa de su prima que esta ubicada en la calle 7 de octubre de la zona de Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra arroz, azúcar, verduras y demás que nenecita para la tienda y así subirá sus ingresos. 

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Braulio drives a beer distribution van; he works with his brother-in-law. His wife has a meat market where she sells beef, chicken and soft drinks. With their combined incomes they support their family and pay for their son's education. Braulio rents his home, which is located in the Rio Seco section of the town of El Alto, from his cousin. The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, vegetables and other items needed for the store thereby increasing their profits. His evaluation shows that he qualifies for this, his first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, vegetables and other items for his wife's store.

loans.name: Felicita,

texts.es:
Felicita ya lleva más de veinte años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO. Gracias a ello y a su gran de esfuerzo, hoy se siente orgullosa no solo de tener un negocio más estable, sino de haber ayudado a sus cuatro a hijos a que culminen sus estudios. Ella asegura que la mayor inversión que ha podido hacer ha sido el estudio de sus hijos.

El negocio de Felicita empezó como una librería en su casa. Como al inicio vendía poco uno de sus hijos decidió apoyarla. Luego de un tiempo ella le encargo el negocio y ella se mudó al mercado para dedicarse al negocio que hasta hoy lleva para adelante, la venta de granos y menestras en el mercado de su barrio.

Su esposo trabaja como personal administrativo en una universidad estatal. Junto con el mantiene el hogar y paga los estudios de su menor hijo, quien esta cursando la carrera de Matemática pura. Por ahora, solo quiere mantenerse en las ventas de su negocio, en un futuro tal vez podría cambiar de rubro.
texts.en:
Felicita has been an EDAPROSPO loan recipient for over twenty years. Thanks to the loans and to her efforts, she is proud not only to have a more stable business but also of having helped her four children finish their studies. She believes that the greatest investment she could have made was in her children's educations. Felicita began with a home-based stationary store. At the beginning, she sold little so one of her children decided to help her. After some time she left him in charge of the enterprise and she moved to the marketplace in her neighborhood to dedicate herself to the business that is today her main occupation, the sale of grains and miscellany. Her husband works as an administrator at the local state university. With him, she supports her home and pays for her youngest son's schooling; he is majoring in mathematics. For now, her sales business is her main interest but doesn't discard the possibility of a future change in focus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For merchandise and her daughter's graduation expenses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La venta de pollos no es el único  y primer negocio propio de Olga. Cuando empezó a trabajar, lo hizo con la venta de frutas, negocio al cual le dedico tres años, hasta que su hijo cayó enfermo. Luego de un tiempo inicio un negocio de comida en el cual duro solo hasta que se animo a vender pollos. 

Luego de cinco años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, Olga ha logrado crecer en este rubro. Hoy en día, su puesto ambulante se ha convertido en un puesto de concreto y céntrico en el mercado de su localidad, y lo mejor de todo, ya es de su propiedad.

Olga, tiene cincuenta y ocho años y cuatro hijos, de los cuales solo uno esta en su poder. Gracias a su trabajo ella pude mantener los gastos d e su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero pero no tiene un trabajo estable. En el futuro quisiera abrir una tienda y a la par continuar con la venta de pollos pues goza de un buen número de clientela.


Compra de pollo al por mayor
texts.en:
The sale of chickens is not the only or first business that Olga has owned. When she began working she did so with the sale of fruits, a business to which she dedicated three years, until her son fell ill. After some time had passed, she started a food business until she was inspired to sell chickens. After five years with loans from EDAPROSPO, Olga has managed to grow in this sector. Today, her street vending locale has turned into a concrete stall in a central location in the market in the area where she resides, and best of all, it is now her property. Olga is 58 years old, and has 4 children, of which only one is under her care. Thanks to her work she can cover her family’s expenses, given that her husband works as a laborer but does not have a stable job. In the future she would like to open a store and next to it continue the sale of chickens given that she benefits from a good number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens wholesale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelly,

texts.es:
D. D. P.

Nelly ha cumplido quince años trabajando en su negocio D. venta D. pollo broster y salchipapas (frituras) en un puesto ambulante afuera D. su casa. Este negocio lo emprendió una vez que decidió tener un recurso propio D. dinero para poder ayudar con los gastos D. la casa. Es así que se decidió a dar lo mejor D. si, la comida.

Hoy en día, a sus sesenta y dos años, Nelly solo trabaja por las tardes. Con sus ganancias ha podido ayudar en los estudios D. sus seis hijos, actualmente todos mayores e independientes. Ella vive con dos D. sus hijas y con su esposo, jubilado D. una asociación minera. 

Mientras su buena salud se lo permita ella dice que continuará con su negocio y analizando la posibilidad D. abrir un restaurante en su propia casa.
texts.en:
D. D. P. For fifteen years, Nelly has been running her own roast chicken and fried salchipapa business outsiD. her house. She decided to start her business because she wanted her own income, to help with home expenses. She wanted her business to be the best she could make it, so she decided it would be a food business. These days, at sixty-two years old, Nelly works only in the afternoon. With profits from her business, she has been able to help her six children through school. Now, they are grown and independent. Nelly lives with two of her daughters, and her husband, who is a retired miner. Because of her good health, Nelly can say that she will continue to run her business, and is considering the possibility of opening a restaurant in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for preparing the foods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Giovana,

texts.es:
Con dos hijos de cinco y cuatro años, Giovana maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de frituras como ambulante en la puerta del mercado más cercano de su casa. Hace tres años que empezó este negocio, pues anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como pastelera en una pastelería. 

No obstante, cuando aún no tenía hijos ha tenido trabajos variados, como vendedora de baterías para carros o ayudante de venta en un puesto de abarrotes. Una vez que tuvo sus hijos decidió establecerse y tener un negocio propio.

Más adelante, Giovana asegura que abrirá una fuente de soda en su propia casa. Hoy se dedica a vender, no solo frituras, por ser temporada de verano también prepara jugos. Eventualmente trabaja cocinando bajo pedidos, para algún evento especial u otras actividades.
texts.en:
Giovana has two children (ages four and five), and manages a small fried-foods stall at the market nearest to her house. Before starting her business three years ago, Giovana worked as a baker at a pastry shop. Nevertheless, Giovana had to hold various jobs -- like selling car batteries or working in a grocery store -- even before having children. Once she had children, she decided to settle and start her own business. Later, Giovana opened a soda fountain in her own house; these days she is not only selling fried-foods, but also, but preparing and selling juices in the summertime. She may soon begin to take small orders for special events or other activities.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies for her two children

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maurilia

texts.es:
El mayor logro D. Maurilia, a sus cincuenta y ocho años, es haber construido trece habitaciones para el alquiler D. los mismos. Sin embargo, a pesar D. que ha sabido invertir bien su dinero ganado en base a su esfuerzo a lo largo D. quince años como pensionista D. trabajadores y como cocinera D. un concesionario D. alimentos en diversas empresas; ella aún no ha terminado D. cumplir sus metas.

Una vez que abandonó  su trabajo como cocinera, se dedicó a la atención D. sus hijos, especialmente D. su última hija quien había ingresado a la universidad. A parte, abrió un pequeño kiosco dentro D. su casa para continuar trabajando en algo y ocupar su tiempo.

Su esposo la apoya siempre, no solo con su ingreso D. su trabajo como chofer D. transporte en una empresa, sino en los proyectos que Maurilia tiene.

Aunque, dentro D. poco abrirá un restaurante en el primer piso D. su casa,  Maurilia no descarta la posibilidad D. abrir en un futuro D. abrir una Clínica junto con su hija que dentro D. poco terminará su carrera D. Obstetricia.
texts.en:
Maurilia biggest achievement at 58 years old is having built 13 rental houses. Despite the fact that she has done well investing the money she earned through 15 years of boarding workers and cooking concessions in various companies, she has not finished achieving her goals. Once she left her job as a cook, she turned her attention to her children, especially her youngest daughter, who had entered university. She opened a small kiosk in her house to keep working and occupy her time. Her husband always supports her, not only with his income as a transport company driver, but also in Maurilia's plans. Although she will soon open a restaurant on the first floor of her house, Maurilia does not precluD. the possibility of opening a clinic with her daughter once she finishes her Obstetrics degree.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino maneja junto con su esposa una tienda de abarrotes desde hace un par de años. Aunque lleva poco tiempo con los préstamos de  EDAPROSPO Faustino esta dispuesto a seguir creciendo como micro empresario y además de su tienda también participa en ferias de venta  en temporadas festivas. En estas fechas se encuentra vendiendo útiles escolares en una feria en su localidad, ya que en marzo empieza el año escolar en su país.

Por otro lado, en las tardes Faustino trabaja en viveros brindando servicio de mantenimiento. En este trabajo ya lleva más de cinco años. Poco a poco y a medida que transcurra el tiempo el quiere ver su tienda crecer, por lo que necesita continuar invirtiendo en la implementación de su local y aumento de mercadería.

Compra de mercadería
texts.en:
Faustino, together with his wife, has been managing a grocery store for a couple of years. Although he has been borrowing from EDAPROSPO for only a short time, Faustino is ready to continue growing as a small business owner and in addition to his store he also participates in markets set up during festivals and celebrations. These days he sells school supplies at a market in his neighbourhood because the school year starts in March in his country. In addition, in the evenings Faustino works in a nursery, providing maintenance services. He has had this job for more than five years. Slowly and over time he wants to see his store grow, for which he must continue investing in the establishment of his store and in the increase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Lucy

texts.es:
Desde hace cinco años. Mary Lucy vende productos de belleza desde hace cinco años. Empezó ayudando a un familiar a vender, pero luego se animo a ser una consultora de belleza y vender por su cuenta. 

A parte de este pequeño negocio, Mary Lucy se encarga también de vender cervezas desde hace doce años. Al inicio empezó este negocio vendiendo solo gaseosas, pero la competencia de las tiendas no permitía que su negocio creciera, entonces luego de observar al mercado se le ocurrió solo vender cervezas y en un horario  nocturno. 

Una parte del dinero que gana gracias a las cervezas es para ayudar a su mamá, que es una persona de tercera edad. En segundo lugar el dinero lo invierte en el estudio de sus hijos y ahora último, el ingreso de la venta de sus cosméticos los gasta en los medicamentos que, como asmática, ella requiere. Su esposo, quien trabaja como pintor de edificios, la ayuda con la mayoría de gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
For five years, Mary Lucy has been selling beauty products. She started out helping a family member by selling, but later decided to become a beauty consultant and to sell for herself. Besides this small business, Mary Lucy has been selling beer for 12 years. Initially, she started this business selling only soft drinks, but competition with other stores was stopping her business from growing and so after observing the market, she decided to sell only beer and to sell at nighttime. Part of the money she makes from beer sales goes to help her mother, a senior citizen. She also uses her income to invest in her children's studies and finally the money from her cosmetics' sales is used to pay for medications which she needs for her asthma. Her husband, who works painting buildings, helps her with the majority of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and her medication

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Del Rocio

texts.es:
G.

Siendo madre de tres hijos de diecisiete, once y cinco años y con tan solo treinta y ocho años de edad, Maria del Rocío aspira a ser toda una ejecutiva de éxito con la venta de sus productos de belleza.

Como consultora de belleza ya lleva cuatro años. Empezó con la idea de solo probar como le iba. Antes de eso trabajo por el tiempo de tres años ara una señora, en un pequeño taller de manualidades. Sin embargo, como le iba bien con la venta de cosméticos decidió a dedicarse solo a esto.

Actualmente, ella esta postulando a la empresa de cosméticos para ser directora de una red de venta propia. De este modo, ella estaría a cargo de una pequeña  empresa, por lo cual necesita formalizarse. En esta empresa, Maria estaría a cargo de brindar capacitaciones a nuevas mujeres que deseen vender cosméticos.

Gracias a su trabajo puede ayudar a su esposo a mantener a sus hijos y pagar los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
The mother of three children--ages 17, 11 and 5--and only 38 years old, Maria del Rocío aspires to become a successful executive through her beauty product sales. She has been a beauty consultant for four years. She started with the idea of just trying it. Previously, she had worked for another woman in a small crafts workshop. Since her cosmetics sales went well, she decided to work solely on this. Now, she is applying to the cosmetics company to be the director of her own sales network. Thus, she would be in charge of her own small company, which she needs to formalize. In this endeavor, Maria would be in charge of providing training to new women who want to sell cosmetics. Thanks to her work, she is able to help her husband support their children and cover their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Procedures to formalize company

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro empezó a sacar préstamo con EDAPROSPO desde hace más de dos años, porque necesitaba ayuda con las tasas y otros gastos de su carrera universitaria. 
A sus veintisiete años él ya es profesor de matemáticas en un colegio, y su negocio personal es dar clases particulares de matemáticas. Empezó a dar clases, en el colegio y particulares, hace casi cinco años, cuando empezó a estudiar en la universidad.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a ayudar a vender en la tienda de abarrotes de su mamá. Todavía ayuda en el negocio cuando es necesario, pero ahora está principalmente centrado en sus estudios.
Tras conseguir su titulo le gustaría abrir un negocio de ingeniería, planificación y construcción de edificios junto con unos amigos.
texts.en:
Pedro started borrowing from EDAPROSPO more than two years ago because he needed help paying his taxes and other expenses from his university studies. At 27 years of age, he is already a professor of mathematics in a high school and his business is one-on-one math tutoring. He began offering classes at the high school and to individuals almost five years ago when he began his university studies. Before that, he was working in her mother's grocery store, helping her with her sales. He still helps in the business when he is needed but now he is mainly focussed on his studies. Once he has his diploma, he would like to open an engineering, planning and building business in partnership with one of his friends.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Because his business did not need a large investment, he used his previous loan to pay some of his household expenses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
A sus cincuenta y seis años Rosa lleva toda su vida trabajando en la misma profesión: la confección de ropa bajo pedido, y en general, a la compra y venta de ropa.
Solo lleva ocho meses con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, pero como es viuda y sus tres hijas ya son mayores de edad e independientes económicamente ella puede dedicar los préstamos y todas sus ganancias a los pocos gastos de si misma y lo demás, invertirlo en su negocio.
De esta manera espera poder poner in negocio estable de compra y venta de ropa desde su propia casa, hasta un día llegar a tener una tienda.
texts.en:
At 56 years of age, Rosa has been in the same line of work her entire life: making clothing to order and generally buying and selling clothes. She has been borrowing from EDAPROSPO for only eight months, but because she is a widow and her three daughters are adults and financially independent she is able to use her loans and all her profits for her small personal expenses and invest the remainder of her income in her business. In this way she hopes to have a stable business buying and selling clothing out of her own home until she can some day open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She used her last loan to buy material for her clothing business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
A raíz de su viudez y a pesar de que contaba con el dinero de la pensión de su esposo, Nancy se vio en la necesidad de trabajar por cuenta propia. Ella siempre ha sido ama de casa. Desde que se caso se encargo del cuidado de sus cuatro hijos, quienes ahora son mayores y tienen su propia familia.

Una de sus hijas ha seguido sus pasos y así como su madre, ella también se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de bebé. Por estos días, Nancy se ocupa de cuidar al menor de sus nietos mientras, su hija se encarga del negocio. Esto solo hasta que el niño ingrese a estudiar en los próximos días, luego Nancy  retomara su trabajo.

Con su negocio no solo gana la sensación de sentirse útil o el dinero extra para los gastos de la casa, su negocio también le brinda la oportunidad de proyectarse en el futuro como una microempresaria. Más adelante, Nancy y su hija están pensando abrir una tienda-bazar en su misma casa.
texts.en:
Following the death of her husband, despite having money from his pension, Nancy found it necessary to work for herself. She had always been a housewife, in charge of caring for her four children, who are now grown and have their own families. One of her daughters followed in her footsteps, and, like her mother, sells baby clothes. These days, Nancy takes care of the youngest of her grandchildren while her daughter runs the business. She will continue doing this until he starts attending school, and then will return to her work. With her business, she not only feels useful and earns extra money to meet her needs, but it also gives her the opportunity to project herself as a microentrepreneur in the future. Later on, Nancy and her daughter would like to open a store-bazaar in their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria,

texts.es:
Hace dos años, María empezó a recibir los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, su negocio era la compra y venta de productos de belleza desde su casa. No obstante, como las ganancias de este negocio eran muy bajas y solo le alcanzaban para reinvertir un poco en el comercio mismo, hace seis meses dejó de dedicarse a esto para tener más tiempo y poder cuidar de sus hijos y su hogar. Sin embargo, un día le gustaría volver a darse un tiempo para poder empezar con este mismo negocio si logra obtener un buen capital de de negocio.

Anteriormente trabajaba en un consultorio por el tiempo de tres años llevando un ingreso más al hogar. Por ahora es su esposo es quien se encarga de mantener el hogar, trabajando como profesor universitario.
texts.en:
Two years ago, María began receiving loans from EDAPROSPO. Her business was in the purchase and sales of beauty products from her home.
