However, because the earnings from this business were very low, it only was enough to reinvest a small amount back into the business. Six months ago, she left the business to have more time and be able to take care of her children and home. However, one day she would like to return to this same business if she is able to obtain good business capital.

Previously, she worked as a consultant for three years to provide an income to bring home. For now, her husband is the one who is in charge of maintaining the home, working as a university professor.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay an outstanding debt

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Chavarria Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Chavarría esta conformado por Paula C. y Juana del Carmen M. Chavarría ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas que realizan son las siguientes: Doña Paula tiene 49 años y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales todos trabajan y estudian, su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos que realiza desde 4 años. La Señora Juana del Carmen tiene 45 años es soltera, tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a una pulpería tiene mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio ambas tratan de salir adelante con sus negocios por lo que su ayuda principal es recurrir a los financiamientos por lo que ahora solicitan la cantidad de C$ 4.000 córdobas cada una ya que es necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus negocio. en los sueños de ambas esta que cada una posea un negocio estable que le proporciones los ingresos necesarios para vivir.
texts.en:
The Solidario Chavarría group is made up of Paula C. and Juana del Carmen M. Chavarría. Both are in different economic activities as follows: Doña Paula is 49 years old and has 6 children, all of whom work and study. She sells soft drinks and has done so for 4 years. Juana del Carmen is 45 years old. She’s single and has 2 children. She has had a small store for more than six years. Both women are trying to get ahead with their businesses, for which financing would be a major help. They ask for C$ 4.000 ($200 USD) each, which is necessary to satisfy the needs of their businesses. Both women dream of each having a stable business that provides them with the needed income to live on.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela ha estado trabajando en su profesión desde que acabó sus estudios de Diseño de moda en 1994.
Ella confecciona ropa con máquinas industriales profesionales, pero no hace producción al por mayor, solamente trabaja bajo pedido de clientes.
Marisela logra contribuir en una menor parte de los gastos de la casa y de la crianza de sus dos hijas de dieciséis y veinticinco años gracias a sus ganancias, lo demás gastos los cubre su esposo.
Aunque tiene ocho años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, Marisela quiere mantener el nivel de su negocio en el cual está ahora, porque por ahora no cuenta con más tiempo que el que requiere para cumplir con  todos los pedidos.
texts.en:
Marisela has been working in her profession since completing her Fashion Design studies in 1994. She makes clothing using professional industrial machines, but does not create wholesale, rather only by special order. Marisela manages to contribute in a small way to the household expenses and to the upbringin of her two daughters, aged 16 and 25, thanks to her income; the remaining expenses are paid by her husband. Although she has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for eight years, Marisela wants to maintain her level of business where it is now, because for now she does not have enough time to satisfy her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She invested in material for her clothes-making business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pablo ,

texts.es:
A sus sesenta y cinco años, Pablo ya lleva algunos años como jubilado por su desempeño en un taller de metalurgia y de ensamblaje de autos. Hace un tiempo perdió a su esposa, con quien tuvo cinco hijos que ahora ya son mayores e independientes

Por mantenerse ocupado y con la idea de asegurar un ingreso extra a su hogar, Pablo, decidió hace quince años emprender un pequeño negocio con la venta de abarrotes. En su casa él comparte los gastos con una de sus hijas.

Por ahora, en la tardes se desenvuelve como administrador de un cementerio. Cuando termine su contrato en este trabajo tiene planeado conseguir más capital y darle un mayor impulso a su tienda.

Compra de abarrotes para su tienda
texts.en:
At 65 years of age, Pablo has already been retired from his job in a metallurgy workshop and in car assembly. A while ago he lost his wife, with whom he had five children who are now grown and independent. To keep busy and to ensure extra income for his household, Pablo decided five years ago to open a small business selling groceries. He shares his household expenses with one of his daughters. Now, in the evenings, he works as an administrator in a cemetary. When this contract is over, he intends to make more income and use it to give a boost to his store. To buy groceries for his store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for his store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Demetrio Calixtro

texts.es: El Señor Demetrio Calixtro L. García tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Demetrio tiene 2 hijos que estudian y trabajan. La actividad económica de Don Demetrio es una pulpería. Hace más de siete años que se dedica a este negocio  y comenzó con la venta de golosinas con la ayuda de los financiamientos que Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones le han otorgado el ha podido mejorar su negocio. Los propósitos de Don Demetrio son de seguir manteniendo este pequeño negocio ya que es su principal ayuda en ingresos. El financiamiento es necesario para su capital de trabajo ya que administra de buena de forma el dinero por que recurre a las compras de productos como granos básicos, pollo, carne, queso y gaseosa. Sus deseos son de obtener una tienda de ropa por que le gustaría conocer otro tipo de negocio. la cantidad necesaria es de C$ 6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Demetrio Calixtro L. García is 52 years old. He is single. Don Demetrio has two children who work and study. Dom Demetrio has a small store. He has had the store for more than seven years and began by selling candies with the help of financing from Fundación León 2000. He has been able to improve his business with the organizations that have funded him. Dom Demetrio’s goals are to continue in this small business, as it is his major source of income. This loan is necessary for working capital to be put to good use in the purchase of products such as basic grains, chicken, meat, cheese and sodas. His goal is to obtain a clothing store, because he would like to learn another type of business. The loan is for C$6,000 córdobas ($300 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margarita Timotea,

texts.es:
Margarita ya lleva cuatro años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO. En este tiempo los ha invertido en la mejora de su negocio vendiendo comida desde un pequeño puesto ambulante.
Empezó a dedicarse a este trabajo hace catorce años. Las circunstancias para las cuales se animó a comenzar fueron bastante drásticas. Ladrones entraron a su casa y le robaron todo, dejando su familia, ya pobre, en una situación aún peor. Entonces, para ayudar en la recuperación del nivel de vida después del robo empezó con su propio negocio.

Desde entonces ha ido bien, creciendo poco a poco, hasta ahora que gana bastante para contribuir de igual manera a su esposo a los gastos del hogar y de la crianza de la última hija menor de edad que todavía vive con ellos.

Habiendo llegado hasta este nivel con su negocio, a sus cincuenta años sueña poder, en un futuro, poder abrir un restaurante para tener un comercio más estable para la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Margarita has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for four years. During this time she has invested the majority of the money in her business selling food from a small mobile stand. She began this work 14 years ago. The circumstances surrounding this decision to start her business were rather dire. Robbers entered her home and robbed everything, leaving her family, which was already poor, in an even worse situation. So, to help restore their standard of living after the robbery she began her own business Since then her business has gone well, growing little by little, until now when she is earning enough to contribute in an equal manner as her husband, to the household expenses and to raising their youngest daughter who is still young and lives with them. Having arrived at this level with her business, at 50 years old she dreams of being able, in the future, to open a restaurant in order to have a more stable business to sell her food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an awning for her small mobile food stand

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Fransisca

texts.es:
Juana Francisca P. C. tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es soltera. 
Doña Juana la actividad económica es la venta de ropa ella inicio este negocio hace mas de nueve años que se dedica a este negocio y por la necesidad de obtener un medio de ingreso para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Juana son de son de invertir en su capital de trabajo para obtener más ingresos. El financiamiento esta destinado a capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de más ropa. Sus sueños son de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por que le gustaría realizarle mejoras. La cantidad es de C$ 6.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca P. C. is 59 years old and single. Juana sells clothing. She began this business more than 9 years ago and she has this business as her means of generating income for her family. Juana plans to invest the loan into working capital in order to generate more income. The financing will be used as working capital because she needs to buy more clothing. Her dreams are make home improvements on her home. She is seeking C$6.000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: William,

texts.es:
William es un padre de familia muy trabajador, con tres hijos de nueve y siete años y el último de tan solo tres meses. Hace tres años que cuenta con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO; sin embargo, en su trabajo como mecánico, cerrajero y de planchado de carros, es decir pintado de autos, ya lleva en total diez años, siendo independiente. Anteriormente estuvo trabajando como soldador para una compañía, fue ahí donde tomo la mayoría de sus conocimientos que le sirvieron mas adelante para tener su pequeño taller en su propia casa.

Su esposa es principalmente ama de casa, pero de vez en cuando lo ayuda en el pintado de los autos y ómnibus. En el futuro, ambos, quisieran reunir el capital suficiente para implementar en su pequeño local un taller de factoría.
texts.en:
William is a hard-working father of a family of three children ages 9, 7, and 3 months. 3 years ago he began working with EDAPROSPO; nevertheless in his work as a mechanic, locksmith and auto body repair, in other words, painting cars, he has 10 years of experience as an independent businessman. Previously he worked as a welder for a company and it is there that he learned the majority of his knowledge that has enabled him to subsequently have his small shop in his own home. His wife is primarily a housewife, but every now and then she helps him painting cars and minibuses. In the future both would like to have enough capital in order to open a small factory shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto shop paint

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Clara Lucila,

texts.es:
Clara se crió en el negocio de la venta de comida, su mamá tenía un carro de venta de comida ambulante y, al igual que su hermana, llevó adelante la tradición familiar. 
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de varias comidas desde un puestito en el mercado, pero ya hace diez años conduce su negocio desde su casa: vende menús por el almuerzo y comida en la noche bajo pedido, llevando los menús a la casa de los clientes.

Sus hijos de veintiún, veinte, dieciséis y quince años todavía viven con ella y, como es ella quien sigue encargándose de ellos, ellos la ayudan en su negocio. Clara utiliza sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio y juntarse a su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la familia.

A sus cuarenta y cinco años, después de dos años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, sueña poder un día agrandar y estabilizar su negocio de comida hasta tener un restaurante propio.
texts.en:
Clara was raised in the food-selling business; her mother sold food from a cart, and, along with her sister, Clara carries on this family tradition. In the past she sold various types of food from a little stand in the market, but for the past 10 years she has conducted business from her home. She sells prepared meals at lunchtime, and pre-ordered food in the evening, which she delivers to her customers' homes. Her children, ages 21, 20, 16, and 15, all still live with her, and, because she continues to look after them, they all help her with her business. Clara uses her earnings to reinvest in supplies for her business and, in combination with her husband's earnings, to cover household and family expenses. At age 45, after two years of receiving loans de EDAPROSPO, she dreams of one day growing and stabilizing her business enough to have a restaurant of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invirtió en ingredientes para los menús que vende.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fany,

texts.es:
Fany heredó el negocio de su mamá. Empezó a dedicarse a la venta de desayuno y almuerzo cuando tenía dieciocho años y quedó embarazada con su única hija, al inicio ayudando a su mamá con el puestito ambulante que tenía afuera del mercado. 

Cuando su mamá ya no pudo trabajar más, Fany se hizo cargo de seguir trabajando con el carrito de comida. Con sus ganancias cubre los gastos que alcanza, pero también recibe una ayuda mensual de su pareja conviviente para cubrir los gastos de la crianza de su única hija de once años.
Después de tres años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO ya ha estabilizado su negocio hasta tener clientes fijos, y por esta razón a sus veintinueve años pronto espera poder abrir un restaurante contando en esta misma clientela.
texts.en:
Fany inherited her mother’s business. She began selling breakfast and lunch when she was 18 years old and pregnant with her only daughter, in the beginning helping her mother with the little mobile stand that she had outside the market. When her mother could no longer work, Fany took over the business and continued working with the food cart. With her earnings she covers the expenses, but she also receives monthly help from her live-in partner to cover the expenses of raising her 11 year old daughter. After three years working with EDAPROSPO she has stabilized her business and has steady customers, and for this reason, at 29 years old, she hopes to be able to soon open a restaurant counting on this same clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partly in her business and the other part in her daughter’s school supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Modesta,

texts.es:
Modesta se dedica a su negocio desde hace quince años, pero solo los últimos cinco ha estado alquilando un puesto en el mercado de Vitarte. Ahora vende productos naturales y hierbas medicinales, mientras que anteriormente vendía productos de limpieza en el mercado de Caquetá.
Recién su segunda hija se unió a ella en su negocio, y ahora las dos  reciben préstamos de EDAPROSPO y juntas invierten en las hierbas y los productos naturales para ir agrandando su comercio.
Modesta lleva tres años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO que le permiten invertir sus ganancias en los estudios de sus cuatro hijos, de veintitrés, veinte, dieciocho y seis años, y juntar, lo que sobra, a las ganancias de su esposo, que tiene una tiendita de abarrotes, para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Más adelante le gustaría invertir en su negocio poniendo vitrinas para exhibir sus productos más ordenadamente en su puesto, y así seguir mejorando en el negocio.
texts.en:
Modesta has had her business for 15 years, but has only been renting a space in the Vitarte Market for the past five. She now sells natural products and medicinal herbs. She used to sell cleaning products in the Caquetá market. Her second oldest daughter recently joined her in business and now they both get loans from EDAPROSPO. Together they invest in herbs and natural products so they can grow the business. Modesta has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for three years, which allows her to invest her earnings in her four children's studies. Her children are 23, 20, 18, and 6 years old. She gives what is left of her earnings to her husband, who has a small grocery store, to help cover their household expenses. In the future, she would like to invest more in her business. She would like to put in glass cases to exhibit her products in a more orderly way. In this way she could continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invirtió en medicinas por que su hijo se calló enfermo y necesitaba curas urgentes.

loans.name: Emercio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la cuidad de Chinandega, el señor Emercio Q. se dedica a su actividad de venta de gas para cocinar vendiendo los cilindros en su propia casa de habitación el cual es visitado a diario por los usuarios de gas cercanos a su localidad.

Actualmente el señor Emerco ha decidido salira adelante en el negocio y debido a que se le están agotando los cilindros, ha decidido hacer un préstamo en Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos y así comercializarlos en su localidad y continuar beneficiando a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Emercio Q. lives in Chinandega in the area of Somotillo. He sells cooking gas for a living, selling the gas cylinders from his home. Many people from the area use this gas and visit his home daily. Currently Mr. Emercio has decided to try to get ahead in his business. Since his cylinders are almost empty, he has decided to take a loan from Ceprodel so he can buy more. In this way, he can make a business out of them for his area. By dong this, he will also be able to continue to provide for his family, who really need his support.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de los cilindros de gas

loans.name: Liz Elizabeth,

texts.es:
Liz empezó a trabajar en el mercado vendiendo ropa y productos cosméticos hace dos años. No obstante, hace seis meses el puesto que alquilaba fue vendido por el dueño, y ella se encontró sin una base para conducir su negocio. Entonces decidió juntarse a su mamá en su negocio de venta de productos naturales y hierbas medicinales.
Aunque desde hace ocho meses está sacando préstamos con EDAPROSPO para invertir en este negocio, sus planes para el futuro no son de seguir vendiendo en el mercado.
Liz tiene veinte años, y además de tener este negocio con su mamá también estudia Inglés y Diseño, y espera en un futuro poder empezar una empresa de diseño y dedicarse por entero a esta profesión.
texts.en:
Two years ago, Liz began working in the market selling clothing and cosmetics. However, six months ago the owner sold the space she rented. She found herself without a base from which to conduct her business. So she decided to join her mother selling natural products and medicinal herbs. Although she has been getting loans to invest in this business from EDAPROSPO for eight months, she does not plan to keep selling in the market in the future. Liz is 20 years old. In addition to having this business with her mother, she also studies English and design. She hopes to be able to start a design business in the future and dedicate herself to this profession full-time.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invirtió en mercancía para su negocio de productos naturales y hierbas medicinales.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es: Dámaso R. R. tiene 61 años, su estado civil es soltero. Tiene dos hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Dámaso es la venta de productos básicos de cocina como achote, canela, pimienta, sal, comino. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio ya que dio inicio a este comienzo por iniciativa propia y mas tarde decide realizar financiamiento para su negocio y es así como ha salido adelante. Los propósitos de Don Dámaso es realizar la suficiente compra de sus productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que así vendería al por mayor. Sus deseos son tener un negocio estable ya que actualmente la manera e la que vende sus productos es de forma ambulante. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 19.000
texts.en:
Dámaso R. R. is 61 years old and single. He has two children who study. Dámaso sells basic cooking products such as achote, cinnamon, pepper, salt, and cumin. He has had this business for more than 5 years, starting on his own initiative and then seeking financing for his business so it may be successful. Dámaso plans on buying a supply of products to sell his customers. The financing is for working capital as he would sell at wholesale. His wishes are to have a stable business as today the way he sells his product is through traveling sales. The quantity he seeks is C$ 19.000

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paula Angelica,

texts.es:
Paula se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa y chompas de ambulante desde hace más de treinta años. Sin embargo, aún antes de empezar con este negocio siempre ha estado trabajando para si misma, hace algún tiempo vendiendo pollos.
Ya lleva tres años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, y a sus cincuenta y seis años espera poder en un futuro estabilizar su negocio poniendo una tienda para vender su ropa.
Paula tiene ocho hijos, cinco de los cuales ya son mayores e independientes económicamente. Paula utiliza sus ganancias, junto a las de su pareja conviviente, para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la crianza de los demás.
texts.en:
Paula has had a business selling clothing and sweaters for more than 30 years. She used to sell as vendor, on foot. Before she started that business [selling clothing], she had worked for herself selling chickens. She has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for 3 years, and at 56 years old hopes to be able to establish her business more. She'd like to have a store she can sell her clothing in. Paula has eight children, five of whom are already of age and are financially independent. Paula uses her earnings, together with her partner’s, to cover the household expenses, and to help raise the rest of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invirtió en mercancía para su negocio de venta de ropa.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
A sus veintinueve años María ya tiene un negocio bien establecido de moto taxis junto a su esposo. Ya llevan ocho años con el alquiler de sus mototaxis, y cuando es necesario su esposo también sale a conducirlos.
Recibe préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace cuatro años, y así puede utilizar sus ganancias para invertir en el capital de su negocio, por ejemplo comprar más moto taxis.
Como el negocio es de los dos, María y su esposo juntos cubren los gastos del hogar y de la crianza de sus cuatro hijos, de diez, cuatro, tres años, más uno recién nacido.
Aunque su negocio va bastante bien, a María le gustaría en un futuro cambiar de profesión y abrir un restaurante, mientras su esposo se podría encargar de la empresa de moto taxis.
texts.en:
At 29 years of age, María already has a well established business of motorcycle taxis with her husband. They have rented their motorcycle taxis for eight years, and, when necessary, her husband also operates them.

She has received loans from EDAPROSPO for four years, and therefore can use the principal to invest in capital for her business, for example to buy more motorcycle taxis.

As the business belongs to both of them, María and her husband cover the household expenses and the upbringing of their four children, ages 10, 4, 3, and a newborn.

Even though her business is going fairly well, María would like in the future to change professions and open a restaurant while her husband could continue to operate the business of motorcycle taxis.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invested in various maintenance expenses for her motorcycle taxis

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es:
Ermanda se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza desD. hace un año. Entró a este negocio porque algunos familiares suyos se lo aconsejaron por lo mismo que ellos se dedicaban a esto y les iba muy bien.
Anteriormente vendía golosinas y caramelos como ambulante, siendo su trabajo casi toda su vida, pero ahora prefiere no salir a la calle y andar tanto; el negocio D. productos D. belleza le permite trabajar desD. su casa, por lo que quiere seguir en este comercio e ir agrandándolo.

Ermanda es madre soltera, pero su único hijo ya tiene años; ella contribuye cubriendo los gastos del hogar. 

Por otro lado, ya lleva un año siendo presidente D. su Alcancía Comunal. Este grupo se juntó hace cinco años, empezando con veintiséis socias que vivían todas en el mismo vecindario. Ahora son solamente once, porque poco a poco algunas socias dejaron el grupo ya que se mudaban a otro distrito, en otra ciudad. En general dicen que el comercio D. todas ha ido levantándose desD. que empezaron con los préstamos D. EDAPROSPO, “antes no sabíamos” mucho sobre como conducir bien un negocio, pero ahora han ido aprendido bastante.
texts.en:
Ermanda has dedicated herself to the sale of beauty products for the past year. She entered into this business because some of her relatives recommended it, as they are doing the same thing, and it is going well for them. Previously, she sold sweets and candies as a traveling sales person. She had done this work nearly all her life but now she prefers not to go out and walk so much. The business of beauty products allows her to work from home, and for that reason, she wants to continue with this work and go about increasing it. Ermanda is a single mother, but her only child is grown and she contributes to cover the household expenses. In another aspect, she has already served one year as president of the community township. This group came together five years ago starting with twenty-six participating partners that lived in the same neighborhood. Now they are only eleven because little by little some partners left the group as they moved to another district, in another city. In general they say that all of the business has been picking up since they started with the loans from EDAPROSPO, “before we didn’t know” much about how to manage a good business, but now we are learning.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ermanda, the president of the township group, will use this latest loan to invest more in the business and buy more beauty products.  The other participating partners will invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Mabia

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’agoè gbonvié, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, son mari est un chauffeur. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de boisson locale appelé toucoutou faite à base de farine de sorgho et très appréciée au Togo surtout au nord. Ce commerce lui permet d’aider son mari car le revenu de son mari est insuffisant pour subvenir aux charges du foyer. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, actuellement son stock de matière nécessaire à la fabrication du toucoutou est épuisé c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages un prêt pour l’achat d’un sac de sorgho
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Agoè Gbonvié neighborhood, she's married to a driver and the mother of 4 children. Her business consists in selling a local beverage called "toucoutou", made out of sorghum flour and very much appreciated in Togo, especially in the North. This business enables her to help her husband, because his income does not suffice to pay for the household expenses. She's been running this business since 1999, and she's currently out of stock of raw materials required to make "toucoutou". She's thus seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to buy a sack of sorghum.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one sack of sorghum

loans.name: Yagliba

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’agoè telessou un quartier au nord de  Lomé, elle a pour activité la vente de boisson locale qui est très apprécié au Togo et est faite à base de farine de sorgho, sa production a diminué. Elle voudrait rehausser sa production c’est pourquoi elle s’est adressée à wages pour demander un crédit afin de pouvoir s’acheter un sac de sorgho. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Agoè Telessou neighborhood, in the north of Lomé. Her business consists in selling a local beverage, very much appreciated in Togo, and made out of sorghum flour. Her production has decreased, and she would like to bolster it. So she turned to Kiva's partner WAGES to seek a loan in order to buy a sack of sorghum. She's married and the mother of 5 children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one sack of sorghum

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Doña María  tiene la edad de 42 años, reside en el  barrio Villa Reconciliación, estado civil casada, tiene un hijo varón de la edad de 16 años actualmente estudia. Los planes para el bienestar de su familia es mejorar el nivel de vida para su hijo y su esposo por que trabajando juntos lograran alcanzar las metas y también lograr que   su hijo sea un profesional. La señora Maria desde hace seis años inicio su propio negocio de venta de cereales como: pinolillo, cebada y tortilla un producto muy consumido por los Nicaragüense y elaborado por su propietaria. Los proyectos para su negocio es incrementar las ventas por medio del incremento de su producción. La solicitud de su préstamo en Afodenic es para comprar materia prima tales como: Maíz, cacao, canela, soya, cal (se utiliza para nesquizar es maíz y elaborar las tortillas), cebada, semilla de jícaro y introducir al comercio otros productos: cuajadas, crema y queso.
texts.en:
Dona Maria is 42 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. She is married and has a 16-year-old son who presently studies. The plans for the well-being of her family are to improve the lifestyle for her son and husband. By working together, they will succeed in reaching their goals and also succeed in getting their son to be a professional.

Mrs. Maria started her own business about six years ago and sells cereals such as; pinolillo [sweet cornmeal and cocoa], barley and tortilla, a popular product consumed by Nicaraguans which she makes herself. Her business projects are to increase the sales incrementally through increased production. The loan request through Afodenic is to buy principal materials such as: corn, cocoa, cinnamon, soy, lime mineral (used for the nixtamalization process of the corn and preparation of tortillas), barley, jicaro seeds and the introduction of other products: curds, cream and cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, cocao, soy, lime mineral and other products for her business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette dame a pour activité la vente de friperies, elle fait ce commerce dans le marché de totti et de façon ambulante, elle-même habite vakpossito, un quartier périphérique d’agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2007 et elle s’approvisionne au marché de hedzranawoé qui est le second marché le plus animé de lomé. Elle veut agrandir son commerce c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages un prêt pour s’acheter un balle de friperie. Elle est célibataire et avec le bénefice de son commerce elle subvient à ses propres besoins et aux besoins de certains membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman's lives in Vakpossito, a suburban neighborhood in Agoè in the north of Lomé. Her business consists in selling second-hand clothing, at the Totti market or as an ambulant saleswoman. She has been in this business since 2007, and gets her supplies at the Hedzranawoé market, the second busiest market in Lomé. She wants to bolster her business, and she's thus seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to purchase a bale of second-hand clothing. She's single, and with her profits, she provides for herself and for other members of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell second-hand clothing

loans.name: Dominga Clementina

texts.es: La señora Dominga tiene 50 años de edad, vive un barrio de la capital de Managua, casada, tiene tres hijos independientes de ellos. Ofrece el servicio de costura desde hace cuatro años, iniciándolo con el objetivo de adquirir un ingreso económico mas para el hogar y aprovechando la zona en donde habitaba que existía una demanda el sector de muelle de los bueyes, es un puerto. Ser costurera es un oficio honesto que lo ejecuta en su propia casa dejándole tiempo para formar nuevos proyectos de negocios como la venta de ropa elaboradas por ella y productos tales como: Zapatos, cosméticos y ropas extranjeras. Siendo un medio más de incremento en la economía de la señora Dominga.El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de productos para comercializar, productos como: tela, hilo, botones, elástico, cosméticos, zapatos, blusas, pantalones y otros. Generándole mayores utilidades y ofreciéndose una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Dominga is 50 years old and lives in a neighborhood in the capital city Managua. She is married and has three independent adult children. She has been offering sewing services for four years. She started the work in order to bring in additional income for her household. She took advantage of the demand that there was in the area where she lived, Muelle de los Bueyes, which is a port. Being a seamstress is honest work that she can do in her own home, which leaves her time to start new business projects, including selling the clothes that she makes and other products such as shoes, cosmetics and imported clothes. All of this helps improve Dominga's economic situation. The loan that she has requested is for the purchase of materials for her business, such as fabric, thread, buttons, elastic, cosmetics, shoes, blouses, pants, etc. This will produce more profit and give her more economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread and other goods

loans.name: Mujeres Que Luchan Por El Progreso Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres que Luchan por el Progreso”, or Women Fighting for Progress, is a group of five women entrepreneurs seeking their first loan from Esperanza International.  This group hopes to use their first microfinance loan to finance current businesses, or in the case of the group’s coordinator, Leoncia, finance two new entrepreneurial activities.  

Leoncia, mother of 5 (ages: youngest 16, oldest 30) resides in Santiago and plans to split her loan funds amongst three different entrepreneurial activities.  For as long as she can remember, Leoncia has been selling corn and ice-cream from her house and to local “colmados”, or small grocery stores.  In addition to this business, Leoncia plans to finalize the start of two new product sales: candy and shoes.  Leoncia will make her own candy from her house and similarly to her corn and ice-cream sales, will sell the candy in two different-sized packages from her home and at local colmados.  Leoncia will also sell shoes for men, women and children through catalog sales.  Leoncia is dedicated to the repayment of her loan since she wants to own her own home.    

Other members of Leoncia’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including undergarment, fried food, accessory, and cloth sales.    

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase materials for food and shoe sales

loans.name: José

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León el señor José A. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de ganadería el cual atiende con mucho esfuerzo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Su principal actividad es la crianza de vacas el cual les saca el máximo provecho extrayendo la leche para después comercializarla. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual acude a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de vaquillas y de esta forma continuar en su actividad ganadera que tanto requiere de su apoyo para desarrollarla.
texts.en:
Mr. José A. earns his living by raising livestock in the borough of El Sauce in the city of León. He works very hard at his business to provide a living for his family.

He maximizes his earnings on breeding livestock by milking the cows, and then selling the milk. Today he has turned to Ceprodel because he hopes to receive a loan in order to buy additional heifer cows so that he can continue to grow his livestock business. Your support will make this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Claudio Cambon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Heifer Cows

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Proposito Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas con Proposito”, or Women United with Purpose, is a group of five women entrepreneurs seeking their first microfinance loan from Esperanza International.  All but one member of this bank, who already operates an entrepreneurial activity, plan to use their first loan to begin their first business and take a step towards bettering their financial and living situation. It is an exciting time for this bank and community.

Yovaira, the coordinator for this group in the city of Santiago, declares that she wants to triumph. Yovaira, mother of two children (ages: 4, and 5 months), plans to sell cooking oil and bedding from her home and throughout the streets of her neighborhood.  She declares that she wants to provide for her two children and give them a better standard of living.

Other members of Yovaira’s microfinance bank plan to create similar entrepreneurial activities including a washing and ironing business, shoes, clothing and paper sales.  

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase Oil and Bedding to Sell

loans.name: Paula Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Paula Z. es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado desarrollar su negocio de venta de verduras en el Mercado Central de Chinandega donde a diario vende sus perecederos  a sus clientes que le visitan.

Hoy en día ha logrado salir adelante y para ello se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel por lo que los ha utilizado para la compra de las verduras y esta es la razón por la cual muy confiadamente acude a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada con un crédito y así continuar en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Paula Z. is a very hard-working person who has been able to build up her business selling vegetables in Chinandega's Central Market, where she sells perishable goods to her customers every day.

She has been successful with the help of loans that she has received from Ceprodel. She has used those loans to purchase vegetables and this gives her the confidence to turn to Ceprodel in the hopes of receiving a loan that will allow her to continue her economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad Group

texts.en:
“Jesus es Prosperidad” is a group of 10 women entrepreneurs seeking their third loan from Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. The group’s past two loans have been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize additional loan funds to further business expansion and allow for additional profits.

Angela is one of the coordinators of this group in the city of Santiago. Angela, mother of four married children and grandmother to nine grandchildren, operates clothing sales from her home and throughout the streets of Santiago. She declares business is well and Dominicans love to buy clothing. Angela’s past loan performance demonstrates a commitment to her goal of improving the life of her grandchildren and providing for their physical needs.

Other members of Angela’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including food, clothing and variety sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase Clothing to Sell

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres Luchadoras,” or Fighting Women, is a group of 15 women entrepreneurs seeking additional loan funds from Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. The group’s past loans have been successfully repaid and the group hopes to utilize additional loan funds to further business expansion and increase profit levels.

Marisol is one of the coordinators for the group in the city of Santiago. Marisol, mother of three (ages: 14, 5, 1), operates clothing and shoe sales from her home and throughout the streets of her neighborhood. Marisol dreams of improving the lives of her children and being able to pay for their physical needs through the profits of her business. Marisol’s past loan performance demonstrates a dedication to this goal.

Other members of Marisol’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities, including a “colmado” or small grocery store, a small restaurant, beauty supplies and undergarment sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia cuenta con 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja por más de 10 años y tiene 2 hijos. Actualmente viven en casa de sus padres que ya están ancianos y vela por ellos. Por más de 19 años ha trabajado como cosmetóloga, hace 5 años incursionó en la venta de perfumes y otros cosméticos, pero lo que es más rentable para Alicia es en su salón de belleza; ya que la única inversión que hace es en los productos para realizar los peinados y tintes, y es justamente este tipo de productos lo que le ocasionan dolores en las manos, porque son sustancias con gran cantidad de alcohol. Pero al margen de sus dificultades, su salón de belleza le permite ganar a diario entre 40 y 45 soles, y en tiempos de fiestas y balies de promoción escolar acumula 70 soles al día. Ganancias que comparte con sus padres, e hijos y es lo que la alienta y motiva a seguir trabajando. Debido a la demanda por sus servicios está pensando comprar la casa que alquila donde actualmente tiene su negocio, por ser un lugar céntrico y muy concurrido. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, está muy motivada de trabajar y ser parte de su banco comunal, por lo que hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente todas las cuotas señaladas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de sustancias usadas para el ondulado de cabello, así como tintes de diversos colores y marcas según la exigencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alicia is 39 years old. She has lived with her partner for mO. than 10 years and has 2 children. They currently live in the home of her elderly parents and she cares for them. She has worked as a beautician for mO. than 19 years and 5 years ago started selling perfumes and other cosmetics, but her beauty salon is what is most profitable, since the only investment that she makes is in the styling and coloring products. Those products also cause her pain in her hands because they contain high levels of alcohol. Despite these difficulties, her beauty salon allows her to earn 40 to 45 soles per day, and in holiday and school graduation periods she earns 70 soles per day. She shares her earnings with her parents and children, which is what motivates her to keep working. Due to the demand for her services, she is thinking about buying the building that she currently rents for her business, because of its well-trafficked, central location. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very motivated to work and be part of her community bank, which is why she promises to be punctual with all of the payments required by her credit advisor. The money that she is requesting is for the purchase of products used in permanent waves, as well a different colors and brands of hair dye as requested by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for beauty salon

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina cuenta con 53 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos viven con ella en su casa propia. En los años atrás cuando aun vivía su esposo vivían en su casa de la chacra, haciendo trabajos agrícolas y solo los fines de semana Cristina se dedicaba a la venta de quesos los cuales compraba cada viernes de las señoras de las chacras, y los domingos los comercializaba en la feria; este negocio le dejaba muy buenas ganancias. Al crecer sus hijos e ir abandonando el hogar y con la muerte de su esposo Cristina decidió “colgar las lampas” y dejar al agricultura, vendió algunos terrenos y con sus ahorros compró una casa en la ciudad, donde actualmente tiene una bodega que va creciendo poco a poco. Con este negocio empieza sus labores a las 6.00am de la mañana y termina de atender a las 10.00pm, los días que tiene que salir a comprar su mercadería se turna con sus hijos que aun viven con ella para no cerrar y perder clientes. De esta forma Cristina sigue luchando por su bienestar y el futuro de sus menores hijos. Con la formación de su banco comunal está muy contenta por ser parte de MFP, ya que es la primera vez que tiene la oportunidad de trabajar con crédito lo que le está permitiendo a ahorrar y la alienta a seguir trabajando. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de mercadería, con la finalidad de surtir su bodega, para de ese modo tratar de captar mayores ingresos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old, and has six sons, 2 of whom still live at home. When her husband was still alive, they lived in their farmhouse and practiced agriculture. On weekends Cristina sold cheese. Every Friday Cristina would buy cheese from other women on neighboring farms and then on Sunday she would sell it at the outdoor market. This business was very profitable. When her sons grew up and left home, and after her husband died, Cristina decided to "hang up her spurs," and stop farming. She sold some land and with her savings she bought a house in the city, where she currently has a store that is growing little by little. Her working day begins at 6:00 AM, and generally ends at about 10:00 PM. On the days when she has to go out to buy merchandise, she leaves her sons who still live at home in charge so as not to have to close shop and lose customers. Cristina works hard to provide for her well-being and the future of her younger sons. She is very happy to be a part of the recently formed MFP communal bank; this has been her first opportunity to work with loans, which has allowed her to save, and has encouraged her to keep working. The money she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to stock her business, and thereby generate greater income from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Claudio Cambon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha cuenta con 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, actualmente está viviendo en la casa que heredó de su padre. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, a las 4.00am inicia el amasando de los bollos en la panadería y a las 6.00am se ubica en el parque de su pueblo con la canasta de panes, vende hasta las 8.00am, luego regresa a casa hasta las 2pm para preparar los alimentos y atender a sus hijos, para que después comience nuevamente el amasado de los panes para la hora del lonche (refrigerio al anochecer) ubicándose en el parque de su pueblo, hasta  las 7.00pm. Pese a ser muy cansado su trabajo Martha dice estar muy contenta porque le agrada vender y estar en contacto con la gente. Cada día inicia con un capital de 20 a 30 soles, de los cuales sus ganancias se incrementan hasta 50 o 60 soles. Ella nos comenta su alegría por su  negocio, pese a sus dificultades de salud, por madrugar constantemente y trabajar en el intenso frío. Una de sus metas futuras es comprar una casa para poner una pequeña tienda donde vender varios productos y dejar el parque y el frío, así captar mayores ingresos económicos para su hogar y para el bienestar de sus hijos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar los pagos correspondientes de acuerdo el cronograma fijado por el asesor de crédito de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita Martha es para la compra de sacos de harina para la elaboración de sus panes.
texts.en:
Martha is 42 years old, a single mother, has four children, and currently is living in the house that she inherited from her father. For 11 years she has dedicated herself to the baking and selling of bread. At 4:00am she begins kneading the dough in the bakery and at 6:00am she situates herself in the park of her village with the basket of breads which she sells until 8:00am. She then returns home until 2:00pm to prepare food for and attend to her children, and begins anew to knead dough for the lunch hour (afternoon meal). She again situates herself in the park of her village until 7:00pm.

Despite being very tired from her work, Martha says she is very content because she enjoys selling and being in contact with the people. Every day she starts with a capital of 20 to 30 PEN with which she earns 50 or 60 PEN. She tells us of her joy for her business despite her difficulties in health due to constantly rising before dawn and working in the intense cold. One of her future goals is to buy a house where she could put a small store for selling various products and to leave the park and the cold, thereby capturing better income for her household and for the well-being of her children. This is her first loan with MFP which she commits to pay on time according to the payment plan established by the loan officer of her communal bank. The money that Martha asks for is to buy sacks of flour for baking her breads.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 46 años de edad, enviudó hace 9 años, y ahora vive con sus dos hijos y una nieta en una casa alquilada, donde tiene su negocio. Cuando estaba vivo su esposo, ella se dedicaba a la venta de comida y a la agricultura con el apoyo de peones, mientras que su pareja trabajaba de transportista de ruta interprovincial; por ello que Olga y su esposo solo iban a su chacra en los meses de la cosecha. Al fallecer su esposo dejó la agricultura y empezó a vender costales e hilos especiales para el empaque de papa, inició con este negocio debido a que en su zona hacia falta la venta de estos artículos. Olga se siente muy contenta, ya que es la pionera con su tienda y ya es muy conocida en este rubro.  Ahora se ha propuesto vender casacas y ropa gruesa para el frío, y otra de sus metas es comprar y vender artefactos eléctricos. Esta temporada escolar le es rentable, ya que de una prenda (para el uniforme escolar) que trae desde la capital la vende al crédito, lo que le permite en ganar el doble, y con estas ganancias comprará artefactos eléctricos. En cualquier tipo de negocio, Olga dice tener éxito. Es una cliente nueva de MFP, y todos están muy motivados por la conformación de este nuevo banco comunal, la han nombrado tesorera, e hizo el juramento de cumplir su cargo de acuerdo las exigencias establecidas; lo mismo que también hace el compromiso de realizar sus pagos en las fechas señaladas. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de casacas para dama y otras prendas, el pedido le llegará en los próximos días, y ya tiene todo listo para sus próximas entregas.
texts.en:
Olga is 46 years old, was widowed 9 years ago, and now lives with her 2 children and her granddaughter in a rented house, where she has her business. When she was living with her husband, she sold food and produce with the help of workers, while her husband was working as a driver; for that reason, Olga and her husband only went to their small farm during the harvesting season. When her husband died, she stopped selling produce and began selling bags and special thread for potato sacks, which she started because no one in her area was selling these goods. Olga is very happy, as she is a pioneer with her store and is already well-known for her line of work. Now she has decided to sell coats and warm clothing for cold weather, with the goal of also buying and selling electrical devices. This school year has been profitable for her, as some articles of clothing (for a school uniform) that she brought from the capital on credit have earned her double - and with this profit, she will buy electrical devices. In whatever type of business, Olga says she is successful. She is a new MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA) client, and everyone is very motivated by the creation of the new communal bank, where she has been named Treasurer, and where she has made an oath to successfully carry out her required duties; she is also committed to paying back her loans on time. With this money, she will purchase women's coats and other clothing. She will receive her shipment of goods in the next couple of days, and she is all ready to make her next deliveries.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying women's coats and clothing for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renew the license of motorcycle with sidecar and buy some materials for its repair

loans.name: Elemy

texts.en:
Elemy S. is a 45-year-old mother of six. She lives in San Jose, the capital of Antique Province on the island of Panay, “where the mountains meet the sea.” Her husband is a fisherman, and her children are all in school – one is in elementary school, four are in high school, and one is in college.

Elemy plans to use this loan to buy an engine and repair materials for the family's outrigger canoe, which is used for fishing. She will also buy a piglet. Elemy has been raising pigs for a number of years, which provides her family with additional income.

loans.use: To buy an engine and repair materials for the family's outrigger canoe, and a piglet

loans.name: Cadiao

texts.en:
R. Cadiao, a 42-year-old single mother, lives near the capital city of the province with her child, who is already a university graduate. She owns a video game shop, located in her relative’s house, paying 30% of her income as rent.

She is now requesting a loan to buy one more video game unit in order to better serve her customers and increase her income. R. dreams of having 10 video game units in the future and establishing her own shop in order to retain all of her income.

loans.use: To buy a video game unit for her business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion Y. is a 46-year-old married mother of three, two in high school and one a college graduate.  She and her husband earn their income by fishing, using small outrigger boats.  Salvacion is requesting this loan to buy a new boat and fishing nets and says her dream is to one day have her own house and a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a new outrigger boat and nets for fishing.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been a local alcohol cooker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for two years, working at her business for 10 hours everyday and earning an average monthly profit of $125. She belongs to the Majengo "A" street group loan (Group code 2001).

Grace is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Grace is 25 years old, single, and has two children, ages 7 and 2. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more items for alcohol preparation.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has been a local alcohol cooker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 2 years. She belongs to Majengo "A" street group loan (Group code 2001). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Veronica is 44 years old, divorced, and has three children: ages 24, 21 and 20.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has been a local alcohol cooker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 2 years. She belongs to Upendo group loan (Group code 2002). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 135. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Leah is 34 years old, married, and has six children: ages 18, 15, 12, 7, 5, and 1.

loans.use: To buy more items for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Enes

texts.en:
Enes has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 2 years. She belongs to Majengo "A" street group loan (Group code 2001). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, and pay school fees for her children.

Enes is married, and has eight children: ages 22, 19, 11, 10, 8, and one is only 4 months old.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester has been a local alcohol cooker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 12 years. She belongs to Ukombozi group loan (Group code 2003). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 300. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Ester is 43 years old, married, and has six children: ages 25, 23, 19, 16, 14, and 12.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Queen has been a businesswoman in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 232. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Queen is 33 years old, widowed, and has four children: ages 15, 13, 9, and 7.

loans.use: To buy more items for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia C. is 61-year-old married mother of five. Her husband and some of her sons drive a "tricycle," a small motorcycle with an attached sidecar that's used as a taxi to haul people and goods. Much of the family's household income comes from tricycle driving, but Cornelia also has a fish-vending business.

Cornelia plans to use most of the money from this loan to put a down payment on a motorbike and buy a sidecar for it, and will use the rest for her fish-selling venture.

Cornelia hopes to be able to provide for her children and their families. Her dream is to see all of her grandchildren attend college.

loans.use: To put a down payment on a motorcycle, buy a sidecar for the motorcycle, and to provide capital for fish vending

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Consolata has been a woman retailer in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for the past 2 years. She is a member of the Upendo group loan (Group code 2001). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.

Consolata is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy additional items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Consolata is married, and has two children: ages 25 and 20. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Tuninge, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her business.

loans.name: Majengo "a" Street Group

texts.en:
Shamimu has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for two years. She belongs to the Majengo "A" street group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more commodities for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Shamimu is 30 years old, married, and has two children: ages 6 and 2. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Lucia, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Majengo "a" Street Group

texts.en:
Jeni is a local alcohol cooker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $200. Every day she works at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Jeni is 45 years old, married, and has five children ranging in age from 13 to 20. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Temi, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for alcohol preparation

loans.name: Majengo "a" Street Group

texts.en:
Shida has been selling clothes in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for two years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175.  Everyday she works at her business for eight hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Shida is 32 years old, married, and has three children.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Fidelia, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is a 34 year old mother of three.  She is married to a farmer. She buys and resells bananas and vegetables to help her husband. 

She applied for a loan to buy pigs because she wants to apply the experience that she learned from her mother in raising pigs. She dreams of having a piggery in the future. She wants to help her husband send their children to school. She hopes that her three children, who are in preparatory and elementary school, will go to college. She also hopes that her family will be stable and to save money.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Majengo "a" Street Group

texts.en:
Sophia has been selling cosmetic items in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for two years. She is a member of the Majengo "A" Street Group loan (group code 2001).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $300. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cosmetics item for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Sophia is 27 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 and 6. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Prisca, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics items for her business.

loans.name: Roida

texts.en:
Roida has been selling food in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She is a member of the Amani loan group (group code 2005).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $185.  Everyday she works at her business for twelve hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items (rice, beans, onion, carrots and milk) for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Roida is married and has five children ages 32, 30, 28 and 26.

loans.use: To buy more food items (rice, beans,onion, carrots and milk) for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Tumpe

texts.en:
Tumpe has been selling beans and maize in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for four years. She belongs to the Amani group loan (group code 2005).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250.  Every day she works at her business for eight hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more beans and maize for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Tumpe is 45 years old, married, and has three children: ages 10, 14 and 16.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize for her business.

loans.name: Kissa

texts.en:
Kissa has been selling  cooking oil and maize in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She belongs to Amani group loan (Group code 2005).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $350. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cooking oil and maize for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Kissa  is 45 years old, married, and has five children: ages 22, 19, 18, 15, and 10.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and maize for her business

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina has been a retail woman in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 12 years. She belongs to Tushikamane group loan (Group code 2006).Every day she works at her business. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more commodities for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Edina is 42 years old, married, and has four children: ages 22, 18, 13 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is a 30-year-old single mother. She operates a variety store and a small restaurant. She is the one doing all the activities in her store. In her business ventures, she is happy to apply the expertise she learned from her mother since her childhood. 
She will use her loan to buy assorted soft drinks; half of the loan will be used for her restaurant. She hopes to expand her business in order to satisfy her customers who are students. 
She hopes to save money for her daughter’s education as well as their daily expenses. She wants to guarantee a secure future for her daughter even though she has no partner to help her.

loans.use: To buy assorted soft drinks and items for her restuarant.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores V. is a 51-year-old mother of six. Her husband drives a "tricycle" -- a motorcycle with a sidecar that's used as a taxi to transport people and goods -- and many of his passengers are students in their community. For extra income, Dolores and her husband also raise chickens.  Dolores plans to put the money from this loan towards the purchase of a new sidecar for her husband's tricycle.  In the future, she wants to be able to buy another tricycle, perhaps for one of her children to use. Dolores hopes to earn enough income to be able to send all of her children to college.

loans.use: To buy a sidecar for a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
This young man is applying to Kiva for his second loan. The first time, in January 2007, he applied for a loan of  $1000.  With that loan, he was able to improve his business and increase the number of his clients. He successfully repaid that loan.

Etibar  is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, Kilindjli village. He temporary lives with his family in the Khirdalan settlement. 

This man sells building materials. Now he is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to increase the variety of building materials that he sells. He has a lot of clients, and he does not want to loose them.  

“I am very thankfull to Kiva that they increased the loan size from $1200 to $3000. For a long time I was waiting for the day when Kiva would increase the loan size. It is the best news for me."

loans.use: To increase his supply of building materials

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
“I am very thankful to Kiva and Kiva lenders. With the help of Kiva lenders I improved my business. Thank you very much that you increase the loan size to $3000."

Vagif is applying to Kiva for a second loan. For the first loan amount, $1000, he applied to Kiva in January 2007. He repaid the loan successfully.

This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Agdam region. He settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has two children.

Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy office supplies, books and discs.
 
“I plan to do changing in my business. I don’t mean that I will change my business. No. I know that the people need the office supplies and the books, discs for education and that is why I want to buy discs with the programs and books for self-education for people.”

Vagif is sure that this way he can help people and attract more clients and get more income.

loans.use: To buy office supplies, books and discs

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en: Rafail is single and lives in the Khachmaz region, in the Ashagi-Zeyid village. He has been in the poultry business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy poultry for improving his poultry business.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Tofik

texts.en: Tofik is 47 years old. He lives in the town of Khachmaz. He is married and has three children. Five years ago, he started a cattle breeding business. Now, he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy five calves for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy five calves

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara is 50 years old. She lives in the town of Khachmaz. She has been in the tailoring business for ten years. Now, Gulnara needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy cloth to sew clothes.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sew clothes

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en: Reyhan is 43 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz. She is married and has two children. She sells nuts and fruits. Reyhan has five years of experiences in this business. Now, she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more nuts and fruits to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy nuts and fruits to sell

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Marcos V. es comerciante y empresario, tiene 45 años de edad es residente del Barrio Buenos Aires, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 12 años en los cuales a tenido mucho exito, logrando asi buena estabilidad economica para toda su familia.
tiene 6 empleados que le ayudan a la elaboracion y venta de los articulos.
el necesita un prestamo para la compra de materiales como ser tablas, lijas, pinturas, mazonite.
el sueño de el es tener una tienda comercial en donde el venda su producto.
texts.en:
Mister Marcos V. is a merchant and businessman, 45 years old, a resident of Buenos Aires, and has been doing his line of work for 12 years, during which he has had much success, achieving good economic stability for his family.

He has 6 employees that help with the production and sale of goods. He needs a loan to buy materials such as boards, sandpaper, paint and hardboard.

His dream is to have a commercial store where he can sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make furniture

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yessika Waleska

texts.es:
la joven Jessica C. tiene 23 años de edad y reside en el barrrio buenos aires de la ciudad de san lorenzo, esta casada y espera a su primer hijo, ella tiene una pulperia que heredo de su madre, este negocio lo posee desde hace 5 años .
su madre le esta ayudando con el negocio ya que no tiene quien le ayude cuando ella necesita descazar por su embarazo.
su sueño es que su hijo que lleva dentro salga bien en su parto y que sea un hombre de bien.
a ella le gusta mucho ver telenovelas.
texts.en:
Jessica C. is a young twenty-three-year-old woman who lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires in the city of San Lorenzo. She is married and expecting her first child. She owns a small grocery store which she inherited from her mother and has had for five years. Her mother is helping her with the business, as she has no one else to help her when she needs to rest from her pregancy. Her dream is that the child she bears is born healthy and becomes a good man. She likes to watch soap operas very much.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of soap, bread, crackers, batteries, bleach, soups, churros, sodas, dairy products, razors, toilet paper, beans, sugar, rice, lard, margarine, oil, cotton, pills, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso de 25 años, es soltero, vive aun en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus hermanos menores. Los recuerdos de su infancia son el labrado de la tierra, en aquellos tiempos sus padres realizan cultivos frutales de plátanos, naranjas, paltas, café, etc., donde él y sus hermanos, a pesar de su corta edad apoyaban en todos los trabajos, dejando de lado sus juegos de niño. En aquel entonces añoraba poder jugar con sus amiguitos en vez de estar en la chacra, pero ahora que ya es joven, dice haberle servido mucho porque es muy  responsable y trabajador, y sobre todo, ama sus actividades agrícolas.  En este tiempo Alfonso está tratando de independizarse económicamente de sus padres; por ello que ha sembrado piña en la chacra de su padre, aunque esta fruta resultada ser muy trabajosa y de mucha inversión, ya que constantemente se tiene que limpiar las chacras, de no ser así, la piña no desarrolla correctamente y si no se abona tampoco crecen de buen tamaño. Alfonso está esperando tener una buena producción para incrementar la siembra de café, porque sabe que los cafetales siempre son más rentables que los frutales. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y en este nuevo banco comunal le han nombrado presidente, por lo que ha juramentado en presencia de los demás integrantes, del mismo modo se ha comprometido en hacer sus pagos puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus piñas, que requieren de abonado cada tres meses, para que pueda producir en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Alfonso is twenty five years old, single, and still lives in his parents' home with his younger siblings. His childhood memories are of his work on the field. In those days, his parents cultivated fruit trees of bananas, oranges, avocados, coffee, etc., where he and his siblings, despite their young age, helped in all the jobs instead of playing child games. Back then, he yearned to play with his friends instead of being in the fields, but now that he's a young adult, he claims that it helped him very much because he is very responsible and hardworking, and above all, loves agricultural activites. Currently, Alfonso is trying to become financially independent from his parents, which is why he has planted pineapple in his father's farm. However, this fruit has proven to be very time consuming and requires much effort, as the fields need to be cleaned constantly, or else the pineapple does not grow correctly, and if they are not fertilized, they do not reach a good size either. Alfonso is waiting to have a good production in order to increase the coffee cultivation, because he knows that plantations of coffee trees are more profitable than fruit trees. This is his first loan with MFP, and he has been assigned as president of this new communal bank, for which he has taken an oath before the other members and committed to be punctual with his payments. The money he requests is for the purchase of fertilizers for his pineapples which require fertilization every three months in order to produce in larger numbers.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for his fruit trees

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 64 años de edad, es casado hace 45 años y padre de 6 hijos; actualmente vive con su esposa y su nieto en su casa. El es un agricultor de mucha trayectoria, junto con su esposa realizan los trabajos agrícolas, y en todo este tiempo ha acumulado muchas agallas y experiencia, conociendo los meses en que se debe cultivar y abonar. Desde entonces a llegado a la conclusión de que la siembra de piña es muy dificultosa, mientras que los platanales le resultan más fáciles. Pero lo que sí es muy  rentable, pero también laborioso es la siembra de café; Daniel no deja de sembrar este producto durante todo el año, invierte mucho, pero también gana, por lo cual se siente muy orgulloso de ser agricultor. Ahora está muy contento porque la chacra de café que había sembrado el año pasado ya está a punto de dar frutos, por ello que quiere realizar el abonado de sus plantas cafetaleras, para que las coseche a tiempo, para de ese modo tener una producción alternada y no le falte dinero para cubrir sus gastos familiares.
