Yuster works at her business eight hours a day, six days per week, and has one shop assistant. Yuster currently earns about $150 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to add more traditional African clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Yuster thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thereby enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To add more traditional African clothes.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena M. se ha dedicado a su negocio de pulpería siendo ella la propietaria el cual ha logrado surtir su pulpería con el propósito de mejorarla y llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. 

Ella ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones y para ello se ha apoyado en Ceprodel. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su inversión.
.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Magdalena M. makes her living running a local grocery store. As the owner, she has managed to stock her store, with the intention of improving it and of supporting her home. She has managed to improve her conditions and for this reason she has pursued Ceprodel's help. The reason that she puts her hope in Ceprodel is to receive a loan to purchase merchandise and in this way to get ahead in her business, which greatly needs your investment.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Mary Miyaniko from Mwanza. She is married and has two children between the ages of 10 and 12. Mary has been running a tailoring business since 2006. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides), and makes them into clothing, mainly for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Mary currently earns about $120 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy vitambaa, vitenge, and kanga. In the future, she plans to add more material to make more clothing for sale. Mary thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thereby enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials to make and sell traditional African clothing.

loans.name: Elvis Hamilton

texts.es:
El señor Elvis V. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a laborar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación supliendo las necesidades de su familia.
Se ha dedicado con ahínco a su actividad de ganadería y por este motivo es que ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere la compra de ganado como son los bueyes para proceder a su crianza ya que se ha dado cuenta que esta actividad ganadera le ayuda a salir adelante mejorando sus ingresos. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente en su municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.
texts.en:
With much effort, Mr. Elvis V. labors to sustain his house, supporting the needs of his family. He works eagerly farming cattle and for this reason he has turned to Ceprodel because he needs to purchase livestock such as oxen to continue breeding, since he has realized that livestock farming helps him to get ahead, improving his income. He will profit greatly from this loan in Managua's municipality of San Rafael del Sur.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Amana

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Amana J. from Mwanza. She is married and has four children between the ages of 27 and 35. Amana has been running a pharmacy shop since 2005. Her business sells a variety of medicines like Panadol, amoxyline, Diclopar, diclofenac, tetracycline, and anti-malarial medications. She works at her business eight hours a day, six days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Amana currently earns about $300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more medicines. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Amana thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thereby enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy medicines for a pharmacy business.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34 year old Happiness M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 13 years old. She is also responsible for supporting one dependent, adopted because his parents abandoned him. Happiness has been running a food shop since 2008. She sells cooking oil, rice, soda and salt and works at her business for 12 hours a day, 6 days a week. Happiness currently earns about 250USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar and soaps. In the future, she plans to open a second business. Happiness thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar and soap

loans.name: Arelis

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, Arelis R. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su actividad de agricultura ya que al ser padre de familia y responsable en el mantenimiento de su hogar debe proporcionar las condiciones necesarias para su familia.

La razón por la que el señor Arelis ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para la compra de insumos como lo son los herbicidas para la siembra de maíz y frijoles. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le otorgará el crédito y así saldrá adelante en su actividad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, Arelis R. works hard in agriculture. As he is the father of a family and responsible for the maintenance of his home he must provide the necessities for his family. The reason that Arelis has pursued Ceprodel's help is to purchase materials such as herbicides to plant corn and beans. It is for this reason that he confidently hopes that Ceprodel will grant him the loan and in this way he will get ahead in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural materials

loans.name: Maritza Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Maritza es una mujer dedicada a su familia como  a su negocio desde hace ocho años logro poner una pequeña venta de productos varios con dinero que le presto su familia y que luego presto a Afodenic para incrementar su negocio este es su sexto ciclo. Tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio  villa reconciliación con tres hijos de 1, 7,12 años de edad, su esposo trabaja junto con ella ya que gracias a sus estrategias y préstamo logro hacer de su pequeña venta una miscelánea donde vende variados productos que son del consumo diario de los clientes. Con esta solicitud quiere comprar productos de consumos diarios como pollo, carnes, embutidos, productos enlatados y otros para seguir fortaleciendo su inventario. A futuro es poder ayudar a sus hijos a que se formen profesionalmente, es por eso la dedicación de aumentar sus activos para poder apoyarlos en sus carreras ya que estudiar hoy en día es muy costoso y no desean privar a sus hijos de tan rico privilegio.
texts.en:
Maritza is a woman dedicated to her family as well as her business, which she has had for the past 8 years. She was able to open a small store where she sold various products with money she borrowed from her family, and later with money from Kiva partner Afodenic. This is her sixth cycle with Afodenic. She is 34 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood with her three children ages 1, 7 and 12, and her husband. Her husband works alongside her and thanks to their strategies and the loan, they were able to turn their small store into a general store that sells a variety of staple products to their customers. With the loan, she wants to buy staple products such as chicken, meats, milkshakes, canned products, and other products to strengthen her inventory. In the future, her goal is to help her children develop professionally, and for this reason she is dedicated to increasing her assets. She wants to support her children in their careers, as education today is very expensive and she doesn’t want to deprive her children of such a great privilege.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy staple products such as meat, chicken, milkshakes, and canned products

loans.name: Zaida Antonia

texts.es: La señora Zaida se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos desde hace siete años, inicio con dinero que Afodenic presto es por eso que da las gracias por que ha podido beneficiarse con sus préstamos. Tiene 30 años de edad, reside en villa Venezuela en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 16 años de edad, con la solicitud del préstamo es para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda ya que viene el invierno otra vez y desea que su familia este en mejores condiciones. Va  a repellar las paredes y hacer un intermedio para tener privacidad ya que ella tapa con una sabana donde duerme.  Sus meta es poder mejorar la infraestructura donde tiene su negocio para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zaida has sold clothes and shoes for the last seven years. She started with money from Afodnic, and she is very grateful to have had the benefit of their loans. She is 30, and she lives in Villa Venezuela in Managua. She has two children, ages 5 and 16. With this loan she will buy construction materials to improve her home. Now that it is winter again she would like for her family to have better living conditions. She will plaster her walls and build a partition where she now hangs a sheet so she has privacy where she sleeps. Her goal is to be able to improve the structure where she has her business so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to plaster walls and build partition

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria es una mujer trabajadora, logro poner una pulpería que desde hace ocho años administra, el cual comenzó con dinero que Afodenic presto, en su vida personal y en los negocios ha sido de muchos beneficios. Tiene 54 años de edad, reside en le barrio A gusto Cesar Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, con dos hijos que están mayores y trabajan, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de Enitel. Este es su octavo ciclo el cual  va invertir en la compra de productos varios como, lacteros, granos básicos, pollo y otros productos de consumo diarios que cubra las necesidades del cliente. Uno de sus anhelo es poder comprar un vehiculo para facilitar el acarreo de las comprar.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard worker who was able to open a mini-mart eight years ago with the money from a loan from Afondenic. This has greatly helped her business and personal life. She is 54 and lives in the Agusto Cesar Sandino neighorhood in Managua. She has two grown children who work. Her husband works for Enitel. This is her eighth loan. She will use the money to buy various products such as dairy, grains, chicken and other consumer goods to meet her customers' daily needs. One of her wishes is to be able to buy a vehicle to make it easier to transport her purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items for resale

loans.name: Isis De La Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Isis tiene 33 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua sabana grande con dos hijos de 5 y10 años de edad, se dedica ala venta de cócteles el inicio con ayuda de su esposo, con esta solicitud de préstamo quiere comprar mariscos como conchas, camarones, punche y otros para fortalecer las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es poder poner un cafetín, poder hacer su casa de concreto ya que es de madera y un poco insegura, también poder dar educación a sus dos hijos para que sean personas estudiadas.
texts.en:
Isis is 33 years old. She lives with her two children, ages 5 and 10, in the Sabana Grande neighborhood in Managua. She sells seafood cocktails, a business she started with help from her husband. With this loan she wants to buy seafood like conch, shrimp, crab and more in order to strengthen her sales and increase her income. Her plan is to be able to open a food stand. She then wants to replace the wood structure of her house with concrete because it is not now very sturdy. She would also like to give an education to her two children so that they can be educated people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various seafood items for resale

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: El señor Juan se dedica ala reparación de zapatos desde hace veinte años, el inicio desde muy joven, con dinero propio y cada día ha ido adquiriendo habilidades y clientela por su buen trabajo. Tiene 51 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles sur, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 14 y 15 años de edad. Su esposa lava y plancha a personas particulares para obtener ingresos para la alimentación de la familia. Sus planes de don Juan es terminar de construir su casa de concreto ya que tiene una parte de piedra y el resto es de tabla y zinc, lo que más desea es poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia. El ha ido poco a poco construyendo su casita con los prestamos que Afodenic ha otorgado este es su sexta solicitud que va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para seguir levantando las paredes de concreto. Sus objetivos captar más clientela, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cumplir sus anhelos.
texts.en:
Juan repairs shoes. He started very young, with his own money, and he has been doing this for twenty years. He is skillful, and he gets customers because of his good work. He is 51 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He and his wife have two children, ages 14 and 15. His wife washes and irons for private individuals to get money to feed the family. Juan plans to finish constructing his house with concrete. Now part of it is made of stone and the rest of boards and iron. What he wants most of all is to be able to have a decent home for his family. Little by little he has been building his house with loans from Afodenic. This is the sixth loan, which he will use to buy construction materials to continue putting up concrete walls. His objective is to get more customers to increase his income in order to reach his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to put up concrete walls on his house

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es: El señor Eustaquio F. C. y su esposa viven los dos solos en su casa, ya que sus hijos ya  han formado su  propia familia y cada quien vive en su casa.  Los señores dedican a la venta de ropa usada, zapatos y accesorios para el hogar, a esta actividad se dedican desde hace 14 años. Ellos fueron de las primeras personas que vendían pulga en una de las instalaciones frente a un centro comercial de esta misma ciudad. Ahora están solicitando un préstamo para comprar mas mercancía y así  su ingresos aumenten.
texts.en:
Eustaquio F. C. and his wife live alone in their house since their children are already raising their own families in their own houses. They have been selling used clothing, shoes, and household accessories for 14 years. They were the first people to sell like a flea market at one of the facilities in front of a mall in their city. Now they are requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise so they can earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for the business

loans.name: Ramiro Arnulfo

texts.es: Don Ramiro tiene un carro que lo trabaja de taxi en la capital de Managua, tiene 43 años de edad, y reside en unidad de propósito, su esposa se desempeña como cajera, sus hijos están independientes, el tiene cinco años de trabajar el taxi, la dificultad es que abecés recorre varios kilómetros para obtener pasajero y solo gasta combustible por que son días malos donde la gente no aborda la unidad, pero otros días son buenos, con esta solicitud va invertir en el mantenimiento del vehiculo para seguir brindando su servicio a sus clientes. Sus metas es poder comprar otra unidad y poder invertir en una finca que tiene.
texts.en:
Don Ramiro has a car which he uses as a taxi in the capital city of Managua. He is 43 years old and lives in the Unidad de Proposito area. His wife works as a cashier and his children are on their own. He has been working as a taxi driver for five years. At times he drives several kilometers before he gets passengers and on bad days when people do not need rides, he only wastes gas. However, other days are good. He will use this loan to maintain his vehicle so that he can continue servicing his customers. His goals are to be able to acquire another car and be able to invest in the farm that he owns.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for the maintenance of his car.

loans.name: Lenuel

texts.es: El Señor Lenuel P. Hernández tiene 57 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Lenuel tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Don Lenuel es el servicio de torno y soldadura. Hace más de diez años que tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad económica ya que los financiamientos han ayudado a crecer en su negocio por lo que anteriormente no poseía material para trabajar por lo tanto su mayor desafío mantener a su familia a pesar de la difícil situación económica. Los propósitos de Don Lenuel son de proporcionarles a sus clientes la mejor calidad en sus productos por lo que así sus clientes tendrían satisfacción. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de hierro, aluminio, chatarra y bronce para realizar sus productos. Sus deseos son de aumentar su negocio para proporcionarle  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 7.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Lenuel P. Hernández is 57 years old and is married. Lenuel has three children and all of them work. Lenuel has a lathe and soldering business. He has had the business for the past 10 years and the loans have helped him grow his business because before the loans, he didn’t have the material to work and his greatest challenge is maintaining his family despite the difficult economic situation. Lenuel’s goals are to give his clients the best quality products because this way his clients will be satisfied. This loan will be used for working capital to buy iron, aluminum, scrap iron, and bronze to make his products. He wants to expand his business to give his family a better quality of life. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto T. Gutiérrez tiene 63 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Todos sus hijos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica de Don Luis es los servicios de sastrería. Hace más de veintidós años que se dedica a esta actividad económica por lo que su negocio surgió por la falta de empleo con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos familiar y así ayudar a su esposa. Los propósitos de Don Luis son de obtener mas reconocimiento con la elaboración de sus trajes por lo que es cada día espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos y así ofertar a sus clientes lo mejor. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que con esto podría comprar los productos  necesarios como hilo, tela, tijeras y alfileres. Los deseos más grandes de Don Luis son de establecer un taller de costura para generar trabajos a personas que realmente lo necesiten. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto T. Gutiérrez is 63 years old and is married. All of his children work independently. Don Luis has a tailor’s shop. He has had the business for 22 years, and he began because he needed work and needed to contribute to the family expenses and in this way help his wife. Don Luis’s goals are to become more well-known for the production of his suits, for which he waits day after day to improve the quality of his products and offer his clients the best. This loan will be used as working capital so he can buy necessary products such as thread, fabric, scissors and pins. Don Luis’s greatest desires are to establish a dressmaking workshop to create jobs for those who really need them. He is requesting a loan for 10,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread, fabric, scissors and pins

loans.name: Sialofi

texts.en:
Sialofi M., 25, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the food, clothing, and crafts business. She sells to the village people and the general public five days per week. Her weekly net cash flow is 350 Tala (about $145).

This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Sialofi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy painting materials and carving tools for her handicrafts.

loans.use: To purchase painting materials and carving tools for handicrafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase adult and children's clothing, a mannequin, and sandals

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chorn S. is a 51-year-old villager in Prasat village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. He gets a small income from this plantation, which he uses to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Choup Sophat (pictured at left), breeds pigs, chickens, and ducks to earn income. The couple has one child, who is a laborer.

Mr. Chorn S. is requesting a loan to buy two cows, which will be used for breeding and for plowing the field.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and for plowing.

loans.name: Aide Nely

texts.es: La señora Aidé es ama de casa, su esposo labora para una empresa en los estados unidos con una antigüedad de 12 años, ella esta al cuidado de la familia, ellos son un matrimonio sólido y empeñado a salir adelante,están solicitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su casita para mayor seguridad del hogar.
texts.en:
Aidé is a housewife whose husband has been working for a company in the United States for 12 years. She is the caretaker of the family. They have a strong marriage and are determined to get ahead in life. They are requesting a loan for the construction of a fence in front of their small house to increase the security of their household.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a fence in front of their house

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora Norma llego a nuestra ciudad junto con su esposo el señor Carlos en busca de salir adelante y lo han logrado con la perseverancia y las ganas de luchar, el señor Carlos trabaja como chofer de una empresa y la señora Norma tiene su propio negocio de abarrotes, negocio el cual esta establecido desde hace mas de 2 años y es por lo que esta solicitando este crédito para invertir en el y obtener mas clientela.
texts.en:
Norma came to her city with her husband Carlos in search of being able to get ahead in life, which they have achieved with a lot of perseverance and determination. Carlos works as a driver of a company and Norma has her own grocery store business that she established over 2 years ago. For this, she is requesting a loan to invest in her store and get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem R. is a basket seller in Ang Ta Nou village in Takeo province. She is a 34-year-old widow with five children: one is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, two are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest is too young to work or study. Mrs. Sem R. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding, and she would like to use the rest of the money to buy a staircase for her house.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding and to buy a staircase for her house.

loans.name: Fidencia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Fidencia Guadalupe vive con su esposos el señor Jesús Angel, ella labora en una conocida plaza comercial como promotora, cuenta con una antigüedad de 1 año, por su parte el trabaja para una maquiladora como operador de línea, son una familia joven pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ya que son personas muy responsables. Acaban de recibir su casita y le quieren colocar las protecciones en las ventanas para mayor seguridad y es motivo por lo que están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fidencia Guadalupe lives with her husband Mr. Jesus Angel. She works in a busy shopping center as a salesperson. She has worked there for one year now. Her husband works for a factory on an assembly line. They are a young family but they have a strong desire to get ahead in life and they are very responsible. They just moved into their new home and they want to put bars on the windows to protect their home and themselves. This is the reason that they are asking for this loan.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put bars on the windows of her new home

loans.name: Ngaeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngaeth M. lives in Ampil village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Say Lyheng, are farmers who own a plot of land for the cultivation of both rice and vegetables. In their efforts to cultivate rice, they face some problems because their field is infertile and because the crops are being damaged by insects. Additionally, their field is far away from irrigation systems.

In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Ngaeth M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel, and she would like to use the rest of money to hire laborers to work on the field. She is 44 years old and the mother of seven children: two are employed in a garment factory, one is a car repairer, and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel, as well as hiring laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
La señora María Graciela es viuda y pensionada a parte cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, obtiene otros ingresos ya que tiene una tiendita de variedad, en ella vende collares, aretes y entre otras cosas también fritos con queso etc. 
Por tal motivo es que esta solicitando este crédito para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Graciela is a widow. She receives a pension and her children also help her with her expenses. She also depends on the income she receives from a small variety store that she has. In the store she sells necklaces, earrings and other things, like nachos. She is asking for a loan so that she will be able to invest the money in her business.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in store

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Mrs. Hum I. is a pig breeder in Ampil village in Kandal province. Her husband, Mr. Tom Khan, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for the cultivation of rice. He faces an obstacle in his plantation because he does not have enough money to cultivate rice. Thus, Mrs. Hum I. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, as well as to hire laborers to work on the field. She is the 59-year-old mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is a seamstress. She is 50 years old and has three children. Previously she engaged in mat weaving. She sells her mats to the village for Php 100.00 per piece. She has a very old sewing machine which she uses also to make dresses. She earns a reasonable profit from sewing clothes for the whole family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy a new sewing machine and repair her old one. She plans to teach her children to sew so that when they are older they could have an alternative source of income for their future families.

CEVI is a non-profit organization partnered with KIVA in the Phillippines. They help people start and have their own businesses. They provide their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help their business to grow.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and buy a new one

loans.name: Chantho

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantho C. lives in Angk village in the Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Horn Houy, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In their plantation, they have a problem because they do not have enough money to support their corn growing. Thus, Mrs. Chantho C. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn seeds to plow on the field. She would use the rest of the money to hire laborers to work in the field.

She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's lifestyle with this loan. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds and hire laborers

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mr. Sen S. lives in Ta Daul Pi village in the Kandal province. He is a rice miller. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell to earn more income.

He is a 62-year-old widower of two children, one of whom owns a rice mill while the other helps with the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Srei

texts.en: Mrs. Srei O. lives in Ta Daul Pi village in the Kandal province. She is a laborer who is a hard-working woman. She is a 46-year-old widow with five children, three of whom have different businesses while the others are attending the local school. Although they try to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. They also live in an old house which is flooded during the rainy season. In order to make the house better for living, Mrs. Srei O. decided to ask for a loan to buy soil to fill in her deep land.

loans.use: To buy soil to fill in her deep land that floods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds to grow on the field.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um I. was born in 1948 and she lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn her livI.. She now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which badly affects her crop. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the field. Mrs. Um I. is a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on her field.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeun Y. lives in Leap village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She now wants to start a business breeding pigs to earn more income to support her family. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy five piglets and pig food for her breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sean Pech, is a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Savoeun Y. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader, S., 39, is a mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. She is a widowed mother. She works in the massage center providing massage service. She has been in this service for more than two years. She gets good recognition from her manager very often because she works very hard. She is a manageable mother and a responsible neighbor.

She uses an old motorbike as her family's transportation but it is broken very often. S. is taking out a loan to buy a new motorbike for her work and for her family's transportation.

The other group members are: S., 24, who works in a hotel and is taking out a loan to buy more cooked ingredients for his wife's store; S., 30, who also works in the hotel, is applying for a loan to repair her motorbike for her transportation; and N., 23, who serves as a public cleaner and is taking out a loan to buy more cooking materials for selling Khmer noodles after her work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana A. is a rice grower. Her husband died from an illness, and she knows how hard it is to be alone especially with her two children to feed, clothe and educate. She is 48-years old and she hopes that someday she will see her children graduate from college and find a good paying jobs.

She is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy fertilizers and herbicides. She believes this loan will bring her a  good harvest. She is also looking for some other income possibilities to help her family.

CEVI gives her credit assistance, trainings and insurance and coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides for the farm

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby S. is engaged in rice farming. She is 28-years old and has three loving children. Her husband, Junifer S., is also a farmer. They work together to sustain the needs of their children. Their harvest is intended for the family consumption, and what is left over is sold to rice traders in their village. The farm is what Ruby depends on to feed, clothe and educate her family.

She is requesting a loan from CEVI which she will use to buy fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will greatly help Ruby improve her harvest and make it easier to pay for her family's daily needs.

CEVI continues to help people start and have their own business. They provide their clients not just credit assistance but trainings about business and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn A. grows rice on her farm. She is 41-years old and has four children. Her harvest helps her husband and her sustain their family. They earn a reasonable profit from rice farming to feed and clothe her family. She hopes to have her children graduate from college so when they are older they can have good jobs and be able to care for their future children.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and high quality rice seeds. The loan will help her increase her yield and better support her family and her children's education.

CEVI provides their clients the credit assistance that they need. They also give their clients trainings and insurance coverage to help them succeed in their business.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a 32-year old woman and blessed with 1 child. She runs a variety store with an auto-load section. She started her variety store through her initiative and knowledge of dealing with customers. 

Her business is growing in because the people in her neighborhood like her products and find what they need in her store. She is requesting a loan to use for additional capital to improve her store and her income.

She dreams to grow her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expand it to other places. She also supports her niece and hopes to help her finish her studies so she can find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a variety store and more autoloads

loans.name: Pablo Alfonso

texts.es:
El microempresario Pablo Alfonso R. es un hombre con mucho entusiasmo, energía, y fe.  Hace varios años, el trabajó en una de las panaderías más grande de Bluefields.  Después, trabajó como pescador por unos años, siempre trabajando por otras personas.   Siempre había querido su propio negocio.  Con su experiencia en la panadería, decidió de empezar con su propia panadería al nivel artesanal hace ocho meses.  

Cada tarde, él y algunos miembros de su familia hacen el pan para vender el próximo día.  Ahora hay demanda para pan redondo, como lo que se usa para hamburguesas.  Usan hornos artesanales, como se puede ver en este video donde Pablo está describiendo y demostrando el proceso que usa para cocinar el pan.  En realidad, son refrigeradoras viejas que Pablo ha modificado para usarlas como hornos, usando carbón para cocinar el pan.  Hacen el pan en la tarde, y cada mañana, menos los domingos, Pablo sale para llevar los panes a varias pulperías en todos los barrios de la ciudad de Bluefields.  

Pablo tiene 37 años y es padre de siete hijos.  Aunque él no pudo estudiar más que el primer año de primaria, todos de los cinco hijos que están a su cargo ahora están estudiando.  Él no puede leer ni escribir mucho, pero su negocio es uno familiar.  Su esposa, quien Pablo dice que es su mano derecha, le ayuda en la administración del negocio y él se la consulta en todas las decisiones económicas de la familia y del negocio.  

Este es el primer préstamo que Pablo ha pedido.  Lo va a invertir en los ingredientes que necesita para hacer el pan.  Específicamente, va a comprar 12 quintales de harina, 20 quintales de carbón, dos cajas de manteca, una libra de levadura, y un bidón de aceite.  

Pablo dice que quiere ampliar su negocio, pero sabe que tiene que aumentarlo paso a paso.  Finalmente, le gustaría tener algunas maquinas para poder aumentar su producción considerablemente.  Tiene muchos planes para el futuro, incluyendo haciendo más cantidades de pan y de más variedad.  Su sueño es para poder llegar a algo para su familia.  No solo piensa en su familia, pero también dice que le gustaría ayudar a más gente a través de contratando a otras personas para trabajar con su familia en el negocio.  En general, Pablo trabaja para llegar su familia más adelante.
texts.en:
Small-businessman Pablo Alfonso R. is a man with much enthusiasm, energy, and faith. A few years ago, he worked in one of the largest bakeries in Bluefields. After that, he worked as a fisherman for a few years, always working for other people. He had always wanted his own business. With his experience working in the bakery, he decided to open his own small bakery eight months ago. Every afternoon, he and a few members of his family make the bread to sell it the next day. Currently there is demand for round bread, like what is used for hamburgers. They use artisanal ovens, as you can see in the video, where Pablo is describing and showing the process for baking the bread. Actually, they are old refrigerators that Pablo has modified to use as ovens, which use charcoal for baking. They make the bread in the afternoon, and each morning, except on Sundays, Pablo takes it to small grocery stores in all of the neighborhoods of Bluefields. Pablo is 37 years old and is the father of seven children. Although he wasn’t able to study past the first year of primary school, all five of his children that are in his care are studying. He can’t read or write very much, but his business is a family one. His wife, who Pablo says is his right hand, helps him manage the business and he consults with her on all of the economic decisions for the family and the business. This is the first loan that Pablo has requested. He will invest it in the ingredients he needs for the bread. Specifically, he is going to buy twelve 100-pound sacks of flour, twenty 100-pound sacks of charcoal, two boxes of shortening, one pound of yeast, and one can of oil. Pablo says that he wants to expand his business, but he knows that he’ll have to grow it step by step. Finally he would like to have machines so that he could increase his production considerably. He has many plans for the future, including making a larger amount and variety of bread. His dream is to be able to make something of himself for his family. He doesn’t think just of his family; he also says he would like help more people by hiring them to work with his family in the business. In general, Pablo works to help is family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 12 100-pound sacks of flour, 20 100-pound sacks of charcoal, two boxes of shortening, one pound of yeast, and one can of oil

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet Y. is a rice grower. Everyday, she checks her farm, removes the weeds, works under the heat of the sun to ensure enough food for the family. She is 47-years old and has six children. Her husband, Leo Y., helps her  manage the farm. Their harvest is mainly for family use, and what is left over is sold at market for additional income.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers like Ammonium Nitrate, and Urea. She will also buy insecticides to ensure a good harvest form her farm. Juliet is also interested in finding other ways to earn income. She hopes to grow pigs in her backyard when she has the capital.

CEVI helps her sustains her business. CEVI provides her not only credit assistance but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, ammonium nitrate, urea and herbicides

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia E. is 36 years old, married and blessed with four children. She lives in Balite, Sagay, Camiguin in Southern Philippines. She engages in fishing and has a piggery. Most of her customers are in nearby villages and nearby islands. Every day, she works hard to provide the needs of the family.

She wants to buy some additional materials for her bangka (sailboat) and she needs the amount of PHP 11,000. If granted, this will her third loan with HSPFI, Kiva's partner.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for the sailboat (bangka)

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane D. owns a small parcel of farm land. She grows rice, which she sells to feed and clothe her family. She is 30 years old and has 3 children. She started her business using 1-hectare of land. Now that she has a 2-hectare farm, she continues to plant more rice for the future of her children.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy for fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds. The loan will truly help her increase her yield.

CEVI has always helped Mary Jane expand her rice farm business. She is provided with credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage to help her succeed in her endeavors.

loans.use: To buy for fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios A. is a rice grower. She is 57 years old and has 7 children. When her children are not busy in school, they help her at the farm. Aside from rice, she also grows vegetables in the backyard. They even raise chickens. When they don't have enough money to buy food, they cook their native chickens for the whole family to share.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and herbicide. From her wide experience in the farm, Remedios recognizes the importance of applying fertilizers and herbicide to ensure a quality harvest.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and own their own business. CEVI provides all their clients with credit assistance, as well as trainings and insurance coverage to make their businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is 37 years old married to Daisy M.. They are blessed with three children and live in Balite, Sagay, Camiguin in Southern Philippines. Samuel engages in fish vending. Being the father and head of the family, he strives hard to provide for his family's needs. Currently, all of his children are in school and his eldest is in fifth grade.

Samuel needs additional assistance amounting to PHP 11,000 in order to purchase fish and some aquatic food to sell. He wants to provide a good living to his family and send the children to school until they graduate college. This will be his third cycle with HSPFI, if his loan is granted.

loans.use: to purchase fish and aquatic food to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 56 years old, widowed, and blessed with four children. But even though she is widowed, she is still dreaming and hoping for the best for her family and business.

Isabel is engaged in fish vending. She sells fish in her neighborhood and in Dalipe (in the municipality of San Jose public market). Fish vending is an occupation she inherited from her mother. When Isabel was twenty years old, she started accompanying her mother to sell fish. She also owns a variety store, which is another source of income for the daily expenses of the family.

Isabel dreams that her business will expand and that she will have a place or stall in the San Jose public market. She hopes that her business could sustain the expenses of her children's studies and a future house renovation.

loans.use: To purchase 450 kls of fish.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. raises pigs. She said she likes having a pig business very much because she enjoys the work and earns a reasonable profit from it. She is 45 years old and single but still looking for a lucky guy to be her husband.

For 20 years, she worked as a purchaser in one of the restaurants in Davao that was owned by Chinese nationals. She was not happy about her job because she didn't receive enough compensation, so she went back to her village to manage the farm.

Jocelyn is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and pig feed. The loan will truly help her expand the business. It will also help her get started with a new business as she is interested in venturing into another line to augment her income.

CEVI provides their clients with credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage and has helped Jocelyn grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Johny

texts.en:
Johny C. raises pigs. He is 41 years old and has 2 children. He loves pigs and thinks that it is a very profitable business. His wife, Lorna C. helps manage their pig business. Together, they worked hard to provide their children with a good future. Aside from pigs, she also has a sari-sari store. She earns additional income from selling various goods in their village. People come to his store to buy their needs. With the profits from these businesses they feed, clothe and educate their family.

Johny is requesting a CEVI loan of Php 6,000. He will use the loan to buy piglets. Some of the loan also will be used to buy feed for his pigs. This loan will help him expand his business. 

CEVI has helped Johny get started with his business. He is provided with the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and resell

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry Clavete is 36 years old, married to Chona Clavete and blessed with 2 children. He lives in Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He owns a sari - sari (variety) store and and also a motorcycle transport business. As a father, he wants to provide for the needs of his family. Everyday, he strives hard to earn an income but it is not quite enough. That's why he wants to expand his store by applying a loan with HSPFI. He is requesting an amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase grocery items. This will be his 1st loan and if granted, he can start to improve their living conditions and be able to send his children to school.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Kry's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader is N., 21, is a father of a young child. He is married to Chinda, 22, who earns an income selling clothes in front of the garment factory. N. sells different kinds of clothes in the Phum Pheak Market and he has been in this business for more than two years. Because his shop is located in the busy market, he can earn a good income and provide a better standard of living for his family. He imports clothes from Vietnam in bulk, at a low price and resell them to his customers at a higher price. He always goes by bus or motor taxi which cost him to much. To help reduce travel expense and because of N. is now tired of taking buses and motor taxies, he is looking for a loan to buy a motorbike for his business and his family transportation. 

The other loan members are: S., 34, who serves as an electrical provider in the private sector is making a loan to renovate his house for his family. KimS., 30, who sells ice to the whole commune is making a loan to build a shop for her business. And S., 27, who owns a groceries shop is applying for a loan to buy more food supplies for her shop. They all live in the Siem Reap Province. S. was not available during the photograph so his wife, Sophy, is in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his business and his family transportation

loans.name: Johneth

texts.en:
Johneth U. is a resident of Balite, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old and happily married to Allan U.; they were blessed with 6 children. Johneth's husband is a fisherman, and fishing is the major source of income in the family. Because of her desire to help, Johneth is the one who goes to the market and sells all the catch of fish of her husband.

Due to a strong demand for fish in the village, she joined HSPFI's micro-finance program and was able to receive her first loan. As time passed, their business has improved. And now dried squid is in demand not just in their village, but also in nearby villages of the province. Johneth now needs PHP 7,000 to buy boxes of dried squid and be the one in their place who stocks it.

loans.use: to purchase  boxes of dried squid for re-sale

loans.name: Elflida

texts.en:
Elflida J. is a rice grower. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. She has been a farmer ever since she was a child. Now that she has a new family, she works very hard to provide her children a good future. She previously worked as an attendant in a small store. She was not happy about her job, so she wound up managing her own farm.

She is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy Brudon chemicals for her farm. Brudon is something that could enrich the soil. She believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest. In this way, she could contribute well to the family income.

CEVI provides people a chance to start their own businesses. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help them run their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase Brudon Chemicals and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario A., 43 years old, is married to Angelito A. and blessed with 5 children; she lives in Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province in Southern Philippines. Three of her children are in school. She is engaged in running a sari - sari (variety) store. Every day, she works hard to earn an income for the family but unfortunately it is not enough.

The store cannot provide enough money for their living; that's why she wants to add some stock to her store by applying for a loan with HSPFI. This will be her 1st loan and she needs the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase grocery items. If granted, this will be a big help to them to have a better living.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter Kalaga is 35 years old and married with 2 children. He has 10 years' experience in a hardware business. Peter requires a loan to purchase cement, paint, nails and iron sheets. His dream is to own a chain of hardware shops in various towns.

loans.use: To purchase cement, paint, nails and iron sheets.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
With her desire to increase the family income, Sheryl M. decided to start up a business. She is 25 years old and is presently residing at Balite, Sagay, Camiguin Province. Sheryl is a single parent and has 1 child to feed. She is very proud to be an entrepreneur in their village; she used to sell dried fish and dried squid. As of the moment, Sheryl buys and sells other products, because she doesn't have enough capital for this kind of business.

Now, she needs an additional capital amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase boxes of dried fish and squid and also to buy fresh fish. With the profit, Sheryl is planning to enroll in the Social Security System; for her family's health and security.

loans.use: to purchase  dried fish and squid for re-sale

loans.name: Bang

texts.en: Bang T. is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the Battambang province. She sells breads at the market and earns approximately US$3 per day. Her husband has operated a moto-taxi business since 2002 and he is able to make US$3.50 every day. This couple has two young children and both of them are in school. Bang T. would like to take out a loan to purchase breads to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase breads to sell.

loans.name: Saoly

texts.en: Mrs. Saoly M. lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Hort Sal, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In their vegetable growing, they face some problems because they do not have enough money to buy corn seed, pesticide or to plow and hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, Mrs. Saoly M. decided to ask for a loan for these purposes. She is 29 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy corn seed and pesticide, to plow the field, and to hire laborers

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S., 51, is married and lives in the Battambang province with her husband and six children. Since 1996, she has been selling fruits, vegetables and pork at the market to earn a living and is able to make US$20 in revenue per day. Her husband is an old person who stays at home. This couple is also supported by two of their children who work as construction workers, while the others are in school.

San S. would like to take out a loan to invest in her business by selling more fruits, vegetables and pork.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chhoam

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoam S., 45, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province, Cambodia. She sells soup and grocery products from her home and is able to make US$3 every day. Her husband, Soeun Rin, 53, is a motor-taxi driver. On average, he makes US$3 per day as well. This couple has three children; two of whom are students and one who is in security. Chhoam S. is asking for a loan to purchase beverages for sale.

loans.use: To purchase beverages for sale.

loans.name: Chhat

texts.en:
Chhat C., 28, lives in the Battambang province with his parents. He is single and works as a local teacher to earn a living. On average, he makes US$2 per day. His mother, pictured here, sells rice noodles and makes US$6 every day.

Chhat C. would like to take out a loan to make a new investment. He wants to purchase fruits so that his mother can sell them for additional profit to raise the family.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther M. is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She has 5 years experience in managing a retail shop. Esther is using the loan to purchase toiletries and foodstuffs. She dreams of transforming her retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase toiletries and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Samai

texts.en: Mrs. Samai C. was born in 1986 and lives in Ta Dork Pong village in Takeo province. Mrs. Samai C. is a widow with a child who is too young to work or study.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land she uses to cultivate rice.  Aside from this plantation, she is a tailor and a general seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more goods to sell to earn a larger income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sell

loans.name: En

texts.en:
En S. is 39 years old and resides in the Battambang province with her husband. She sells grocery items, CDs and VCDs. On average, she makes $7 every day, while her husband is a soldier doctor and earns $10 per day. This couple has two young children.

En S. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov S. is 48 years old and lives in Kvav village in Takeo province. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Yang Chanthon, is a farmer. Aside from tending his plantation, he is a cow breeder. Since his cattle business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Pov S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Dekpate

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de hanoukokpe qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle a pour activité principale la vente des serrures et des clés pour les maisons, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1994 et s’approvisionne dans les pays voisins du Ghana et du Benin, actuellement son stock est épuisé, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages un prêt pour augmenter ses activités avec 3 cartons de serrures, 02 cartons de tachettes et 7cartons de crochets. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
Dekpate D. lives the neighborhood of Hanoukpe, on the outskirts of the city of Lome. Her main business is selling keys and locks for houses and she has been doing this since 1994. Dekpate buys hers supplies in the neighboring countrys of Ghana and Benin. At present her inventory is depleted and this why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to increase her business by buying 3 cartons of locks, 2 cartons of latches and 7 cartons of catches. Dekpate is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy locks and latches for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more pigs to resell.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
A mother of six, Rhoda B. is 39 years old. She is married to Moisses B. and lives in Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province in Southern Philippines. She engages in buying and selling ready to wear (RTW) clothes. She purchases clothes and sells them with a low percentage of income. Every day, she works hard to meet the needs of the family but their income is not enough.

Now she needs an amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional clothes and earn a higher income. This will be her first loan with Kiva's partner HSPFI and, if granted, this will be a big help for them to have a good living.

loans.use: To purchase ready to wear (RTW) clothes to sell

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny L. is a villager in Kvav village in Takeo province. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Lun Sy, is a coconut seller. He now wants to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. In order to do this, Mrs. Ny L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her husband to breed.

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Ream R. is 29 years old and sells vegetables and fruits in the Battambang province. Her business has been around for about nine years and she makes $5 every day. Her husband is a promotions staff member and makes $3 per day.

Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to make two investments. She would like to both purchase a motorbike to transport fruits, and also put $500 into her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruits to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and a motorbike

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan R. is 40 years old. He is married with 4 children. Jonathan has 8 years'  experience in the textile business. He is using the loan to purchase more fabric. His dream is to  run a wholesale textile enterprise.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of  fabrics for re-sale

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou N., 43, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. To earn a living, she sells grocery products and vegetables in the market and is able to make US$ 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and makes US$ 3.50 every day. This couple has four children, three of whom are students and one who is employed as a waiter.

Sou N. would like to purchase rice and take off the husks with the intention of re-selling the rice and turning a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice to husk for sale

loans.name: Adjowa Egbe

texts.fr: Egbe est une femme mariée qui habite avec son mari et ses deux enfants le quartier d’adidogomé. Elle fait comme commerce la vente du bois de chauffage et parfois aussi du charbon de bois. Elle a déjà obtenu de wages un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Actuellement son stock de bois de chauffe est épuisé c’est pour cela qu’elle demande à wages un deuxième crédit afin de rehausser son stock et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Egbe is a married woman who lives with her husband and her two children in the Adidogomé neighborhood. Her business consists in selling firewood, and occasionally also charcoal. She already received a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, and it was repaid without problems. She's currently out of stock of firewood, this is why she's seeking a second loan in order to bolster her stock and meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mr. Vann U. lives in Chi Chreab village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. He is a 60 year old widower with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Mr. Vann U. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Knet

texts.en:
Knet K. is 39 years old and sells fish in Battambang province. She makes about US$ 8 per day and her husband helps her transport fish from the lake to sell at the market. This couple has five children, two of whom are construction workers and three are in school.

Mrs. Knet K. would like to take out a loan to purchase more fish to sell at the market. (She is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jeanneth

texts.en:
Jeanneth P., 26 and single, is a resident of Poblacion, Catarman, Camiguin Province. At her young age,she already feels the financial crisis in life. She finds ways and means to help her parents and her 3 brothers who are still studying.

Jeanneth ventured into running a sari-sari store (variety store) to address the needs of the villagers. She started her business with a small capital of her own. And now, she continues her dreams to be a leading sari-sari store in the village. With this goal in mind, Jeanneth needs to have an additional capital amounting to PHP 4000 to purchase grocery items for sale. She hopes that someday, out of her profit, she can have enough money for the renovation of their house.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mrs. Phally O. is a farmer in Chhkae Slab village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chhin Leang, is a policeman in the local district. Although they work hard, they still do not earn much income to support their family. So, Mrs. Phally O. has decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a kitchen for her family. She is 42 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a kitchen for her family.

loans.name: Chh

texts.en: Chh L. O., 25, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. She stays at home doing housework and her husband, pictured here, is a goldsmith making US$ 12 each day. Chh L. O. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase materials. She sees this purchase as a good investment to expand her husband’s business and she is confident it will increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase goldsmith's materials

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: M. kossi est un homme marié qui habite le quartier d’agbalépédogan, il a 03 enfants et sa femme est une revendeuse. Il a ouvert une boutique qu’il a appelé Ets M. Kossi dans laquelle il fait le commerce de pièces détachées. Il fait ce commerce depuis 2002 et c’est avec cette activité qu’il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Actuellement  il ne dispose pas de certaines pièces que ses clients demandent, il demande alors un crédit pour pouvoir acheter des pièces détachées.
texts.en:
M. Kossi is a married man who lives in the Agbalépédogan neighborhood. He has three children, and his wife is a reseller. In 2002, he opened a store called "Ets M. Kossi" where he sells spare parts. Since then, he has been running this business, which enables him to provide for his family. At this time, he's lacking some spare parts that his clients are looking for. He's therefore seeking a loan in order to be able to purchase these spare parts.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell spare parts

loans.name: Keuy

texts.en: Keuy S., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. She raises pigs and makes US$ 2.50 per day, while her husband sells fish making US$ 3 per day. This couple has two children and both of them are farmers. Keuy S. would like to take out a loan to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Vorei

texts.en: Vorei C. is 34 years old and lives with her husband in Battambang, Cambodia. She and her husband make and sell cakes at the market to earn approximately US$4 per day. They have four children and all of them are in school. Vorei C. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike so that she can use it as transportation and sometimes her husband can use it to operate a moto-taxi business to earn an extra income. (Her husband is pictured at home.)

loans.use: To operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.name: Akouvi Delali

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’adidogomé , elle a pour activité le commerce de charbons de bois en gros et en detail, actuellement son stock est presque fini c’est pour ça qu’elle demande un crédit pour s’approvisionner par l’achat des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood, and her business consists in wholesaling and retailing charcoal. At this time, she's almost out of stock, this is why she's seeking a loan in order to purchase sacks of charcoal. She's married and the mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: A. akoua est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle habite avec sa famille dans le quartier d’avédji un quartier de la ville de lomé , elle  a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale qu’elle fait depuis 2006. Actuellement la demande de sa clientèle est très élevée. Elle demande alors à wages son premier prêt pour rehausser son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
A. Akoua is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Avédji neighborhood, in the city of Lomé. Since 2006, her business has been consisting in selling staples. At this time, customer demand is very high. She's therefore seeking her first loan from Kiva's parter WAGES in order to bolster her stock.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell staples

loans.name: Amou Yawa Digbodi

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier de soviépé et a pour activité le commerce de charbons de bois et de céréales, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000, elle vend du charbons de bois en détail et en gros et parfois à crédit.étant seule dans sa zone, elle a une demande très elevée, elle voudrait par conséquent bien satisfaire sa clientèle. Ayant déjà obtenu un crédit de wages elle sollicite un second pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et de céréales. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est transitaire et elle a 03 enfants à charge.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Soviépé neighborhood, and since 2000, her business has been consisting in selling charcoal and cereals. She sells charcoal retail and wholesale, and sometimes on credit. As she runs the only business of this type in her area, she experiences very high customer demand. In order to meet such demand, she's seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to buy sacks of charcoal and cereals. She's married to a freight agent and has 3 children to support.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and cereals

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is engaged in hog farming. She grows pigs to support her family's needs. She loves pigs very much, that is why she invests a lot of money in this endeavor. She is 54 years old and has 5 children. Aside from pigs, she also owns a 3-hectare farm. The income from her harvest is what she uses to feed and clothe her family. When they have plenty of harvest, they sell some of their rice to the traders in their village.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 2 sacks of feed for her pigs and to start a new business. She knows that her loan will help her develop her pig business. It will also help her to start a new business.

CEVI provides all their clients with credit assistance. They also give their clients training and insurance coverage to help them to develop their businesses and alleviate their poverty.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of feed for the pigs and to start a new business.

loans.name: Kokatia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kokatia ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants  et  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans le village de Koumantou préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles font diverses activités qui vont de l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, à la vente de céréales et d’habits.
Ces femmes sont en partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 6 mois. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire). Le premier prêt a été correctement remboursé.
Les femmes du groupe Kokatia comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 100 kg d’oignons frais, 80 kg de poisson séché, un sac de sel de cuisine et des tissus. Elles s’approvisionnent en tissus et  en condiments alimentaires avec les forains venant de Sikasso. Les tissus sont   cousus pour faire des chemises destinées à la vente. Tous les achats sont faits en gros pour la vente au détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle riche et variée.
Les membres du groupe  Kokatia espèrent gagner en moyenne 30.000 FCFA par mois. Ce qui leurs permettra de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de contribuer aux  dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women in the Kokatia group average 40 years of age and 3 children. They live in large traditional families in the village of Koumantou, in the Bougni Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They run various businesses, ranging from buying and reselling food condiments, to selling cereals and clothing. These women entered into partnership with Kiva's partner Soro Yiriwaso six months ago. They are seeking their second group loan (solidarity loan), after having repaid the first one without problems.

The women in the Kokatia group intend to use this loan to buy 100 kg of fresh onions, 80 kg of dried fish, one sack of salt, and some fabrics. They get their food and fabric supplies from ambulant sellers from Sikasso. Fabrics are sewed to make shirts for selling. They buy wholesale and sell retail, for cash or on credit, to a rich and diverse clientele.

The members of the group hope to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 60), to be used to repay the loan and help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various items (onions, dried fish, salt, ...)

loans.name: Conscience Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Conscience, avec  en moyenne 23 ans et 3 enfants, vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou  préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région du Mali)
Ces femmes exercent essentiellement le commerce de condiments, de bijoux et de tissus.
Ce groupe est partenaire de Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans. Il est à son cinquième prêt solidaire et tous les  prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le présent prêt va servir à acheter, 100 kg d’oignons frais, 800 kg de gombo, 60 kg de pâte alimentaire, des bijoux (colliers pour le poignet et le cou) et des tissus. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments avec les commerçantes venant de Sikasso, en bijoux et tissus  auprès  des commerçants au grand marché de Bamako (capitale du Mali). 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune  en moyenne 40.000 FCFA par mois qui servira à rembourser l’échéance du prêt et satisfaire des dépenses de la famille (éducation, nourriture, habillement, santé…etc.)
texts.en:
The women of the group Conscience average 23 years of age and 3 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, in Bougouni prefecture (third region of Mali). These women essentially do commerce in condiments, jewelry, and cloth.

The group members have been partners with Soro Yiriwaso for three years and are on their fifth solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The current loan will serve to buy: 100 kg of fresh onions, 800 kg of okra, 60 kg of pasta, some jewelry (bracelets and necklaces), and some cloth. Supplies of condiments are gotten from merchants from Sikasso. The jewelry and cloth are gotten from merchants at the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of Mali).

The women each envision realizing 40,000 francs CFA on average per month that will serve to repay the loan and to meet family expenses (education, food, clothing, health...etc.)

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan C. is a rice grower. He is 31 years old and has 2 children. He dreams of having a farm to support the needs of his family. He wants all his children to graduate college so that when they are old, they have something to be proud about for their children, like a good job and other achievements. He has been a tenant farmer for 3 years now, but has never owned the farmland that he tills. Someday, he said, he will be able to buy his own farm to support his family's needs.

He is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy ammonium sulfate and other fertilizers. The loan will truly help Jonathan expand his business. He is also thinking of other possible income areas to augment his income. The loan will help him start a new business.

CEVI helps him sustains his family. Now, he enjoys having the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase ammonium sulfate and other fertilizers.

loans.name: Eléphant Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Éléphant (deux mariées et deux célibataires) avec une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans, un enfant, vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou préfecture de Bougouni  région de Sikasso.
Ces femmes font le commerce d’articles divers (charbon de bois, beurre de Karité, tissus, tasses, etc.). Après avoir correctement remboursé leur premier prêt de groupe, elles  sont à leur deuxième prêt qui servira à acheter, 800 sacs de charbon de bois, 100kg de beurre de karité, 200 pièces de pagnes et 200 mètres de tissus en provenance du Burkina Faso.
Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des paysans producteurs de Koumantou et des villages environnants, et des grossistes du grand marché de Bamako. Elles effectuent leurs ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs (venant des grandes villes) de femmes et d’hommes.
