Elles espèrent avoir en moyenne 40.000 FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice servira à rembourser l’échéance du prêt et une partie réinvestie dans le commerce (achat  de moutons, des céréales).
A  l’avenir les femmes veulent avoir des magasins de vente.
texts.en:
The women of the group Éléphant (made up of two women who are married and two who are not) average 23 years of age and one child each. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, in Bougouni prefecture in the Sikasso region. These women do commerce in various goods: charcoal, karité butter (from the shea nut), fabrics, tubs and basins, etc. After having correctly repaid their first group loan, they are on their second loan, which will serve to buy 800 sacks of charcoal, 100 kg of karité butter, 200 bolts of pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and 200 meters of fabrics from Burkina Faso.

The women acquire their supplies from rural producers of Koumantou, surrounding villages, and wholesalers at the grand marketplace of Bamako. Sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of retailers (from the big cities), women, and men.

The women hope to obtain 40,000 francs CFA on average per month. This profit will serve to repay the loan, and a portion will be reinvested in commerce (buying sheep and grain). In the future, they want to have some sales shops.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta F. is a farmer. She grows rice on her farm, the income from which she uses to feed and clothe her family. Her harvest is mainly intended for family use only. Sometimes, when she has plenty of harvest, she also sells rice to traders in their village. Her husband, Remegio F. is also a farmer. Together, they work hard to meet the needs of their children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. Her loan will definitely help her achieve a better yield. In that way, she will be able to give more support to her children.

CEVI helps Marieta run her farm business. Now, she is provided with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase ammonium fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en: Arvin D. lives in Poblacion, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 30 years old, and married with one child.His business started when balut (duck eggs) was in demand in their village. Arvin, together with his wife, work hand in hand to supply the needs of the family. At present, he is a balut distributor at Catarman, one of the most populated municipalities in Camiguin Province. Alvin wants to expand his business and be able to cater to the 5 municipalities of Camiguin Province. He joined HSPFI and was able to get his first loan, and now Alvin needs additional capital amounting to PHP 8,000, to purchase more trays of balut.

loans.use: To purchase more trays of balut.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a widowed mother of five who would like a loan to expand her businesses in order to make some small improvements in her life. After the death of both her husband and one of her children, Prudencia has been supporting her family on her firewood and her farming businesses.  
 
This is Prudencia’s tenth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 1998. She says firewood is always needed in her community and her farm always produces well, so her business is sure to be successful after this loan. 
 
With the profits from this loan, Prudencia plans to pay for her children's school fees and other educational needs.  She also intends to renovate her kitchen if possible. She hopes this loan will improve her and her family's standard of living. She prefers GHAPE loans because the conditions of the loans work well for her.
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, yarm seeds and materials for the construction of two rooms in her house.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat C. is 49 years old. She is married and the mother of two adorable children. Shahodat has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began her small business 11 years ago with financial support from her husband who is mechanic. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business she requests a loan of $ 900 US Dollars. Shahodat is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods for selling thus increasing the range of goods. She thanks everybody who decided to support her.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase goods for selling to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Iris

texts.ru: Ирис мужчина 47 лет , женат имеет шестерых детей.Жена домохозяйка,занимается домашними делами.Сам Ирис занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого скота, коров.У него сейчас 5 голов коров,из которых две дают жирное, хорошее молоко.Ему по бизнесу помогают его сыновья , которым 18-20 лет.Кроме этого они занимаются ремонтом домов на заказ.Для увеличения оборотного капитала бизнеса животноводства, Ирис решил получить кредит в Микроинвесте.
texts.en:
Iris is a man of 47 years of age, married and has six children. His wife is a housewife and does the household chores. Iris has a business of raising cattle such as cows and then reselling it. At this time he has five heads of cows two of which give good heavy milk. His sons help him with the business who are 18 and 20 years old. Besides this they also do repairs and remodel homes. To increase the working capital of his animal husbandry business Iris decided to get a loan from MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand animal hunsbandry business

loans.name: Normamad

texts.en:
Normamad is a farmer. He lives with his family, including his wife, 2 children that are school aged, and parents. His wife and elder son help him with caring for their land. In the past, they have had problems harvesting, having to sell their crop in advance with reduced earnings. Normamad has gained a lot of experience in his business and his crop is now one of the most demanded at the market. He now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow his crop. To solve this problem, he has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make his crop more productive.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, mineral fertilizer and cattle.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena Q. is a rice grower. She is 30 years old, and the farm is her life. Her parents are also farmers, so everything she knows about planting rice or crops is something she gets from her parents. Her family depends mainly on the quantity of their harvest. If they produce more, they have more income in the family, but if they produce less, they suffer. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to improve the quality of the soil in her farm. She believes this will improve her yield. Aside from rice, Rowena also tries to think of some other possible income areas where she could earn additional income for her family. "Good that I have CEVI who partners me in combating new challenges in my business", she said.

CEVI gives their clients a chance to expand their businesses. The clients are provided with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad H. is 44 years old. He is married with three children. Ahmad has been a farmer for the last seven years; it is his passion. He practices both dairy farming and mixed crop farming. He says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce from his farm has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing all of his land; this is because he used up all his proceeds from the last harvest to pay his children's (pictured) school fees and was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to sow his whole land. Ahmad is requesting a loan of $700 USD to be able to purchase the resources needed to plough the whole farm for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted fertilizer stock, seeds and also cattle. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is married and the father of 3 children. He is a farmer. Together with his wife (pictured) they grow potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers, work with which he is hopeful of making progress and providing what is necessary for his family that needs it. For that reason he wants to invest in his production, expand his crop fields and improve the quality of his products.

Abdurahmon knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Abdurahmon makes is to purchase the seeds and fertilizer necessary for his land. Support this hardworking father so his effort is worthwhile!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Jose  Ebe

texts.en:
Jose Ebe C. owns a small farm in their village. He is 37 years old and has 3 children. He has worked in the farm for almost 2 years already. His wife, Glenda C. helps him manage their farm. Aside from rice, they also grow other crops in their backyard. The harvest is what they use to buy their other needs. Because of their farm, it's now easier to feed and clothe their family.

Jose Ebe is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides and seeds for his farm. The loan will truly help him improve his yield. He is also interested in venturing into another line of business. Some of his loan will also be used to start a new livelihood.

CEVI provides their clients like Jose Ebe not just credit assistance. They also give training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase urea, Insecticide, and seeds

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
K. Rasul is dedicated to farming activities and has been engaged in this activity for 20 years. Presently he is the father of two children. He must continue providing them with the conditions necessary for their scholastic development. His reason for coming to IMON International is to obtain a loan with which he will buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops. Rasul and his family will benefit a lot from this loan, and so he is waiting for his request to be granted, and in this way he will have the financial capital to continue with his business in agriculture.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Saidullo

texts.ru: Сайдулло мужчина 43 лет , женат имеет пятерых детей.Жена работает в колхозе,на поле.Сам Сайдулло работает частным таксистом на собственной автомашине.Его доход хватает на минимальное проживание,поэтому он дополнительно со своими сыновьями занимается откормом и продажей скота. У них сейчас около 20 голов баранов.Сауйдулло узнав от своего друга о возможности получения кредита для увеличения бизнеса животноводства , решил обратится в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Saidullo is a man of 43 years of age, married and has five children. His wife works in a collective farm in the fields. Saidullo himself works as a taxi driver on his own car. His income is enough to cover minimal living expenses, and this is why he additionally has a business with his sons raising and reselling cattle. Right now they have around 20 heads of sheep. Saidullo found out from his friend about an opportunity to get a loan to increase his animal husbandry business and has decided to come to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase animal husbandry business

loans.name: Tursun

texts.en:
65-year-old Tursun is a farmer and married with five children. He has been a member of IMON International in Tajikistan since last year, and has used his loans to expand his farm. For more than 30 years, Tursun has been growing such crops as: wheat, watermelons, onions and other crops. With the loan he has recently applied for, Tursun intends to buy more seeds and fertilizer to invest in his crop. Tursun says he will use his experience to build a successful business and plans to hire at least two workers over the coming year. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Magdaline Mambo

texts.en:
Magdaline is a widow with six grown children. She and her son run a business in Douala, selling spare motor parts and cars. She plans use this loan to purchase parts from Japan in which she will sell in Cameroon for a profit.

This is Magdaline’s ninth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 1999. She has seen that her previous loans have realized good profits for her, so she intends to take this loan out in order to produce the same effect.

Magdaline has been a widow for 28 years; her husband died an early death, when the children were young. She has supported her family by farming cocoyams and now has the ability to share her entrepreneurial spirit with her son.

With the profits from this loan, Magdaline plans to support younger children in their education and try to start up another business. She enjoys taking out GHAPE loans because GHAPE has always shown her loyalty and interest in her development.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase cars and used Japanese motor parts.

loans.name: Guchimurod

texts.en:
Guchimurod is a 48-year-old married man and the father of 3 children. He is an experienced farmer. He grows vegetables and fruit on a piece of land next to his home. He needs the amount of 2000 Somoni. Guchimurod wants to expand his business further, as this will allow him to generate more revenue for his large family and therefore improve their livelihood. This is his first loan with IMON International. Guchimurod will invest his funds into the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур мужчина 34 лет , отец троих детей,женат.Жена работает продавщицей в сельском магазине.Сам Баходур работает в сельской школе ,учителем математики.Его заработная плата не хватает для прожиточного минимума,поэтому Баходур занимается продажей скота.Он каждые две недели ездит на рынок скота и перепродаёт скот, с чего имеет дополнительный доход для проживания.Для ремонта своего сарая Баходур хочет получить кредит, и на оставшуюся сумму хочет закупить корм.
texts.en:
Bahodur is a 34 year old man, married and the father of three children. His wife works as a salesperson in a town store. Bahodur himself teaches math in the town's school. His pay does not even cover a basic standard of living, so he also trades livestock. Every two weeks he goes to the livestock market to resell animals, which provides additional income for living expenses. Bahodur would like to obtain a loan to repair his barn, and buy feed with any leftover funds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of livestock

loans.name: Ural

texts.en:
Since he was very young, Ural has worked in farming. By way of this work, he succeeds in supporting his family, providing his little boy with the studies he deserves. The reason that he has applied to IMON International today is to get a loan with which to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing his crops. Ural hopes that he will be given a loan and that way he will succeed in his business and improve his living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Batsuh V. lives with her husband, two daughters and two sons in Tsetserleg city in Arkhangai province. One of the sons is a college student. All the other children work in the countryside. One of the children is unemployed and helps her mother’s business.

Batsuh's husband is a guard for the building of City Water Treatment Agency. In 2000, she started selling raw meat at the local market. In December 2001, she started taking loans from XacBank, Kiva's partner in Mongolia. The result has been very good and all the loans were paid back on time.

When she began the business, she only had a working capital of 50,000 tugrig (1 USD=1,5000 tugrig). Now it has increased to 600,000 tugrig. With the help of the loans, she has improved her family's living conditions and paid her son’s college tuition. She is entrepreneurial and good at what she does. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and help all her children to find jobs. In addition, she would like to have her own place to run the business. With this loan, she will buy raw meat for her business.

loans.use: To buy raw meat for re-sale

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en:
T. Otabek is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired fair experience in agriculture. Currently, he is very happy with his 4 children who are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more inputs: seeds and fertilizer for a good harvest and to take care of his children and his home.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Chia Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a mother of six children who runs a pharmacy and raises pigs. She lives in Ntasen, outside of GHAPE headquarters, where she has her pharmacy. She will use this loan to purchase medicine, poultry vaccines, and feed for her pigs.

This is Anna’s fourth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2003. This loan will not only help the community to have a convenient store, but it will help sustain her pharmacy, which gives them access to medical supplies and health care. Anna thinks her business is likely to succeed because she understands her business well and sees that her store is very popular, for its location is advantageous.

With her last loan, Anna was able to help pay her children’s school fees. She will use the profits from this loan to do the same. She will also use the profits for maintaining repairs on her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the education they provide her with.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of medicines for re-sale and pig feed

loans.name: Elzara

texts.en:
Elzara is a humble mother who, with much effort, works on her potato farm to later sell its agricultural products in the markets of the closest towns or to traders from the same area. Her responsibilities as a mother have encouraged her to pursue farming activities to continue growing the best vegetables in the area. However, she wants to increase her investment in agriculture and expand her farmland to improve the living standards of her beloved family. Let’s help this mother to keep working for the well-being of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Menglikul

texts.ru: Менгликул мужчина 37 лет , женат имеет четверых детей, работает в колхозе Уткансоя пастухом мелкого скота колхоза.Со своей работы Менгликул не получает денежной платы , а получает лишь продукты питания рассчитанные на год проживания.Поэтому Менгликул занимается откормом и продажей скота.Для получения кредита Менгликул обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Menglikul is a 37 year old man, married and with four children, who tends the sheep of the Utkansoy collective farm. He receives no salary for his work, only a year's worth of foodstuffs, so he also raises and sells cattle. He came to Microinvest to obtain a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of livestock

loans.name: Shakuntala

texts.en: Shakuntala is 57 years old and a new member of ASHI. She has been married for eight years and has been blessed with seven children. Four of them are college graduates and the others are still in school. Her first loan amounting to $125 will be her starting capital for vegetable vending and for buying and selling herbal medicines. Shakuntala will purchase a variety of vegetables to sell to customers in her neighborhood and in surrounding townships. She dreams that this business will expand so that she can open stalls in other places. Eventually she would like to build her own house where her family can live comfortably.

loans.use: To buy a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar C. lives with his wife, a daughter and a son in Tsetserleg, a city in Arkhangay province. His son works in the capital city, Ulaanbaatar, and the daughter is a college student. His wife helps to run his business. He has years of experience in making wooden products. In 2000, he started his business with revenue of 100,000 tugrig ($1 USD=1,500 tugrig). Currently, the revenue has increased to 2,000,000 tugrig. His business has already been well established in the market and has many individual and corporate customers. He is very skillful and his shop is well equipped. He focuses mostly on product quality. His loan history is very good. He would like to use this loan to purchase equipment and some raw materials. Ganbaatar is well respected locally for his business and for his hard work. In the future, he hopes to train apprentices in carpentry and to continue to provide good-quality wooden products for the city. He also hopes to have a larger place for his business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment, wood and other raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 40 years old, has been married for twenty-one years and has seven children, all of whom are going to school. Her husband is a mini-bus (jeepney) driver. Elsie used her savings to start a business in food vending. She manages it by cooking delicacies in front of their house. She sells around the area. She is also employed in vegetable vending for additional income. Elsie dreams of having a stall for her growing business. She wants her children to finish their studies and live in comfortable house.

loans.use: purchase additional ingredients used in food vending

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is engaged in food vending and tricycle service. She started this business by selling barbecue every afternoon in her back yard. She displays her menu in front of the house. She also accepts orders of rice cakes for additional income. 

Evelyn is 48 years old, married and a mother of four children. One child who is studying at college level is starting to have higher expenses at school. Evelyn dreams that this business will turn into a restaurant located in the municipal plaza. She also hopes that they will have their own house in the future and that her daughter will be able to finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and pay for tricycle registration

loans.name: Nergiy

texts.en: G. Nergui lives with her husband and two children in Tsetserleg city in Arkhangai province. The children are 11th grade students. Her husband runs a small carpenter business. In 2001, G. started selling raw meat in the local market. In 2003, she took her first loan from the bank. Since then, she has taken 15 loans from XacBank, Kiva's partner in Mongolia, and the result has been very good. She always pays back her loans on time. Since the bank loans began, she has significantly improved her family's standard of living. She is self-confident and good at attracting customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business and to have her own place. She would also like to branch out into surrounding small towns. G. started her business with 200,000 tugrig ($1 USD=1,570 tugrug) and it has now increased to 2,000,000-2,500,000 tugrig. Since the start, she managed to buy a small car and work equipment, and she built a small working space next to her home.  G. is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more meat for her business.

loans.use: to buy more meat for her business

loans.name: Sotibolul

texts.en:
A. Sotibolul lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan, where livestock is developed in general. He has been engaged in livestock for 15 years; he is skilled and has the appropriate knowledge that he uses in practice. Sotibolul also works on a collective farm, but it is seasonal work. Sotibolul has one cow, one bull and six rams. He dreams of having a big flock, so he applied to Kive for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months to purchase pedigree cows.

Sotibolul first applied to the MicroInvest loan programme in 2009, and he can already recommend himself as a serious client who trusts our loan procedure.

loans.use: To purchase pedigree cows

loans.name: Fuh Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married to Fuh Peter and together they have seven children, including two who are younger than 15 years of age. Patience has faced some major challenges in life, such as the ill health of her son, the death of her child when the child was about six months, and inadequate food and shelter. These problems made life difficult for Patience until she discovered GHAPE as a source of relief in the year 2003. She has taken and repaid four loans, and her repayments were done promptly.

With this loan, she plans to buy pig feed, piglets, a wheel barrow, and fertilizer. She is convinced this business will progress because she has experience in the business, she has a good business side, and she is trusted by her customers. Patience’s business will help her community by providing green vegetables and pork to them. She will use the profit from the loan to pay for her children's school fees and provide them with good clothing and shelter. Patience plans to start repayment at the forth month from the day of disbursement. She prefer to receive loans from GHAPE because of the training GHAPE offers before disbursing loans, and also because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and the alleviation of poverty through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase seedlings and piglets

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
K. Mavluda was born in 1960 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Mavluda works in Khujand, so she has to go to Khujand every day. She works in the local bazaar, where she trades in children wear. Mavluda likes her work and attends to it creatively. She is very polite and kind by nature.

Mavluda works with straight suppliers from China and brings assortments of goods from Istaravshan, where she goes twice a month. Mavluda is applying to Kiva for a business support loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months to use to import seasonal goods. Mavluda thanks Kiva for its support and wishes it all the best in the future.

loans.use: Import seasonal goods

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren A. is a widow who lives with her two daughters, two sons, and a grandson. The family lives in the city of Tsetserleg in Arhangay province. Her two sons work in the city of Darhan. One of her daughters stays at home to look after her child. The other daughter is an 11th grade student. Her children also help her to run her business.

In 2002, Purevsuren started her first shoe repair business. In 2004, she received her first loan from XacBank, Kiva's partner microfinance institution in Mongolia, and she has taken 11 loans since. With the loans, she has gotten some money to keep the business afloat and improve her life. After the first loan, Purevsuren was able to buy some furniture for her home with her profits. Her revenue has increased from 200,000 tugrig to 500,000 tugrig (USD 1=1,570 tugrig).

Purevsuren is open-minded and is good at talking to her customers. She has a good, business-oriented mind. In the future, she hopes to make sure that all her children have jobs and also to expand her business to a larger retail business. With this loan, she would like to purchase raw materials, such as needles, leather and equipment, for her shoe repair business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials, such as needles, leather and equipment

loans.name: Ortikboy

texts.ru:
Ортикбой мужчина 49 лет , отец шестерых детей,мастер по стройке домов.У Ортикбоя своя бригада, в которой он бригадир.Жена работает в колхозе.Ортикбой дополнительно занимается откормом и продажей скота.
Ортикбой хорошо разбирается в породистых баранах.У него сейчас около 30 баранов,которые все хорошей породы.Ортикбою по бизнесу помогают его семья,дети.В связи с дождями Ортикбой хочет получив кредит заменить крышу хлева ,где он держит свой скот.
texts.en:
Ortikboy is a 49 year old man, the father of six children, and a home construction specialist. Ortikboy is the leader of a construction team, and his wife works on a collective farm. He also raises and sells livestock on the side. Ortikboy is knowledgeable about purebred sheep. He has around 30 rams, which are all well bred. His family also helps with the business. Because of rain, Ortikboy wants to obtain a loan to replace the roof of the barn where the sheep are kept.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of livestock

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: K. Manzura first applied to MicroInvest in 2008, when she took a development loan for to stabilize her business in bijouterie selling. She brings it from China and sells it in the Panjshanbe bazaar. Manzura has worked with bijouterie for one year, and now she wants to widen her existing assortment and open a specialized trade outlet for sales. Manzura applied to Kiva for a business support loan of  3500 STJ to import Italian bijouterie because it’s the popular and modern good in Tajikistan.

loans.use: To import Italian bijouterie

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
Ikrom is a farmer who is not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of a family. He works hard raising his cattle, which he takes out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt this is not an easy task, but his love for his family gives the work reason and meaning. Currently Ikrom wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of cattle he owns, which, in the long run, will provide better financial income. If you support him, he will be forever grateful. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Bakhtiyorjon

texts.en:
Bakhtiyorjon is 24 years old and the father of two kids. He lives with his parents who are hugely helpful to him, above all on their farm. Bakhtiyorjon grows potatoes and raises livestock. He's been doing this difficult work since he was 20 years old. The thing that pleases him most is taking good care of his crops and animals since a good appearance might fetch a better price. Since his products, once in the market, are in high demand by his customers, he's right to take care. This is Bakhtiyorjon's first loan. He will use the funds to buy more cattle for expanding his animal caring business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Orabbiddin

texts.en: Orabbiddin M. is a young businessman who has been raising and selling cattle for 5 years. He brings livestock from Kyrgyzstan to sell in Tajikistan. To supplement his income, he also buys vegetables from collective farmers to trade at the local bazaar. Orabbiddin would like to use this Kiva loan to build a summer barn for his cows. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: summer cow barn building

loans.name: Neba Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a mother of five children who runs a sewing business, as well as selling beans and oil. She lives outside of GHAPE headquarters in Ntasen, where she also runs her business. She will use this loan to purchase sewing materials and foods such as conki beans, banket beans, palm oil, rice and fertilizer.

This is Zipporah’s fourth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2006. This loan would help bring more food to her community because she is closer to them than the market is. She believes that under these conditions her business will succeed.

Since her first loan, Zipporah has been able to buy a sewing machine and help pay for her children’s school fees. Now, with the profit from this loan, Zipporah intends to buy a plot of land. She appreciates receiving a loan from GHAPE, especially because it helps pay for things her family needs.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials and produce

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a very hard-working and diligent woman who takes pains to maintain the economic stability within her home. She plants potatoes, corn, and wheat in her fertile crop lands. Although many times the losses from climatic changes have been substantial, she perseveres in her work because there are also very good times. Fotima would like to acquire a larger quantity of chemical and natural fertilizers to raise the quality of her products.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.en:
Zulaikho is a humble mother who, with much effort, works on her land, growing apple trees and different vegetables to later sell in the markets of the closest towns or to traders from the same area. Her responsibilities as a mother have encouraged her to pursue farming activities to continue growing the best vegetables in the area. At the same time, she raises cattle with the help of her husband and children. Now Zulaikho wishes to expand her business and to buy more cattle to improve the living standards of her beloved family.

loans.use: Purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
M. Gulchehra lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married with four children. As with many rural women, she doesn't have a specialized education but she is experienced in livestock so she started taking care of home animals when she was a girl and helping her mother.

Today Gulchehra has her own family and owns livestock -- two cows and four rams. She makes milk and sour products and sells them in local bazaar. Gulchehra applies to Kiva for the business support loan of 1,200 STJ for six months to purchase special milk-making equipment. It will permit her to increase milk making and to use modern methods of milk making.

Gulshehra thanks Kiva for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: Purchase special milk-making equipment

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en:
Enhbold G. is 38 years old and has a family of four, including his wife, a son and a daughter. His 16-year-old son is a 9th-grade student in high school and his daughter is four years old and goes to a kindergarten.

Since 1998, he has been renting a small room located under a staircase in an apartment, where he runs a bike repair, rental and accessories business. As of today, he is still running his small bike business. Most of his customers are 10- to 15-year-olds and those people who use a bike as the main transportation means for their daily lives, such as for work.

The bike business does quite well during warm seasons. In 2008, he bought a small car with profits from his bike business and used it as a taxi in the city. He said that his life has improved since he started the taxi business.

His wife has also started contributing to the family business by continuing the bike business. As the warm season is approaching soon, they requested a loan to buy bike accessories for the bike shop. Enhbold and his wife's hopes are to live without economic dependence on anyone and to live every day to the fullest.

loans.use: To buy bike accessories for the bike shop

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret P. is currently in the business of selling eggs and bread. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Margret is 37 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tsolmonbaatar

texts.en: Tsolmonbaatar P. lives with his wife and two children in Tsetserleg city, located in the Arhangay province. His children both go to kindergarten. Although his family has its own piece of land, they live in their mother's home because of its close access to the local market. Together with his wife, Tsolmonbaatar sells second hand clothing and and also transports passengers from Tsetserleg city to Ulaanbaatar, the capital. In July 2008, Tsolmonbaatar and his wife bought a freight train cargo container for 3,000,000 tugrig ($1 USD=1,570 tugrig) and converted it into a bicycle repair shop. Their daily gross income is 15,000-25,000 tugrig and the profit ranges between 7,000-15,000 tugrig a day.  They have taken two loans from XacBank (Kiva's microfinance partner in Mongolia) and paid back both loans on time.  Tsolmonbaatar and his wife put a lot of heart into their business and they complement each other in this family activity.  In the near future, they hope to have their own piece of land located close to the local market. They also hope to build a larger repair shop.  The loan will be used to purchase repair accessories and welding materials.

loans.use: To purchase repair accessories and welding materials

loans.name: Borya

texts.en:
E. Borya is a 55-year-old man with a family of four. He lives with his wife and two children in Baganuur, a small town that is 200 km away from Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia). Although he receives government disability benefits, he launched a small shoe-repair shop with his wife in 1998.

With his first loan, he bought a shoe-sewing machine. As he is good at repairing shoes, he is usually busy with his customers. He runs his business in a shop he rents. His son works in a local company. His son lives with his wife in a ger (a traditional, nomadic form of housing tent) just next to his father's ger.

With his previous loan with Kiva's partner XacBank, E. bought furniture and necessities for his son to live independently in his ger with his wife. E.'s dream is "to have his own place for work." He likes to quote a Mongolian proverb that says, if one works hard, good destiny follows. He wants this loan to buy more shoe-repair supplies.

loans.use: To buy more shoe-repair supplies

loans.name: Fubu

texts.en:
P. is a father of eight children and raises pigs. He lives in Ntasen, outside of GHAPE headquarters. He will use this loan to purchase building materials for a new room he wishes to add on to his two-bedroom house.  
 
This is P.’s tenth loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2000. His past loans have been investments for his pig-raising business. The profits from those loans have helped him to send his children to school. This particular loan is for him to be able to complete the building of his house. He plans on contributing by providing labor and will use the loan to buy materials. 

While he has had many trials in his life, from the loss of a child to the death of his mother, P. continues to provide for his children and their needs. P. has been with GHAPE for almost a decade and continues to use them as a resource because he feels comfortable with “their ways.”
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Chaplain

texts.en:
Chaplain B. is currently in the business of selling bread at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Chaplain is 36 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house for rent

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en: Tumenbayar is 24 years old. He just moved out with his girlfriend from his parents' home, where he used to live with his father, mother, two sisters and a young brother. He now lives in a small rental room with his girlfriend. In 2007, he started a small retail business. With his sister, he went to Ereen, China (a border city) to buy cheap clothes and sold them at profit in his small rented space in the local market.  Since May 2008, he left the retail business to his sister and started a small photo-taking business in a small rented room. He takes photos for passport, IDs, and customized photos for school and college commencements. As the business slows down due to popularity of digital cameras for most families, he expanded his service by adding a computer, where he creates various cards such as invitation cards. He also types various documents in his computer for his customers. In addition, he added a small cellphone-service business, where he uploads songs and videos for cellphones. His business does well during anniversaries and wedding celebrations. He requested a loan to buy a decent-quality camera and printer. His dream is to have his own studio with excellent-quality computer and equipment.

loans.use: To buy a decent-quality camera and printer

loans.name: Nyiragicali

texts.en: Greetings from Rwamagana, Rwanda!  R. Nyiragicali is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company.  She owns a small shop in Rwamagana which is located in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.  She has owned the business for 29 years and employs three people to help her with its operation.  She works every day from 7:00am to 10:00pm and earns a profit of approximately 120,000 Rwandan Francs each month (240 USD).  She will use the loan to buy more stock of the items in her shop so that she can increase her sales.  With her profits, she intends to pay school fees, buy more food for her family, and reinvest in her business.  R. is 50 years old, married, and has five children aged 30, 28, 25, 19, and 7.  She also cares for three orphans, aged 20, 15, and 6.  Her income is supplemented by the shop which her husband owns and operates, earning approximately 70,000 Rwandan Francs each month.

loans.use: More stock of the items in her shop so that she can increase her sales

loans.name: Botezatu

texts.en: E. is 35 years old and has lived for more than 10 years in Balti, a town situated in the North of the country. He sells shoes at the sale market in Balti town. E. purchases the stock from wholesale stores and subsequently retails it at the market. He is helped a lot by his wife, because she is the seller of the footwear. Now E. wants to increase his stock of goods. This will allow him to have more sales and to earn more money in the future.

loans.use: to increase his stock of goods

loans.name: Aderina

texts.en:
Aderina A. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Aderina is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Slmb Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are the teachers of the S.L.M.B Primary School in Magburaka. S.L.M.B Primary school Maroc was built primarily for Quranic reading, but was later transformed to provide English and Arabic learning. Presently, there are 20 teachers in the school and 710 pupils. S.L.M.B has always succeeded in public exams (The National Primary School Examinations- NPSE) as well as sport.

This is the second loan S.L.M.B is requesting from Kiva through SMT. With a loan, some members of the staff will start small businesses while those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into them. Some of the staff members will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others will use it to pay for either their children's education or for themselves to pursue further studies, while the rest will use their loan for home building projects.

Fifty-two year old Alimany K. (back row, fourth from left) is the head teacher at the school. He was born in Roten, eight miles from the town of Magburaka. He is married with nine children who are in primary school, secondary school, and college. Alimany will use his loan to pay school fees for his children. Being able to pay his children’s school fees will make him a happy man.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Kolorita

texts.en:
Kolorita J. is 57 years old and is married with a husband who works in business. She has 4 children who all attend school. Kolorita currently sells sugar and alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand her business. With the extra profits attained through her loan she hopes to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. All are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To expand her business in order to build a shop

loans.name: Chiriuhin

texts.en:
Chiriuhin S. is a farmer who produces vegetables and fruits. Chiriuhin likes his job and enjoys meeting people and offering them his products. He thinks that the most important thing in his job is acquiring loyal customers. This principle has given him very good results. The business he runs is profitable and the loan he would like to obtain from Microinvest will help him continue his business.

Chiriuhin wishes to thank Microinvest and Kiva for assisting with this loan.

loans.use: To continue his vegetable and fruit business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Grace is 22 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Slmb Secondary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the S.L.M.B Secondary School, Magburaka. S.L.M.B. was established in 1961 by Alhaji Sorie Kanu to provide education for the people of Magburaka and for the propagation of Islam. Today, it has a total of 616 pupils with a staff of eighteen teachers and administrators. 

S.L.M.B Secondary School had never got a loan from SMT before.  They heard of SMT from colleagues in other schools who have benefited greatly from SMT’s services. They decided to form a group and send in an application to SMT requesting a loan after hearing these other success stories. With the loan, some of the staff members will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (although this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs.  And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system.

Fifty-seven year old David P. G. (second from Left) is the principal of the school.  He was born in Matotoka, eight miles from Magburaka town. He is married to two wives and has fifteen children – between the ages of two and twenty-six. He has been a principal for the past twenty-one years. With this loan, David will buy building materials. Mr. David will be very pleased to receive this loan as it will enable him to speedily complete his house building project.

loans.use: Buy house building materials.

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina N. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Perina is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is an accountant. She has 2 children and they both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand a bread-selling business

loans.name: Vitalie

texts.en: This is Vitalie C. and he is 36 years old. He sells all varieties of vegetables and fruits in the district. He has been doing this for the past two years, and has already seen that the sale of these products is very profitable as people need to buy them. Vitalie is a very diligent man in business and he is always willing to extend his activity. Now he wants to increase the sales of vegetables on the market and has bought 10 more hectares of arable land. He wants to develop the business and to increase his working capital with materials like digging tools, a plough, fuel, and seeds.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to increase the sales of vegetables on the market

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice L. is currently in the business of selling bread and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Joice is 19 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has no children.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

loans.use: Build a shop

loans.name: Fisticanu

texts.en: Fisticanu A. lives in Moldova's Calarasi district and has been a carpenter for more than five years. He works alone in a workshop that he built near his home, where he produces high-quality wood items, including tables, doors, windows, chairs and beds. He needs to increase working capital for his workshop, but wood is quite expensive. Microinvest issued a loan to this young carpenter in hopes that he will attract many clients in the future.

loans.use: Increase working capital for his workshop

loans.name: Paska

texts.en:
Paska E. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Paska is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a fire-brigade militant. She has three children, who all go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her beer-selling business and build a house for rental purposes

loans.name: Benevolent Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Benevolent Islamic Primary School, Magburaka. The school was built by the Benevolent Mission in 1986. It has a total of 14 staff members and 432 pupils. 

The Benevolent school staff will use their first loan from Kiva through SMT for a variety of purposes. Some will start a small business, while others will invest in their existing businesses.  As an example, John A.S. K. (2nd from right) is the Deputy Head Teacher of the school. John is married to a businesswoman and the two of them have two children together. To supplement his meager monthly salary, he sells local products like rice, palm-oil, pepper, etc. This loan will enable him to invest in his business. 

Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture; others will use their loan in home building projects. Some will pay for their children’s education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. With their monthly salaries, they will gradually repay their loan to SMT.

loans.use: Invest in Business

loans.name: Kadimala

texts.en: Kadimala R. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Kadimala is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a security guide. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.
